HM2 Ray's final act of heroism was to protect the patient he was treating. He threw himself upon the wounded marine, thus saving the man's life when an enemy grenade exploded nearby. By his determined and persevering actions, courageous spirit, and selfless devotion to the welfare of his marine comrades, HM2 Ray served to inspire the men of Battery D to heroic efforts in defeating the enemy. His conduct throughout was in keeping with the finest traditions of the U.S. Naval Service.”

“As a hospital corpsman, you are always very aware of the legacy that has been paved before your time. To be able to work in a facility named after one of the 23 hospital corpsman Medal of Honor recipients is a real honor and also very humbling,” stated Hutcheson.
column9: 美国华盛顿州埃弗雷特
column10: 对同名诊所的反思与尊重
column11: 海军医院二等兵大卫・R・雷今年已经76岁了。1969年3月19日，国会荣誉勋章获得者（死后）和海军医疗准备和训练部队（NMRTU）的同名人员埃弗雷特因其在越南共和国广南省安和附近的福禄6号战地中的行为而在战斗中被杀。过去了，但从未忘记。从52年前的那一天起，这位老人的遗产就体现在位于大卫・R・雷分支医疗诊所内的NMRTU埃弗雷特的工作人员身上，他们照顾着大海军基地埃弗雷特地区的合格受益人。对于驻扎在该诊所的医院医务人员来说，追随这样神圣的脚步具有象征意义。“我觉得在任何以某位前辈名字命名的地方工作都很有意义。知道你代表了一位为我们国家做出最大牺牲的人，每天走进来都能看到他们的照片和引文，我感到非常自豪。”医院二等兵埃米利奥・亚历杭德罗・卢戈（Emilio Alejandro Lugo）说，他是华盛顿土生土长的波尔斯波人，在海军服役的八年中，有两年被分配到该诊所。“在以荣誉勋章获得者医院医务人员的名字命名的设施内工作是非常重要的，因为它在穿着我们国家的衣服和帮助需要医疗保健的人时设定了最高标准。”来自亚利桑那州道格拉斯的医院三等兵克里斯托・珍妮特・萨莫拉（Crystal Jeanette Zamora）补充道，她在海军的四年中有三年一直驻扎在该诊所。诊所水手对雷的高度尊重甚至已经成为一种流动的尊重形式，远远超越了诊所。司令部的吉东已经成为pri的象征性来源特别是在目前的流感大流行期间，帮助阻止新冠病毒的传播。在雨雪中，在城市和农村背景下，在工作和下班时，诊所的医务人员携带并展示了guidon。萨莫拉感叹道：“与圭登号一起出游使我们能够以极大的自豪、荣誉和承诺来展示这些令人难以置信的特征，这将鼓励我们继承这一遗产。这种情感意义重大，值得注意，它展示了HM2大卫・R・雷号所表现出的勇敢、无私和英雄主义行为。”首席医院护卫员山姆・哈奇森（Sam Hutcheson）证实，NMRTU埃弗雷特水兵乘坐大卫・R・雷・吉登（David R.Ray guidon）进行各种远足是一种值得注意的方式，以显示HM2雷的记忆仍然健在。“我真的很幸运能被这么多才华横溢、积极进取的水手所包围。在准备和执行大卫・R・雷的自豪感和仰慕之情的过程中，我们的创造力达到了一个新的水平。能够在各种天气条件下进入我们周围的地区，并花一点时间来参考哈奇森来自佛罗里达州盖恩斯维尔，他在诊所工作了23年。他强调说：“选择他的牺牲，是我们能为一位英雄做的最起码的事情，这位英雄为他的国家和战友做出了最大的牺牲。他的遗产通过这些水手得以延续。他们为此感到无比自豪。”。“它显示了尊重那些曾经去过的人的遗产的价值。与GuoDon一起出去，比仅仅是蛋糕或其他东西要好得多，因为我们不仅仅是从中得到一些东西。我们走出去，在许多人认为不那么理想的天气的同时，坚持海军核心价值观来表现出对荣誉的承诺。”卢戈说，他欣然承认海军医疗队的收费标准以服务高于自我而闻名，而这一理念――以大卫・R・雷（David R Ray）为例――是鼓舞人心的。“我选择这一收费标准是因为这一传统，”卢戈继续说。“当人们问我在海军做什么时，我喜欢说我是一名护卫兵。每个退伍军人都知道护卫兵是什么，我们做什么，以及我们愿意履行的遗产。这一遗产也是一个伟大的激励工具，需要我们投入更多的工作。我们是海军中装饰率最高的，这是有原因的。”萨莫拉在自我激励之前证明了服务的传统。“这激励着我尽我所能去帮助那些需要帮助的人，帮助我身边的水手们。我被激励着像HM2 David R.Ray那样无私和始终关心他人。我希望这些特征能够传承下去，并对未来的医院医务人员产生这样的影响和作用。”作为一名高级应征领导人，哈奇森坦率地表示，自海军医院军成立以来，将服务置于自我之前一直是标准，雷就是这种特质的缩影。“我敢说，请阅读他的行动引文，尽量不要被激励。一切都是关于视角的。当你觉得今天很艰难的时候，只要想想在敌人的炮火下，在受伤时仍然从一个护墙到另一个护墙照顾受伤的海军陆战队，就有助于集中注意力。”哈奇森解释道，当被问到你会如何回应一个对海军一无所知的人，他好奇地问，“谁是HM2大卫・R・雷，”卢戈回答说，“除了荣誉勋章获得者，他还是一个来自田纳西州的孩子，他死的时候把海军陆战队的福利放在他自己的责任之前。因为他，其他人的儿子能够从越南的丛林中回家，当时服兵役不是自愿的。他们两人可能都不想去那里，而且两人都不想去可能已经死在那里了，但由于HM2 Ray的牺牲，他们中至少有一人回来了。现在，他激励未来几代医院的医务人员在最困难的时候保持同样的忠诚。”萨莫拉回答了同样的问题，“医院的医务人员费用是美国海军中最光荣、最有荣誉感的费用之一。大卫・R・雷（David R.Ray）的确切原因与此相似，因为他冒着生命危险超越职责范围，为海军陆战队提供援助，并在受伤的同时为一名患者牺牲自己的生命，表现出英雄行为。就是这样遗产和灵感，使成为一名医院医务人员变得如此光荣、有回报和无私。”“在安和附近的Phu Loc 6，第二营D连担任HM2时，表现出明显的英勇无畏，冒着生命危险，超出职责范围。清晨时分，估计有一个营大小的敌军对D连阵地发起了坚决的攻击，并成功地实施了pe铁丝网周围的网络。最初的敌人炮火爆发造成了海军陆战队的大量伤亡，他们在火箭和迫击炮攻击中立即使用榴弹炮。HM2射线在激烈的敌对火力下毫不气馁，从一个护墙移动到另一个护墙，为伤员提供了紧急医疗。尽管伤势严重在对一名海军陆战队伤员进行急救时受伤，他拒绝医疗救助，继续救生。当他包扎并试图安慰另一名受伤的海军陆战队士兵时，HM2 Ray被迫与两名攻击他的阵地的敌军士兵作战，一人死亡，一人受伤。他迅速失去了体力h由于伤势严重，他仍然设法在敌人炮火的冰雹中转移到其他伤亡者身上。他再次面临迎面而来的敌军的猛烈炮火，尽管存在严重的人身危险和不可逾越的困难，他还是成功地治疗了伤者并挡住了敌人，直到弹药耗尽这一次他受了致命伤。HM2 Ray最后的英勇行为是保护他正在治疗的病人。他将自己投靠在受伤的海军陆战队员身上，从而在附近一枚敌方手榴弹爆炸时救了这名男子的命。凭借他坚定和坚持不懈的行动、勇敢的精神以及对海军战友福利的无私奉献，HM2雷激励了D连的士兵们英勇地战胜敌人。他的行为始终符合美国海军服役的最优良传统。”哈奇森说：“作为一名医院护卫员，你总是非常清楚在你的时代之前已经铺好的遗产。能够在以23名医院护卫员荣誉勋章获得者之一命名的设施中工作是一种真正的荣誉，也是一种非常谦卑的荣誉。”。

column2: Coming Full Circle
column3:
RICHMOND, Va. - Born and raised in Burlington, New Jersey, a suburb of Philadelphia, Aviation Boatswain’s Mate Nevin Stevens grew up playing hockey and rooting for the Philadelphia Flyers, Phillies and 76’ers.

Upon graduation from high school, Stevens did not know what he wanted to do in life. What he did know however, was that college was not it. 

One day, and with no intention of joining the military, he drove a friend to a Navy recruiting station. As the saying goes, “The rest is history.”  

Stevens has been in the Navy for seven years. His first assignment had him operating, maintaining and performing maintenance on steam catapults, barricades and arresting gear aboard the aircraft carrier USS Harry S. Truman (CVN 75). 

His most recent two years have been spent as a recruiter at NRS Virginia Beach, part of Navy Talent Acquisition Group Richmond.

After buying a house in Virginia Beach, working for recruiting just made sense.

“I came from a divorced family and moved around a lot up until the age of 8 when I moved in with my father,” said Stevens. “I wanted to have a way to where my 5-year-old daughter and 1-year-old son could have a home to grow up in.” 

Making the decision to join the Navy at 18 was the best thing he could have done, said Stevens. He said without the Navy he would not have started a family nor would he have been able to provide for them the way he does. 

“My family is the reason why I have stayed in the Navy, for the simple fact of I love what I do and it’s a sense of security to be able to support them.”

There was a learning curve for Stevens on his transition to recruiting. Getting familiar with the different forms an applicant needs to join the Navy and the process of making initial contact with potential applicants were some of his challenges. 

He said he wasn’t the type of person to just approach people and strike up conversations.

“I usually go out prospecting with another recruiter so they can start the conversation, then I join in,” he said. “Or I find something I might have in common with the individual and talk about that. That puts us both more at ease.”

Despite the initial adjustments, Stevens has settled into recruiting just fine. In October 2020, for his outstanding efforts and accomplishments in recruiting, he was meritoriously promoted to the rank of first class petty officer, pay effective immediately.

Though the personal accolades are flattering, Stevens said being able to help people better their lives by joining the Navy is what really matters to him. When he gets calls from Sailors who have graduated boot camp, thanking him for mentoring them, that’s what makes it all worth it, said Stevens.  

“It doesn’t get any better than that,” Stevens said with a smile. “That, and giving people a chance to be a part of something bigger than themselves.”

Being able to spread Navy awareness to people who may not think the Navy is for them is a feeling that comes full circle for Stevens.  

From an 18-year-old kid offering a ride to a friend, to a Petty Officer 1st Class who now offers careers, what a difference seven years makes.

At the end of this year, Navy Recruiting Command will consist of a command headquarters, three Navy Recruiting Regions, 26 NTAGs and 64 Talent Acquisition Onboarding Centers (TAOCs) that will serve more than 1,000 recruiting stations around the world. Their mission is to attract the highest quality candidates to assure the ongoing success of America’s Navy.

For more news from Commander, Navy Recruiting Command, go to http://www.cnrc.navy.mil. Follow Navy Recruiting on Facebook (www.facebook.com/MyNAVYHR), Twitter (@USNRecruiter) and Instagram (@USNRecruiter).
column9: 美国弗吉尼亚州里士满
column10: 转一圈
column11: 里士满，弗吉尼亚州-出生和长大在新泽西州伯灵顿，费城郊区，航空水手长的伴侣内文・史蒂文斯从小打曲棍球，支持费城飞人队、费城人队和76人队。高中毕业后，史蒂文斯不知道他想在生活中做什么。然而，他知道的是，大学不是这样。有一天，他无意参军，开车送一个朋友去海军征兵站。俗话说，“剩下的就是历史了。”史蒂文斯已经在海军服役七年了。他的第一项任务是操作、维护和维护哈里・S・杜鲁门号航空母舰（CVN 75）上的蒸汽弹射器、路障和拦阻装置。他最近两年在海军人才收购集团里士满旗下的NRS弗吉尼亚海滩（NRS Virginia Beach）担任招聘人员。在弗吉尼亚海滩（Virginia Beach）买了一栋房子后，从事招聘工作是有意义的。“我来自一个离异的家庭，经常搬家，直到8岁时才和父亲住在一起，”史蒂文斯说。史蒂文斯说：“我想找到一条路，让我5岁的女儿和1岁的儿子有一个家可以在那里长大。”18岁时决定加入海军是他能做的最好的事情。他说，如果没有海军，他就不会组建家庭，也无法像现在这样养活他们。“我的家庭是我留在海军的原因，因为我热爱我所做的事情，能够支持他们是一种安全感。”史蒂文斯在过渡到征兵时有一段学习曲线。熟悉申请者加入海军所需的各种形式以及与潜在申请者进行初步接触的过程是他的一些挑战。他说，他不是那种只与人接触并展开对话的人。“我通常与另一位招聘人员一起出去寻找机会，这样他们就可以开始对话，然后我就加入进来，”他说。“或者我找到了一些我可能与这个人有共同点的东西，并就此进行讨论。这让我们双方都更轻松。”尽管最初进行了调整，史蒂文斯还是很好地适应了招聘。2020年10月，由于他在征兵方面的杰出努力和成就，他以优异的成绩晋升为一级士官，薪酬立即生效。尽管个人荣誉令人受宠若惊，史蒂文斯说，加入海军能够帮助人们改善生活对他来说才是真正重要的。史蒂文斯说，当他接到新兵训练营毕业的水手打来的电话，感谢他对他们的指导时，这就是一切值得的原因。“没有比这更好的了，”史蒂文斯笑着说。“这让人们有机会成为比自己更重要的事情的一部分。”能够将海军意识传播给那些可能认为海军不适合他们的人是史蒂文斯的一种感觉。从一个18岁的孩子给朋友搭便车，到一个现在提供职业生涯的一等士官，七年的变化是多么大。今年年底，海军招募司令部将由一个司令部、三个海军招募区、26个NTAG和64个人才获取入职中心（TAOC）组成这将为全球1000多个招聘站提供服务。他们的任务是吸引最优秀的候选人，以确保美国海军的持续成功。有关海军招募司令部指挥官的更多消息，请访问http://www.cnrc.navy.mil. 关注Facebook（www.Facebook.com/MyNAVYHR）、Twitter（@usncruiter）和Instagram（@usncruiter）上的海军招募。

column2: World War II Veteran Renews Bond with 1st Special Forces Group (Airborne) During 60th Anniversary Celebration
column3:
“I exercised this morning just like I have every day since I retired,” he told members of 1st Special Forces Group (Airborne) assembled to celebrate the unit’s 60th Anniversary. “I am humbled to meet such a great group of men. I feel like my experience in World War II inspired a lot of the development of how Special Forces now operates.”

Gutierrez served with the First Special Service Force (FSSF) during World War II, storming the beaches in Anzio, Italy, liberating southern France, and re-claiming Rome from the Nazis. He visited here to celebrate the 1st SFG (A)’s 60th Anniversary on June 24, 2017.

When 1st SFG (A) stood up in 1957, it drew its lineage from the First Special Service Force.

The FSSF was made up of 900 American and 900 Canadian volunteers who assembled in Helena, Mont., to answer the call for men of the highest physical prowess to fight in an unknown unit at an unknown location for an unknown operation. The men were trained in commando tactics that included mountain climbing, skiing, demolition, amphibious training, and hand-to-hand combat, using the historic V42 knife for close-quarters fighting. Nicknamed the “Devil’s Brigade” by German Soldiers for their fierce tactics and practice of wearing black boot polish on their faces, the unit excelled during nighttime raids.

By the time the war ended, the brigade had captured more than 30,000 prisoners, won five U.S. campaign stars and eight Canadian battle honors.

To celebrate and honor the influence of Gutierrez and his ilk, 1st SFG (A) chose to do something a little different than conducting an airborne operation or having a formal Dining Out. In the spirit of the men who came before them, the anniversary was celebrated with a strenuous round-robin training event featuring six stations. Each station featured a 1st SFG (A) veteran who quizzed current unit members about their lineage and history.

“We can benefit from the living history in our ranks,” said Col. Guillaume Beaurpere, the 1st SFG (A) commander. “Heroes like Eugene can teach us a lot about commitment and sacrifice.”

Gutierrez joined the Army in 1941 after his family was devastated during the Great Depression. “I had seven siblings and my dad lost his grocery business,” Gutierrez said. “My family needed me to help financially and the Army paid $40 a month.”

After graduating high school, Gutierrez enlisted in the Army, sending money back to his family and saving some for college. He figured that three years of service would pay for two years of college. Little did he know, he would find himself on multiple front lines during four years of service.

“When I went to enlist, I weighed two pounds under the minimum weight allowance,” Gutierrez explained. “At 118 pounds, the recruiter told me to go home and eat nothing but bananas and return the next day. He told me when I was full to eat even more bananas.”

Initially Gutierrez joined the Army Air Corps specializing in parachute rigging, and that road led him to the First Special Service Force.

In total, Gutierrez saw 240 days of combat from December 1943 to December 1944. On December 4, 1944, the First Special Service Force was terminated because there was trouble finding replacements for such an elite unit, and larger, division-size elements were needed to fight.

After the war, Gutierrez returned to Texas, marrying his wife Penny in 1951; the two are still married after 66 years. Gutierrez went into teaching, and retired as a school principal in 1990.

“You all are defending my freedom,” Gutierrez told the 1st SFG (A) Soldiers, “I wish you the best in the world.”

column9: 美国华盛顿州刘易斯-麦考德联合基地
column10: 二战退伍军人在60周年庆典期间与第一特种部队集团（空降）续约
column11: 他告诉聚集在一起庆祝部队成立60周年的第一特种部队（空降部队）的成员说：“我今天早上锻炼身体，就像我退休后每天一样。”。“我很荣幸能见到这么多人。我觉得我在第二次世界大战中的经历在很大程度上启发了特种部队目前运作方式的发展。”古铁雷斯在第二次世界大战期间与第一支特种部队（FSSF）一起服役，冲进意大利安齐奥的海滩，解放了法国南部，从纳粹手中夺回罗马。2017年6月24日，他来到这里庆祝第一届SFG（A）成立60周年。当第一届SFG（A）于1957年成立时，它从第一支特种部队中继承下来。FSSF由900名美国和900名加拿大志愿者组成，他们聚集在蒙大拿州的赫勒拿。，响应号召，让最有体力的人在未知的地点，在未知的单位里为未知的行动而战。这些人接受突击队战术训练，包括爬山、滑雪、爆破、两栖训练和肉搏战，使用历史悠久的V42刀进行近距离战斗。德军士兵以其凶猛的战术和在脸上涂黑鞋油的做法，给该部队起了“魔鬼旅”的绰号。该部队在夜间突袭中表现出色。战争结束时，该旅已俘获3万多名囚犯，赢得了五个美国战役明星和八个加拿大战役荣誉。为了庆祝和表彰古铁雷斯及其同僚的影响，第一SFG（A）选择了做一些与执行空降行动或正式外出就餐略有不同的事情。本着先驱者的精神，纪念活动以六个电台为特色，进行了艰苦的循环训练。每个车站都有一名第一SFG（a）老兵，他询问了当前部队成员的血统和历史。第一SFG（a）指挥官纪尧姆・博佩尔上校说：“我们可以从我们队伍中活生生的历史中获益。”。“像尤金这样的英雄可以教会我们很多关于承诺和牺牲的东西。”古铁雷斯在1941年加入军队，当时他的家庭在大萧条期间遭到毁灭。古铁雷斯说：“我有七个兄弟姐妹，我爸爸失去了他的杂货生意。”。“我的家人需要我提供经济帮助，军队每月支付40美元。”高中毕业后，古铁雷斯应征入伍，将钱寄回家人，并为上大学存了一些钱。他估计三年的服务费可以支付两年的大学学费。古铁雷斯解释说：“当我入伍时，我的体重低于最低限额两磅。”。“体重118磅的征兵员让我回家，只吃香蕉，第二天再回来。他告诉我，当我吃饱的时候，他可以吃更多的香蕉。”最初，古铁雷斯加入了陆军航空队，专攻降落伞装配，这条路把他带到了第一支特种部队。总之，从1943年12月到1944年12月，古铁雷斯经历了240天的战斗。1944年12月4日，第一支特种部队被终止，因为难以找到这样一支精锐部队的替代者，需要更大的师级部队作战；66年后，两人仍然结婚。古铁雷斯开始教书，1990年以校长的身份退休。“你们都在捍卫我的自由，”古铁雷斯对第一届SFG（a）士兵说，“我祝你们世界上一切顺利。”

column2: A1 shares proposed promotion changes with Peterson officers
column3:
PETERSON AIR FORCE BASE, Colo. C If you threw a salt water fish and a fresh water fish into the same tank, one would thrive and the other would struggle. 

Ever since the Air Force became a military service, officers in the line of the Air Force promotion category have been in the same tank when it comes to promotion. However, Air Force Manpower, Personnel and Services (A1) is proposing that officers be divided into separate tanks to give them the best chance to thrive within the conditions of their career field. 

Assistant Secretary of the Air Force for Manpower and Reserve Affairs Shon Manasco along with several other members of A1 and Air Force Personnel Center visited Peterson Air Force Base, Colorado, Tuesday to explain the proposed LAF promotion category reconfiguration and how it could affect the base’s officers. 

Col. Kelly Sams, senior military assistant to Manasco, explained that in the past there were members of more than 40 Air Force specialty codes competing against one another for promotions. With the new proposed system, those AFSCs would be divided into six tanks and officers would only compete for promotion against others in their respective category. 

“This initiative isn’t so much about fixing something that’s broken,” Sams said. “Rather it’s more about looking forward and embracing the opportunity to enhance the development of our officers of the future.” 

The proposed categories include air operations and special warfare, space operations, nuclear and missile operations, information warfare, combat support, and force modernization. 

“The line of the Air Force category has worked well and has produced the leaders that we have today,” Sams said. “However, the broad nature of this category with all of the specialties within has led officers down a similar development path. A path that has proven successful at promotion boards but may sometimes lead to sub-optimized development.”

Along with the promotion category reconfiguration, Sams said that career field managers across all AFSCs have been working to develop career field briefs that outline key experiences for each level within an AFSC and help define what Air Force leaders value and expect of their officers. Once completed, these briefs will be available to all officers on the MyPers website. 

“We don’t have a shortage of great officers,” Manasco said. “But think of how many more great officers we could have if there were a little more flexibility in that path.”
column9: 美国科罗拉多州斯普林斯
column10: A1与Peterson高级职员分享提议的晋升变动
column11: 科罗拉多州彼得森空军基地――如果你把一条咸水鱼和一条淡水鱼扔进同一个鱼缸，一条会茁壮成长，另一条会挣扎。自从空军成为兵役以来，空军晋升类别的军官在晋升方面一直处于同一个阵营。然而，空军人力、人事和服务部（A1）建议将军官分成不同的坦克，以使他们在其职业领域的条件下获得最佳发展机会。美国空军负责人力和预备役事务的助理秘书长肖恩・马纳斯科（Shon Manasco）与A1和空军人事中心的其他几名成员周二访问了科罗拉多州彼得森空军基地，解释拟议的LAF升级类别重组，以及这将如何影响该基地的军官。Manasco高级军事助理Kelly Sams上校解释说，过去有40多个空军专业代码的成员相互竞争晋升。根据新提议的系统，这些战地特种部队将分为六辆坦克，军官们只会与各自类别的其他坦克竞争晋升。萨姆斯说：“这项计划并不是为了修复一些坏掉的东西。”。“相反，这更多的是展望未来，抓住机遇，加强未来军官的发展。”拟议的类别包括空中作战和特种战、太空作战、核与导弹作战、信息战、作战支援和部队现代化。萨姆斯说：“空军类别的产品线运作良好，产生了我们今天的领导者。”。“然而，这一类别的广泛性质以及内部的所有专业，使警官们走上了类似的发展道路。这条道路在晋升董事会上被证明是成功的，但有时可能导致次级优化发展。”随着晋升类别的重新配置，Sams表示，所有空军司令部的职业领域经理一直在努力制定职业领域简报，概述空军司令部各级别的关键经验，并帮助确定空军领导人对军官的价值和期望。一旦完成，这些简报将在MyPers网站上提供给所有官员。马纳斯科说：“我们并不缺少优秀的军官。”。“但想想看，如果在这条道路上有多一点灵活性，我们还能拥有多少优秀的军官。”

column2: 45th FSS wins 6 AF-level A1 awards
column3:
The 45th Force Support Squadron earned six of the nine awards from the 2016 Air Force-Level A1 Awards.

The 45th FSS award-winning Airmen and organizations include the following: 

- Maj. Gen. Eugene L. Eubank Award for Best Force Support Squadron (Small Unit) 
- Senior Master Sgt. Randolph Livingston III:   Gen. Billy Boles Mentorship Award
- Airman and Family Readiness Program of the Year
- Food Operations Program of the Year
- Golf Program of the Year
- Resource Management Program of the Year

“This remarkable feat could not have been accomplished without the dedication to excellence from the men and women of the 45th FSS and the 45th Space Wing,” said Brig. Gen. Wayne Monteith, 45th Space Wing commander.  “Congratulations on your absolutely stellar performance, you've earned it!”
column6: PATRICK AIR FORCE BASE, FL, UNITED STATES
