column10: 第45届FSS获得6项AF A1级奖项
column11: 第45部队支援中队获得了2016年空军A1级奖励的九个奖项中的六个。第45 FSS获奖飞行员和组织包括：尤金・L・尤班克少将最佳部队支援中队奖（小型部队）-高级军士长伦道夫・利文斯顿三世：比利・博尔斯将军导师奖-年度飞行员和家庭准备计划-年度食品运营计划-年度高尔夫计划-年度资源管理计划第45空间联队指挥官韦恩・蒙蒂斯准将说：“如果没有第45空间联队和第45空间联队的男男女女们对卓越的奉献精神，这一非凡的成就是不可能实现的。祝贺你绝对出色的表现，你赢得了它！”

column2: March 2017 Chief’s Choice Award C Airman 1st Class Allison S. Block
column3:
Q1) Where is your hometown?
A1) Valdosta, GA.

Q2) How long have you been in the Air Force?
A2) 1 year.

Q3) How long have you been at Holloman?
A3) 5 months.

Q4) What squadron are you a part of, what is your job title and what are your duties?
A4) I am part of the 49th Force Support Squadron as a career development apprentice. I provide personnel program support to 4.1K active duty Airmen that span across three major commands, counsel on reenlistment/extension eligibility and provide program guidance on selective reenlistment/critical skills retention bonuses.

Q5) Name two of your long-term goals?
A5a) Obtain a Master’s in Education Degree. (wants to be a teacher someday)
A5b) Complete 20 years in the Air Force.

Q6) What are your off-duty interests and hobbies?
A6) Photography.

Q7) Who or what are your inspirations?
A7) God and my parents.

Nominating reason for selection:

Chief Master Sgt. Sarah Esparza, the 49th Force Support Squadron superintendent, selected Airman 1st Class Allison S. Block because she has provided customer service for 339 Airmen and processed 31 reenlistment and extension contracts which enabled $392,000 in Critical Skills Retention Bonus and Selective Reenlistment Bonus payouts. She tackled the clean-up of back-logged products and distributed 183 Career Job Reservation notifications across the wing. Her maturity, drive for knowledge and ability to learn quickly, proved that she is a vital asset to the team. She was selected as the alternate program manager for enlisted and officer promotions, which is uncommon for a brand new Airman in this career field. Block has also passed three Career Development Course pretests with an average score of 95 percent. She has contributed four hours to the Meals on Wheels program, distributing food to 12 members of the Alamogordo community and recently served as a judge for the Holloman Elementary School science fair.
column9: 美国新墨西哥州霍洛曼空军基地
column10: 2017年3月首席选择奖-飞行员一等艾利森s.布洛克
column11: Q1）你的家乡在哪里？A1）佐治亚州瓦尔多斯塔。Q2）你在空军服役多久？A2）1年。Q3）你在霍洛曼服役多久？A3）5个月。Q4）你是哪个中队的一员，你的职位是什么，你的职责是什么？A4）我是第49部队支援中队的一名职业发展学徒。我为4.1K现役飞行员提供人事计划支持，这些飞行员跨越三个主要司令部，就重新入伍/延期资格提供咨询，并就选择性重新入伍/关键技能保留奖金提供计划指导。Q5）说出你的两个长期目标？A5a）获得教育硕士学位。（希望有一天成为一名教师）A5b）在空军服役满20年。Q6）你的业余爱好和爱好是什么？A6）摄影。Q7）你的灵感来自谁？A7）上帝和我的父母。提名理由：陆军第49支援中队总监莎拉・埃斯帕扎少校，之所以选择艾莉森・布洛克（Allison S.Block）作为一等飞行员，是因为她为339名飞行员提供了客户服务，并处理了31份重新入伍和延期合同，从而获得了392000美元的关键技能保留奖金和选择性重新入伍奖金。她处理了备份产品的清理工作，并在整个部门分发了183份职业工作预约通知。她的成熟、求知欲和快速学习能力证明了她是团队的重要资产。她被选为应征和军官晋升的候补项目经理，这对于这个职业领域的全新飞行员来说是罕见的。布洛克还通过了三次职业发展课程前测，平均得分为95%。她为“车轮上的膳食”项目贡献了四个小时，向阿拉莫戈多社区的12名成员分发食物，最近还担任了霍洛曼小学科学展的评委。

column2: February 2017 Chief's Choice Award -- A1C Derek J. King
column3:
Q1) Where is your hometown?
A1) Brunswick, Ga.

Q2) How long have you been in the Air Force?
A2) 19 months.

Q3) How long have you been at Holloman?
A3) 4 Months. 

Q4) What squadron are you a part of, what is your job title and what are your duties?
A4) I am part of the 54th Aircraft Maintenance Squadron, 311th Aircraft Maintenance Unit an F-16 assistant dedicated crew chief. I am a front-line manager of a $24.9M F-16CG aircraft; prioritize, oversee, and execute aircraft specific maintenance strategy. I perform aircraft basic post-flight, pre-flight, thru-flight, walk around, end of runway and special inspections. I troubleshoot malfunctions, determine maintenance actions, ensure timely repairs and monitor the status of parts. I conduct ground handling, flying related tasks such as aircraft launch, recovery, tow and servicing; along with forms documentation.

Q5) What is your personal motto?
A5) “If you’re gonna do it, do it right.”

Q6) Name two of your long-term goals?
A6a) - Achieve a Bachelor’s Degree.
A6b) - Be a good leader in the United States Air Force.

Q7) What are your off-duty interests and hobbies?
A7) I enjoy playing sports and the guitar.

Q8) Who or what are your inspirations?
A8) My mother, she has sacrificed and worked hard to provide for my siblings and me. I strive to make her proud and to work as hard as she does.

Nominating reason for selection:

“A1C King is an amazing Airman and repeatedly sets the example for his peers,” said Senior Master Sgt. Brian James McRory, 311th Aircraft Munitions Unit assistant superintendent.
column6: HOLLOMAN AIR FORCE BASE, NM, UNITED STATES
column9: 美国新墨西哥州霍洛曼空军基地
column10: 2017年2月首席选择奖――A1C Derek J.King
column11: Q1）你的家乡在哪里？A1）佐治亚州不伦瑞克。Q2）你在空军服役多久？A2）19个月。Q3）你在霍洛曼服役多久？A3）4个月。Q4）你是哪个中队的一员，你的职位是什么，你的职责是什么？A4）我是第54飞机维修中队的一员，第311飞机维修队的一名F-16助理专职机组长。我是一架价值2490万美元的F-16CG飞机的一线经理；优先考虑、监督和执行飞机特定维修策略。我执行飞机的基本飞行后、飞行前、直飞、绕飞、跑道结束和特殊检查。我排除故障，确定维护措施，确保及时维修并监控零件状态。我执行地勤、飞行相关任务，如飞机发射、回收、牵引和维修；Q5）你的个人座右铭是什么？A5）“如果你要做，就要做好。”问6）说出你的两个长期目标？答6）获得学士学位。答6）成为美国空军的优秀领导者。问7）你下班后的兴趣和爱好是什么？答7）我喜欢运动和弹吉他。问8）你的灵感是谁或什么？答8）我的母亲，她为养活我和我的兄弟姐妹做出了牺牲并努力工作。我努力让她感到自豪，并像她一样努力工作。提名理由：“A1C King是一名出色的飞行员，多次为同龄人树立榜样，”第311航空弹药部队助理警司高级少校Brian James McRory说。

column2: Chief's Choice Award -- SrA Kelsey Joseph
column3:
Q1) Where is your hometown?
A1) Wolcott, Connecticut

Q2) How long have you been in the Air Force?
A2) Three years

Q3) How long have you been at Holloman?
A3) Two years

Q4) What squadron are you a part of, what is your job title and what are your duties?
A4) 49th Aircraft Maintenance Squadron, Aircraft Communication Maintenance Unit communication system journeyman. I inspect and maintain the ground control stations, and satellite communication equipment in support of the USAF’s largest Remotely Piloted Aircraft Formal Training Unit

Q5) What is your personal motto?
A5) In life, I do not believe any person deserves anything; You must work hard and earn the things you want and need.

Q6) Name two of your long-term goals?
A6a) Obtain a bachelor degree
A6b) Go to Officer Training School

Q7) What are your off-duty interests and hobbies?
A7) Staying active, hiking, my dog, nature, helping others, shooting (marksmanship), motorcycles, friends and family

Q8) Who or what are your inspirations?
A8) Grandfather and mother, people who help others selflessly, people who work hard and earn what they have, people who are optimistic, and people who bring family together

Nominating reason for selection:

CMSgt Seth L. Rector, Reaper AMU Superintendent

Senior Airman Joseph was part of a three-person team deployed to Duke Field, Eglin Air Force Base, FL, in support of Combat Hammer, which is the Air-to-Ground effort in the weapon system evaluation program. She was instrumental to the initial setup of a dual Global Communications System, two Ground Data Terminals and a Satellite Communication Earth Terminal Subsystem (SETTS) in less than a week. Specifically, she worked tirelessly to repair waveguides damaged during shipment. Despite the dire condition of the SETTS, her tenacity resulted in a complete refurbish and ensured the vital SATCOM link was ready for the first day of flying. The deployment was a resounding success, with 16 out of 16 targets sunk. As a result, 26 Weapons Squadron was able to refine MQ-9 Reaper maritime target engagement tactics, techniques, and procedures.
column9: 美国新墨西哥州霍洛曼空军基地
column10: 酋长选择奖――SrA Kelsey Joseph
column11: 问题1）你的家乡在哪里？A1）康涅狄格州沃尔科特问题2）你在空军服役多久了？A2）三年问题3）你在霍洛曼服役多久了？A3）两年问题4）你是哪个中队的一员，你的职位和职责是什么？A4）第49飞机维修中队，飞机通信维修单位通信系统熟练工。我检查并维护地面控制站和卫星通信设备，以支持美国空军最大的遥控飞机正式训练部队。你的个人座右铭是什么？在生活中，我不相信任何人值得任何东西；你必须努力工作，获得你想要和需要的东西。Q6）说出你的两个长期目标？A6a）获得学士学位6b）上军官培训学校Q7）你下班后的兴趣和爱好是什么？A7）保持活跃、徒步旅行、我的狗、大自然、帮助他人、射击（射击）、摩托车、，朋友和家人Q8）你的灵感来自谁或什么？A8）祖父和母亲，无私地帮助他人的人，努力工作并挣到他们所拥有的东西的人，乐观的人，以及让家人团聚的人提名理由：CMSgt Seth L.Rector，收割者AMU主管高级飞行员Joseph是部署到佛罗里达州埃格林空军基地杜克菲尔德的一个三人小组的成员，以支持战斗锤，这是武器系统评估计划中的空对地工作。在不到一周的时间里，她帮助建立了一个双全球通信系统、两个地面数据终端和一个卫星通信地球终端子系统（SETTS）。特别是，她不遗余力地修复运输过程中损坏的波导管。尽管SETTS的状况非常糟糕，但她的顽强精神导致了一次彻底的整修，并确保了至关重要的卫星通信链路在飞行的第一天就做好了准备。这次部署非常成功，16个目标中有16个被击沉。结果，26个武器中队得以改进MQ-9“收割者”海上目标交战战术、技术和程序。

column2: January 2017 Chief’s Choice Award -- A1C Earnest Trueblood
column3:
Q1) Where is your hometown?
A1) Browns Mills, New Jersey.  It’s famous for its lush forests and the haunted Red Feather Trail.  

Q2) How long have you been in the Air Force?
A2) Nine months.  I joined because I was looking for stability, and I wanted to get money for college.  

Q3) How long have you been at Holloman?
A3) Seven months.  I love the mountains, meeting new people and traveling around the local area.

Q4) What squadron are you a part of, what is your job title and what are your duties?
A4) I am part of the 49th Wing Judge Advocate office. My job title is military justice paralegal. I process the logistics of court martial actions and Article 15’s. I like to bring a ‘can do’ attitude of perseverance to the fight.

Q5) What is your personal motto?
A5) Keep on trucking!  

Q6) Name two of your long-term goals?
A6a) Be the best Airman I can be.
A6b) Have a family and make them happy.

Q7) What are your off-duty interests and hobbies?
A7) Playing baseball, playing video games, and spending time with friends and family.

Q8) Who or what are your inspirations?
A8) My family, in particular my parents, because I have watched them survive some tough times so I could live a nice life.  

Nominating reason for selection:

“I nominated Airman 1st Class Trueblood for his outstanding performance and legal support,” said Chief Master Sgt. Barrington Bartlett, the 49th Wing command chief.
column9: 美国新墨西哥州霍洛曼空军基地
column10: 2017年1月首席选择奖――A1C诚挚的特鲁布拉德
column11: Q1）你的家乡在哪里？A1）新泽西州的布朗・米尔斯。它以茂密的森林和闹鬼的红色羽毛小道而闻名。你在空军服役多久了？九个月了。我加入是因为我希望稳定，我想为上大学挣钱。Q3）你在霍洛曼待了多久？A3）七个月。我喜欢山区，喜欢结识新朋友，喜欢在当地旅行。Q4）你是哪个中队的一员，你的职位是什么，你的职责是什么？A4）我是第49翼法官辩护律师办公室的一员。我的职位是军事司法助理。我处理军事法庭行动和第15条的后勤。我喜欢在战斗中表现出“能干”的毅力。Q5）你的个人座右铭是什么？A5）继续开卡车！问6）说出你的两个长期目标？答6a）做我能做的最好的飞行员。答6b）有一个家庭，让他们快乐。问7）你下班后的兴趣和爱好是什么？答7）打棒球，玩电子游戏，和朋友和家人在一起。问8）你的灵感是谁或什么？答8）我的家人，特别是我的父母，因为我看着他们度过了一些艰难的时刻，所以我可以过上美好的生活。提名理由：“我提名特鲁布拉德一级飞行员是因为他的出色表现和法律支持，”第49联队司令部长官巴林顿・巴特利特上士说。

column2: Team MPS, getting it right
column3:
The 341st Force Support Squadron military personnel section received the 2015 A1 Gerrit D. Foster, Jr. Outstanding Military Personnel Program Award.

This is an Air Force level award focused on team or program performance determined by outstanding contributions and commitment to excellence in serving Airmen and their families.

Malmstrom has won the award for the second time in three years.

“The Gerrit D. Foster, Jr. Award recognizes the best MPS in the Air Force,” said Ken Sylva, 341st FSS military personnel section chief. “It validates the hard work our team puts forward, and affirms Malmstrom is getting the best personnel service the Air Force has to offer. MPS takes care of personnel business so Airmen can focus on their primary jobs. That’s a win for whole team.”

According to Sylva, MPS submitted a package of achievements to compete against 82 other bases and came out victorious.

“The success is due to the team’s understanding of their role in the wing mission, and an environment where people are free to innovate,” said Sylva. 

There are a number of factors involved when gauging the success of an MPS. Malmstrom consistently rated near best in every category in 2015.  

MPS knocked the competition out of the park by successfully and efficiently handling the most important pieces of information in an Airman’s personnel records including personnel reliability program requirements, permanent change of station processes and handling duty orders.

Malmstrom also took charge of the assignment incentive pay system by accomplishing a 96 percent completion rate only one month into the program’s inception. This program not only critically impacted the 341st Missile Wing but the nuclear enterprise as well by improving force conditions for missile maintainers and security forces Airmen with special duty assignment incentive pay due to field deployments.

The Air Force goal for MPS is to have an 80 percent timeliness competition rate.

Malmstrom achieved 98 percent.

For Malmstrom’s MPS of approximately 20 Airmen, this win is becoming a trend.

“We have a very young crew of 23 members over here, not just in age, but in experience,” said Sylva. “Our Airmen are stepping outside of themselves and using their motivation to provide Malmstrom in a positive and impactful way.” 

At the 341st MW, the MPS is comprised of three sub-sections including customer service, force management and career development. 

These sections handle various critical stages on the human resources side of an Airman’s service including in processing, promotions, temporary assignments, permanent change of station and discharge from service.

Staff Sgt. Anais Lopez Quinones, 341st FSS career development supervisor for outbound assignments, says that her role as an MPS Airmen is critical in taking care of all Airmen at Malmstrom “face-to-face.” 

“I help people PCS out of the base, to make their transition smoother,” said Lopez Quinones. “It’s good to have someone for guidance, to have that one person who can answer all their PCS questions.”

According to Sylva, MPS is open 7:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday, no exception other than wing-wide closures. 

“We have a great team,” said Lopez Quinones. “We all work toward one goal: providing the best customer service. We all do our best and give more than one hundred percent. MPS Airmen strive for the best.”
column6: MALMSTROM AIR FORCE BASE, MT, UNITED STATES
column9: 美国蒙特州马尔姆斯特罗姆空军基地
column10: 下议院议员，准备好了吗
column11: 第341部队支援中队军事人员科收到了2015 A1 Gerrit D.Foster，Jr.杰出军事人员计划奖。这是一个空军级别的奖项，重点关注团队或计划绩效，由杰出贡献和对优秀服务飞行员及其家人的承诺决定。马尔姆斯特罗姆三年来第二次获得该奖项。“Gerrit D.Foster，Jr.奖表彰空军中最优秀的议员，”第341 FSS军事人事科科长Ken Sylva说。“它验证了我们团队所做的艰苦工作，并确认马尔姆斯特罗姆正在获得空军所能提供的最佳人事服务。国会议员负责人事事务，使飞行员能够专注于他们的主要工作。这是整个团队的胜利。”根据西尔瓦的说法，议员们提交了一份与82个其他基地竞争的一揽子成就，并最终获胜。“这一成功归功于团队对他们在联队任务中的角色的理解，以及人们可以自由创新的环境。”Sylva说。衡量MPS的成功与否涉及到许多因素。马尔姆斯特罗姆在2015年的每个类别中都被评为近乎最佳。MPS成功、高效地处理了飞行员人事记录中最重要的信息，包括人员可靠性p程序要求、永久性改变电站流程和处理值班命令。马尔姆斯特罗姆还负责派遣激励薪酬体系，在项目开始一个月内完成了96%的完成率。该项目不仅对341导弹联队产生了重大影响，而且对核企业也产生了重大影响导弹维修人员和安全部队飞行员的流动部队条件，以及由于现场部署而获得的特殊任务分配奖励薪酬。MPS的空军目标是拥有80%的及时性竞争率。马尔姆斯特罗姆实现了98%。对于马尔姆斯特罗姆的大约20名飞行员的MPS来说，这一胜利正在成为一种趋势。“我们这里有23名非常年轻的机组成员，不仅是年龄，而且是经验，”西尔瓦说。“我们的飞行员正在走出自我，利用他们的动机以积极有效的方式提供马尔姆斯特罗姆。”在341MW，MPS由三个子部门组成，包括客户服务、部队管理和职业发展。这些部门处理飞行员服务人力资源方面的各个关键阶段，包括处理、晋升、临时任务、永久换岗和退役。工作人员安娜斯・洛佩斯・奎诺内斯中士，341FSS出外任务职业发展主管，说她作为MPS飞行员的角色对于“面对面”照顾马尔姆斯特罗姆的所有飞行员至关重要。“我帮助人们离开基地，让他们的过渡更顺利，”洛佩斯・奎诺内斯说。“有人来指导，有一个人能回答他们电脑上的所有问题，这很好。”根据西尔瓦的说法，国会议员周一到周五上午7:30到下午4:30开放，除了全联队停赛外，也不例外。“我们有一个很棒的团队，”洛佩兹・奎诺内斯说。“我们都朝着一个目标努力：提供最好的客户服务。我们都尽力而为，付出了100%以上。MPS飞行员力求做到最好。”

column2: Warfighter of the Week- Master Sgt. Leah Chavez
column3:
TUCSON, Ariz. - Master Sgt. Leah Chavez, 12th Air Force (Air Forces Southern) A1 contingency operations and planning manager, was recognized as the Warfighter of the Week, July 10, 2015.

Chavez, a native of Houston, Texas, has been serving in the Air Force for 12 years. She served five years with the Air National Guard and seven years with the Air Force Reserves. She has always known that serving in the Air Force is what she wanted to do, so after graduating high school she enlisted.

As an A1 contingency operations and planning manager for 12th AF (AFSOUTH), she works with the Installation Personnel Readiness office and Unit Deployment Managers to make sure Airmen have all of their pre-deployment requirements taken care of before being deployed. She also keeps accountability for all Air Force personnel who travel through the United States Southern Command area of responsibility.   

"Being a contingency operations and planning manager can be a very complex job, you have a lot of responsibility and there are a lot of moving pieces that go in to getting the job done," said Senior Master Sgt. Dorothy Cole, 12th AF (AFSOUTH), A1 superintendent. You have direct influence on the livelihood of our Airmen and there's no one better for the job than Chavez; to put it simply she's amazing and we're happy to have her as a part of our team."

In her personal time, Chavez loves challenging herself both physically and mentally. She loves to workout and run marathons, and has found ways to inspire others through these hobbies.

"I love to motivate people and I love fitness, so being able to workout with my fellow Airmen, or pace them during their physical fitness test, means a lot to me," said Chavez." "No Airman left behind truly means a lot to me."

In the future Chavez would like to become a first sergeant and also plans on pursuing her education by getting her Master's Degree in Homeland Security.

Warfighter of the Week is an opportunity for the Airmen throughout 12th AF (AFSOUTH) to share their story. The Warfighter of the Week initiative aligns with the 12th AF (AFSOUTH) commander's priority of creating a work environment where someone knows you both professionally and personally.  These outstanding Airmen are selected by their directors based on their contributions to the Air Force's mission.
column9: 美国亚利桑那州图森
column10: 本周最佳作战人员-利娅・查韦斯上士
column11: 亚利桑那州图森市――第12空军（南部空军）A1应急行动和规划经理Leah Chavez上士被公认为2015年7月10日本周最佳作战人员。查韦斯出生于德克萨斯州休斯敦，在空军服役12年。她在空军国民警卫队服役五年，在空军预备队服役七年。她一直知道在空军服役是她想做的事，所以高中毕业后她应征入伍。作为第12空军（AFSOUTH）的A1应急行动和规划经理，她与安装人员准备办公室和部队部署经理合作，确保飞行员在部署前已满足所有部署前要求。她还对穿越美国南部指挥部责任区的所有空军人员负责。“作为一名应急行动和计划经理可能是一项非常复杂的工作，你有很多责任，而且在完成工作中有很多活动，”A1总监、第12 AF（AFSOUTH）高级少校多萝西・科尔（Dorothy Cole）说。你对我们飞行员的生活有直接影响，没有人比查韦斯更适合这份工作；简单地说，她很了不起，我们很高兴她成为我们团队的一员。“在她的私人时间里，查韦斯喜欢挑战自己的身体和精神。她喜欢锻炼和跑马拉松，并找到了通过这些爱好激励他人的方法。”我喜欢激励人们，我喜欢健身，查韦斯说：“所以，能够和我的飞行员同伴一起锻炼，或者在他们的体能测试中给他们配速，对我来说意义重大。没有一名飞行员被甩在后面，这对我来说真的意义重大。”在未来，查韦斯希望成为一名上士，并计划通过获得国土安全硕士学位继续接受教育。本周的《作战人员》是整个第12空军（AFSOUTH）的飞行员分享他们故事的机会。本周最佳作战人员计划与第12届空军（南部）指挥官的优先事项一致，即创造一个有人在专业和个人方面都了解你的工作环境。这些杰出的飞行员是由他们的主管根据他们对空军任务的贡献选出的。

column2: Idaho Joins New York for A-10 Live Fire
column3:
FORT DRUM, N.Y., (Sept. 26, 2018) ― More than 12 Airmen assigned to the 274th Air Support Operations Squadron, New York Air National Guard, called in live fire from A-10 Thunderbolt IIs during training scenarios at Ft. Drum, Sept. 18-20, 2018. 

To meet training requirements, the 124th Fighter Wing, Gowen Field Air National Guard Base, Idaho, provided four of the aircraft for the joint terminal attack controllers to train with. With 30 mm rotary cannons, white phosphorus rockets and 500 pound bombs at their disposal, the JTACs coordinated several attacks on stationary targets.

“We were controlling close air support, we had A-10s overhead,” said Senior Airman Blaine Moore, a JTAC assigned to the 274th ASOS. “We were being a liaison on the ground to coordinate with the pilots so they could deliver close air support on enemy targets.” 

The targets may not have been truly enemies, but to train as they fight is essential for keeping their skills sharp. On a battlefield, it is a JTAC that is going to ensure that air support delivers the desired results.

“This type of training is extremely important for us because it‘s hands on training,” said Moore. “It’s what we’re actually going to be doing downrange so that when the time comes and we have to save and protect friendly ground forces, we can coordinate and provide these ordinances in a safe manner.”

Playing such a vital role on the battlefield, the Airman of the 274th ASOS spend countless days perfecting these skills. Success for them is measured in their ability to save and protect others.

“Our role is extremely crucial in a downrange environment,” said Moore. “Without us on the ground to liaison with the assets in the air and the ground commander, there is not necessarily a connection between the two.”

A JTAC is specially trained to be able to communicate with the various aircraft of the U.S. military that provide air support. They plan and coordinate missions to have ground targets engaged, and then control the aircraft to execute the mission. U.S. and coalition forces can utilize JTACs in ways that can drastically change the face of a battle. 

“Any chance we get, we take full advantage of it and take our training to next level,” said Moore, describing the opportunity to train with live fire from aircraft.  “We were in full scenario the entire time utilizing every piece of equipment that we possibly could, that we don’t get to use outside of a firing range.”

The week of training at Ft. Drum ended as a success with all training goals achieved. For the Airmen of the 274th ASOS, the job may not be easy but it is exactly how they want to serve their country. 

“It feels awesome, it’s a lot of hard work but it’s very rewarding,” said Moore.
column9: 美国纽约州德拉姆堡
column10: 爱达荷州加入纽约A-10实弹射击
column11: 纽约州德拉姆堡（2018年9月26日）-纽约州国民警卫队第274空中支援行动中队的12名以上飞行员在德拉姆堡进行训练时，从A-10 Thunderbolt IIs呼叫实弹射击，2018年9月18日至20日。为了满足训练要求，爱达荷州戈文空军国民警卫队基地第124战斗机联队提供了四架飞机供联合终端攻击控制员训练。在30毫米旋转加农炮、白磷火箭和500磅炸弹的支配下，JTAC协调了对固定目标的几次攻击。“我们控制着近距离空中支援，我们头顶上有A-10，”分配给第274 ASOS的JTAC高级飞行员布莱恩・摩尔（Blaine Moore）说。“我们在地面充当联络人，与飞行员协调，以便他们能够对敌人目标提供近距离空中支援。”这些目标可能不是真正的敌人，但在战斗中进行训练对于保持他们的技能至关重要。在战场上，JTAC将确保空中支援达到预期效果。“这种类型的训练对我们来说非常重要，因为这是动手训练，”摩尔说。“这是我们实际上将要做的事情，以便当时间到来时，我们必须拯救和保护友好的地面部队，我们可以安全地协调和提供这些法令。”在战场上扮演着如此重要的角色，第274 ASO的飞行员花了无数天来完善这些技能。他们的成功取决于他们拯救和保护他人的能力。摩尔说：“我们的角色在下行环境中至关重要。”。“没有我们在地面与空中资产和地面指挥官的联系，两者之间就不一定有联系。”JTAC经过专门训练，能够与提供空中支援的美军各种飞机进行通信。他们计划和协调任务，让地面目标参与，然后控制飞机执行任务。美国和联军可以利用联合战术指挥系统，从而彻底改变战斗面貌。摩尔说：“只要有机会，我们就会充分利用它，把我们的训练提高到一个新的水平。”他描述了利用飞机实弹进行训练的机会。“我们一直在充分利用我们可能使用的每一件设备，而这些设备我们无法在射程之外使用。”在鼓堡训练的一周圆满结束，所有训练目标都实现了。对于第274届美国空军司令部的飞行员来说，这项工作可能并不容易，但这正是他们想要为国家服务的方式。摩尔说：“这感觉棒极了，这是一项艰巨的工作，但它是非常有益的。”。

column2: AA Group to Start at NSAB
column3:
For those struggling with alcoholism or other substance abuse, Naval Support Activity Bethesda (NSAB) Interfaith Center is set to start hosting a weekly Alcoholics Anonymous group.

The “Another Chance” AA group came about between talks that NSAB Chaplain Christilene Whalen had with AA member Dan.

“I wanted to start one for the NSAB community,” he said. “I approached the chaplain and said ‘Hey I’d love to start a meeting here.’”

“We said, ‘When?’ Whalen recalled. “It was a decision that was easy to make.”

Dan said he hopes the meetings will help service members, “Wounded Warriors” or anyone who works at NSAB and has a problem with alcoholism.

“Our primary purpose (in AA) is to stay sober and help other alcoholics achieve sobriety,” Dan said.

Whalen said the Interfaith Center’s mission rolls neatly into that of AA as both are designed to help people grow.

“AA is really important to me,” she continued. “I have a large amount of alcoholics in my family … They help not only the person who is going through it, but the family member as well. ‘Cause it’s difficult to live in a house with an alcoholic.”

Another Chance is a registered group of Alcoholics Anonymous, so people who have court requirements to attend can come and have their court cards signed. Whalen said service members can be referred to the meeting through the Drug and Alcohol Prevention Advocate.

“Sometimes those ‘voluntold’ things help people keep their jobs, keep their families and keep their lives intact,” Whalen added.

Dan said anyone is welcome to attend the group and “the only requirement for membership is a desire to stop drinking.”

The first Alcoholics Anonymous group is March 15 at 11:30 a.m. in the Interfaith Center basement, conference room 34, Bldg. 11. For more information, call the Interfaith Center at 301-319-5058.
column9: 美国马里兰州贝塞斯达
column10: 机管局小组将于国安局展开
column11: 对于那些与酗酒或其他药物滥用作斗争的人来说，海军支持活动贝塞斯达（NSAB）宗教间中心将开始每周举办一个酗酒匿名小组。“另一次机会”AA小组是在NSAB牧师克里斯蒂琳・惠伦与AA成员丹的会谈之间举行的。“我想为NSAB社区举办一次。”他说。“我找到牧师，说‘嘿，我想在这里开个会’”“我们说，‘什么时候？’Whalen回忆道。“这是一个很容易做出的决定。”丹说，他希望这些会议能帮助服役人员、“受伤的战士”或任何在国家安全局工作并有酗酒问题的人。“我们的主要目的（在AA中）“这是为了保持清醒，帮助其他酗酒者保持清醒，”丹说。惠伦说，宗教间中心的使命巧妙地融入了AA，因为两者都是为了帮助人们成长。“AA对我来说真的很重要，”她继续说。“我家里有很多酗酒者……他们不仅帮助正在经历这一过程的人，也帮助家庭成员。因为与酗酒者住在一起很困难。”另一个机会是一个注册的匿名酗酒者团体，因此有法庭要求出席的人可以来签署他们的法庭卡。Whalen说，可以通过药物和酒精预防倡导者介绍服务人员参加会议。Whalen补充道：“有时候，这些‘数不清’的东西有助于人们保住工作、保住家庭、保持生活完整。”Dan说，欢迎任何人参加这个团体，“成为会员的唯一要求是戒酒。”第一个匿名酗酒者小组将于3月15日上午11:30在11号楼34会议室宗教间中心地下室举行。有关更多信息，请致电301-319-5058与宗教间中心联系。

column2: 3rd AA Bn celebrates the Corps’ 240th birthday
column3:
MARINE CORPS BASE CAMP PENDLETON, Calif. C To most, Nov. 10 is just like any other day, but for the few and the proud, it is one of the most significant days in their Corps’ history and is celebrated with pride during the Marine Corps Birthday Ball Celebration.

For 240 years the United States Marine Corps has been the nation’s force in readiness and has been called upon to support operations around the world. Each year, Marines in every clime and place pay homage to the Marine Corps’ continued dedicated service as a ready and relevant force deployed across the globe.    

Although many Marines enjoy the typical lavish Marine Corps Birthday Ball ceremonies held at venues throughout the country, others like Company A, 3rd Assault Amphibian Battalion, 1st Marine Division, celebrated the Corps’ birthday in more austere conditions this year.

The company of Marines and Sailors celebrated the 240th birthday in the desert of Yuma Proving Grounds, Arizona to cap off a 15-day field exercise. 
  
The Marines and Sailors were in high spirits during the celebration, starting the evening off with a hot meal. Directly after, the Marines took their places around the lowered ramp of an Amphibious Assault Vehicle to hear the 13th Commandant of the Marine Corps Gen. John A. Lejeune’s birthday message and to witness the traditional cake cutting ceremony, followed by the viewing of the birthday message from the current commandant, Gen. Robert B. Neller. 

“This right here is the heart of the Marine Corps, it’s what we do,” said 1st Lt. Sean Styerwalt, the headquarters company platoon commander with 3rd AA Bn. “As Marines we get out here and get dirty and we do what we have to do. We have been out here for 15 days, so we stink and some of us are tired but it’s a great deal and it’s probably the best birthday I’ve ever been a part of.”

The Marine Corps’ birthday is a time-honored tradition when past and present generations of Marines gather to commemerate the Corps’ storied history. There are various moments within the ceremony that capture the significance of Marine Corps legacy.

The cake cutting ceremony, which can be considered the most symbolic tradition of the ceremony, symbolizes the passing of responsibility and traditions from one generation of Marines to another.    

No matter what the circumstance, Marines will set aside time to celebrate the traditions and legacy of the Marine Corps. While the celebration of the Corp’s birthday is a top priority among all commands, it never gets in the way of maintaining the readiness of its Marines.   

“I think it’s great to celebrate out in the field here in Yuma because it’s what the Corps’ roots are,” said 1st Lt. Dillon Fuston, a platoon commander with 3rd AA Bn. “Marines look pretty in their dress blues and all but when it comes down to the dirty grit of it, all Marines are here to train and to fight. It’s good that we are out here because it reminds Marines what our duties are to the nation and to each other.”   

At the end of the event, Capt. Brian Jaquitch, the company commander, expressed how proud he was of his Marines and their efforts throughout the training.     

“I’m extremely proud of the company,” Jaquitch said. “I couldn’t be more proud of the way these Marines trained and the skills they showed as a crew. The ceremony was pretty much the culminating event, so it was a great way to end the training portion of this exercise.”

Despite the layers of dirt and grease stained within their utilities and coveralls, the lack of showers and stomachs growling for a home-cooked meal, the Marines and Sailors successfully completed their training and showed they haven’t forgotten where they came from, remembering the long line of heroes who came before them.
column6: YUMA PROVING GROUND, AZ, UNITED STATES
column9: 美国亚利桑那州尤马试验场
column10: 第三届美国海军陆战队庆祝陆军陆战队240岁生日
column11: 加利福尼亚州彭德尔顿海军陆战队大本营――对大多数人来说，11月10日就像其他任何一天一样，但对少数人和骄傲的人来说，这是美国海军陆战队历史上最重要的日子之一，在海军陆战队生日舞会上，人们自豪地庆祝这一天。240年来，美国海军陆战队一直是国家的战备部队，并被要求支持世界各地的行动。每一年，海军陆战队在每一个地区和地方都要向海军陆战队致敬，他们作为一支部署在全球各地的随时准备好的相关部队，继续奉献自己的服务。虽然许多海军陆战队士兵喜欢在全国各地的场地举行的海军陆战队生日舞会，但其他人，如海军陆战队第一师第三突击两栖营A连，今年，海军陆战队和水手们在亚利桑那州尤马试验场的沙漠中庆祝了240岁的生日，结束了为期15天的野战演习。海军陆战队和水手们在庆祝活动中兴高采烈，晚上以一顿热饭开始。紧接着，海军陆战队士兵们在一辆两栖突击车的下降坡道周围就座，聆听海军陆战队第13任司令约翰・A・勒琼将军的生日祝词，见证传统的蛋糕切割仪式，然后观看现任司令罗伯特・B・内勒将军的生日祝词。“这里是海军陆战队的核心，我们就是这样做的，”第三机管局Bn总部连队排长肖恩・斯泰尔沃尔特中尉说。“作为海军陆战队，我们来到这里，弄脏衣服，做我们必须做的事情。我们在这里已经呆了15天了，所以我们很臭，有些人很累，但这是一个非常棒的生日，这可能是我参加过的最好的生日。”海军陆战队的生日是一个由来已久的传统，过去和现在的几代海军陆战队成员齐聚一堂，共同讲述海军陆战队的传奇历史。仪式中有许多时刻体现了海军陆战队遗产的重要性。蛋糕切割仪式被认为是仪式中最具象征意义的传统，象征着责任和传统从一代海军陆战队传递到另一代海军陆战队。无论在什么情况下，海军陆战队都会留出时间来庆祝海军陆战队的传统和遗产。虽然庆祝该公司的生日是所有司令部的首要任务，但它从未妨碍海军陆战队保持战备状态。“我认为在尤马的战场上庆祝是一件很好的事情，因为这是军团的根基所在，”第三陆军旅排长Dillon Fuston中尉说。“海军陆战队穿着蓝色礼服看起来很漂亮，但归根结底，所有的海军陆战队都是来训练和战斗的。我们来到这里很好，因为这提醒了海军陆战队我们对国家和彼此的责任。”活动结束时，连长布赖恩・贾奎奇上尉，表达了他对自己的海军陆战队以及他们在整个训练过程中的努力感到多么自豪。“我为这家公司感到非常自豪，”贾奎奇说。“我对这些海军陆战队的训练方式和他们作为一名船员所表现出的技能感到无比自豪。仪式几乎是一个高潮，因此这是结束这次演习训练部分的一个很好的方式。”尽管他们的工具和工作服上沾满了层层污垢和油脂，由于没有淋浴和肚子咕噜咕噜地咕噜咕噜地吃一顿家常饭，海军陆战队和水手们成功地完成了他们的训练，并表明他们没有忘记他们来自哪里，记住了在他们之前的一长串英雄。

column2: Cadets on board- 2nd AA Bn Marines give demonstration
column3:
CAMP LEJEUNE, N.C. - Cadets with the Naval Junior Reserve Officer Training Corps unit at Cary High School, Cary, North Carolina, visited Marine Corps Base Camp Lejeune, March 31, 2015, to expand their knowledge of military occupational specialties.

The cadets teamed up with Marines from 2nd Assault Amphibian Battalion, 2nd Marine Division for hands-on experience with amphibious assault vehicles.

“Many of our students are attracted to the military; that’s why they join JROTC,” said Lt. Col. Wesley L. Feight, the senior naval science instructor at Cary High School. “This is a way to expose them to more pieces of the military puzzle and help them make sense of things.” 

The cadets were given the chance to experience the gas chamber and interact with a military working dog unit. The trip also allowed time for cadets to participate in the Indoor Simulated Marksmanship Trainer before returning home.

At home, the cadets have the opportunity to participate in competitive drill, marksmanship and color-guard services, and they are heavily involved in community service.

“My favorite part of JROTC is gaining snapshots of the military lifestyle and the opportunity to see different jobs before I commit to one,” said Brendan Kearns, a senior at Cary HS and the commanding officer for the school’s NJROTC program. 

Kearns plans to attend college and participate in their ROTC program before joining the military.

“For me, the highlight is having them interact with Marines,” Feight said. “I think they gain more from talking with the people, seeing what Marines are really like and gaining that level of familiarity and appreciation.”
column9: 美国北卡罗来纳州勒琼营
column10: 船上学员-第二架AA Bn海军陆战队进行演示
column11: 北卡罗来纳州勒琼营――2015年3月31日，北卡罗来纳州卡里高中海军初级预备役军官训练团的学员参观了海军陆战队勒琼营基地，以扩大他们对军事职业专业的了解。学员们与第二突击两栖营的海军陆战队进行了合作，海军陆战队第二师，体验两栖攻击车。卡里高中高级海军科学讲师韦斯利・L・费特中校说：“我们的许多学生都被军队吸引，这就是他们加入JROTC的原因。”。“这是一种让他们接触更多军事谜题并帮助他们理解事物的方法。”学员们有机会体验毒气室，并与军事工作犬部队互动。这次旅行还让学员们有时间在回家之前参加室内模拟射击教练。在家里，学员们有机会参加竞争性训练、射击和护色服务，并积极参与社区服务。“我在JROTC最喜欢的部分是获得军队生活方式的快照，以及在我投入工作之前看到不同工作的机会，”Cary HS的大四学生、学校NJROTC项目的指挥官Brendan Kearns说。Kearns计划在参军前上大学并参加他们的ROTC项目。“对我来说，最重要的是让他们与海军陆战队互动，”费特说。“我认为他们从与人们交谈、了解海军陆战队的真实面目以及获得那种熟悉和欣赏中获得了更多。”

column2: Digging deep- Marines with 2nd AA Bn. conduct avalanche training
column3:
BRIDGEPORT, Calif. C Marines and sailors from across II Marine Expeditionary Force and 2nd Marine Expeditionary Brigade took on the Mountain Warfare Training Center in Bridgeport, Calif., as part of their preparation for Exercise Cold Response 16 in March.

The exercise will feature military training including maritime, land and air operations that underscore NATO's ability to defend against any threat in any environment.

Marines with 2nd Assault Amphibian Battalion worked against the clock as they raced to save a notional avalanche victim during scenario-based training at the training center Jan. 20, 2016.

The Marines and sailors conducted multiple training events throughout the 10-day course in order to acclimatize themselves to the weather conditions they’ll face in Norway during Cold Response.

Sgt. Keith Carman, a squad leader with Alpha Company, 2nd Assault Amphibian Battalion, led the charge as his Marines rushed to save the notional victim.

“We had two classes leading up to the actual scenario that gave us an insight to the training ahead,” said Carman. He added the classes gave his Marines a chance to learn more about the gear and eventually get their hands on the equipment.

Cpl. Tristan Morrison, a fire team leader with the company, joined the Marines in the search for the notional casualty. The Marines formed a probe line in which they stood side-by-side and canvassed the area of the suspected location of the casualty. The Marines probed with aluminum rods marked at every foot to indicate the depth of the snow, which also helped locate a rescue dummy. 

“The Marine behind the probe line gives you the commands on where to probe and when,” said Morrison. “While he’s doing that, he’s looking at inconsistencies in the probes and the one probing is getting a feel for what the probe is hitting.”

With little experience operating in mountainous regions, Carman said his Marines performed well and he feels confident in their capabilities.

“The Marines did great,” said Carman. ”We beat our timeline to get to the landing zone and found the victim within a reasonable timeframe regardless of the outside factors affecting our movements.”

By working through scenario-based training, the Marines better prepared themselves the challenges they’ll face working alongside their NATO counterparts during the Norwegian winter.
column9: 布里奇波特，加利福尼亚州，美国
column10: 挖掘深-海军陆战队与第二个AA Bn。进行雪崩训练
column11: 加利福尼亚州布里奇波特――来自第二海军陆战队远征军和第二海军陆战队远征旅的海军陆战队和水手参加了位于加利福尼亚州布里奇波特的山地战争训练中心，作为他们为3月第16次冷反应演习做准备的一部分。这次演习将以军事训练为特色，包括海上，强调北约在任何环境下抵御任何威胁的能力的陆上和空中行动。1月20日，在训练中心进行的基于情景的训练中，海军陆战队与第二突击两栖动物营分秒必争，争分夺秒地赶赴拯救一名名义上的雪崩受害者，2016年。在为期10天的课程中，海军陆战队和水手们进行了多次训练，以适应寒冷响应期间他们将在挪威面临的天气条件。中士。基思・卡曼（Keith Carman）是第二突击两栖动物营阿尔法连的一名班长，他带领海军陆战队冲锋去营救名义上的受害者。卡曼说：“我们上了两门课，了解了实际情况，让我们了解了未来的训练。”。他补充说，这些课程让他的海军陆战队有机会学习更多关于装备的知识，并最终掌握装备。Cpl。特里斯坦・莫里森是该公司的消防队队长，他加入了海军陆战队，搜寻所谓的伤亡人员。海军陆战队组成了一条探测线，他们并排站在探测线内，仔细搜索疑似伤员的位置。海军陆战队用铝棒探测每一只脚，以指示雪的深度，这也有助于找到一个救援假人。莫里森说：“探测线后面的陆战队员会告诉你探测的地点和时间。”。“当他这样做的时候，他在观察探测器中的不一致性，而其中一个探测是对探测器击中的物体的感觉。”卡曼说，由于在山区作战的经验很少，他的海军陆战队表现良好，他对他们的能力充满信心。“海军陆战队做得很好，”卡曼说我们按照时间表到达着陆区，在合理的时间内找到了受害者，而不考虑影响我们行动的外部因素。”通过基于情景的训练，海军陆战队更好地准备了他们将在挪威冬季与北约同行一道面临的挑战。

column2: From sea to land- 2nd AA Battalion maintains amphibious readiness
column3:
CAMP LEJEUNE, N.C. - The whisper of engines slowly grew louder until it was a roar over the crash of waves on sand. Dots on the horizon, dwarfed by the silhouette of the USS Whidbey Island, crawled along in the ocean until the distinct shapes of assault amphibious vehicles formed and appeared larger than the landing ship in the distance.

The AAVs left spouts of water and plumes of white and black smoke in their wakes, and growled as tracks met the beach and the vehicles rushed forward. The Marines had landed as approximately 40 Marines with 2nd Assault Amphibian Battalion, 2nd Marine Division, conducted amphibious operation training aboard Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, July 15C16. 

“This is the first time we’re doing this together as a platoon,” said Cpl. Kyle Severt, an AAV crew chief with 3rd Platoon, Bravo Company. “It’s important because our job is to keep the Marine Corps amphibious. We have to practice in the water to be good at it because this is one of the most dangerous things that we do.”

The exercise began with the platoon’s 10 vehicles plunging into the Atlantic Ocean and practicing various maneuvers. The Marines conducted landing drills several times before heading several miles out to sea to board the Whidbey Island and complete their well deck training.

After a night on the ship, the Marines again boarded their vehicles and splashed into the ocean, making one final beach assault. 

“The Marine Corps is amphibious by nature,” said Lance Cpl. Matthew Carstensen, an AAV crew chief with the unit. “We hit beaches and we hit with speed and ferocity. That’s our job and if we don’t get that training, how is the infantry going to rely on us to get them to the beach safely?”

The use of amphibious operations allows Marines to land personnel and equipment without the need of secure aircraft landing zones. The AAVs have the capability to carry personnel and supplies, as well as provide their own firepower and security.

“We are the first wave to hit the beach,” said 1st Lt. Ian Budge, the commander of 3rd Platoon. “AAVs let us project power from any kind of naval platform that can travel the world. AAV operators are the only Marines who will actively practice this and we will be the direct advisors for ground assaults.” 

Naval-based assaults are not the only option the military utilizes to move troops into hostile territory, but they can be more practical in certain situations. Direct assaults from the sea carry less risk of being surrounded than inserting personnel and equipment in land controlled by an enemy with aircraft, and allow for more direct supply lines.

“Aircraft have great potential to go inland over long distances,” Budge said. “AAVs, however, are the primary means for establishing a foothold on any land where we don’t already have a presence. Constant training with AAVs is important for us so that if anything kicks off, we’re ready to answer the call.”
column9: 美国北卡罗来纳州勒琼营
column10: 从海上到陆地-第二防空营保持两栖战备状态
column11: 北卡罗来纳州勒琼营地――引擎的低语声慢慢变大，直到海浪拍打沙滩发出轰鸣声。地平线上的小点与美国惠德比号航空母舰的轮廓相形见绌，它们在海洋中爬行，直到两栖攻击车的不同形状形成，并且看起来比远处的登陆舰还要大。AAV在尾迹中留下了水柱和黑白烟羽，当铁轨与海滩相撞，车辆冲向前方时，它咆哮着。7月15日至16日，海军陆战队第二师第二突击两栖营约40名陆战队士兵在北卡罗来纳州勒琼营进行两栖作战训练。“这是我们第一次作为一个排一起做这件事，”布拉沃连第三排AAV机组长凯尔・塞维特下士说。“这很重要，因为我们的工作是让海军陆战队保持两栖。我们必须在水中练习，才能擅长这项工作，因为这是我们所做的最危险的事情之一。”演习开始于该排的10辆车冲入大西洋并练习各种机动。海军陆战队进行了多次登陆演习，然后出海数英里登上惠德比岛并完成井底甲板训练。在船上呆了一个晚上后，海军陆战队再次登上车辆并溅入大海，进行了最后一次海滩突击。“海军陆战队本质上是两栖的，”该部队AAV机组长兰斯・马修・卡斯滕森下士说。“我们袭击海滩，我们以速度和凶猛袭击。这是我们的工作，如果我们没有得到训练，步兵将如何依靠我们将他们安全带到海滩？”两栖作战的使用使海军陆战队能够在不需要安全飞机着陆区的情况下降落人员和设备。AAV有能力运送人员和物资，并提供自己的火力和安全保障。第三排指挥官伊恩・巴奇中尉说：“我们是第一批登陆海滩的人。”。“AAV让我们可以从任何一种可以周游世界的海军平台上投射力量。AAV操作员是唯一会积极实践这一点的海军陆战队，我们将是地面攻击的直接顾问。”海军基地攻击不是军方将部队转移到敌对领土的唯一选择，但在某些情况下，它们可能更实用。来自海上的直接攻击比在敌人用飞机控制的陆地上插入人员和设备所带来的被包围的风险要小，并且允许更直接的补给线。“飞机有很大的潜力可以远距离进入内陆，”Budge说。“然而，AAV是在我们还没有存在的任何土地上建立立足点的主要手段。AAV的持续训练对我们来说很重要，这样，如果有什么事情开始，我们就可以随时响应。”

column2: 2nd AA Bn becomes first unit to negotiate Camp Lejeune’s new Leadership Reaction Course
column3:
U.S. Marines with 2nd Assault Amphibian Battalion (2nd AA Bn), 2nd Marine Division, took on a challenge as the first unit to navigate the newly-opened Leadership Reaction Course (LRC) on Marine Corps Base Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, Jan. 7, 2020.

More than 60 Marines with 2nd AA Bn maneuvered through four different obstacles, some leading the path to victory and other to defeat.

“Marines gain a lot from this training and most importantly they gain the ability to think in a time constrained, stressful situation,” said Staff Sgt. Donald McBee Jr., the mine countermeasure platoon sergeant with 2nd AA Bn. “There are frictions that are thrown at them, having to think under pressure, giving them the ability to problem solve on the move.”

The Marines divided into 12 teams of five, rotating through the different obstacles, each requiring critical thinking and problem solving skills to maneuver. Each station consists of its own rules and objectives: red surfaces couldn’t be touched, only the materials provided could be used and all Marines have to make it through the obstacle safely.  The team also had to complete each station in less than 15 minutes.

At each obstacle, a new Marine was given an opportunity to lead by becoming the fire team leader for the group. That Marine’s responsibility was to form a plan, and organize and direct the Marines on hand to solve the obstacle in the time allotted. The objective of Marine Corps leadership is to develop the leadership qualities of Marines to enable them to assume progressively greater responsibilities. Regardless of rank, every Marine must be prepared to lead.

“I gained a lot of experience about critical thinking that I wouldn’t usually get from my day to day work,” said Cpl. Arthur Lesso, a metal worker with 2nd AA Bn. “I most definitely would do it again. It helps leaders and people who wouldn’t be leaders to flex that muscle and just figure out a problem that doesn’t have an easy solution.”

According to McBee, 2nd AA Bn participated in the LRC as their Back in the Saddle training to start 2020 off right. The goal of BITS is to refocus Marines after the holiday and prepare them for the year ahead.
 
“The LRC is absolutely great training, and I am glad they brought it back,” McBee said. “I guarantee that we will be coming back to do follow-on training here.”
column9: 美国北卡罗来纳州勒琼营
column10: 第二个AA Bn成为第一个谈判Lejeune营新领导层反应课程的单位
column11: 2020年1月7日，海军陆战队第二师第二突击两栖营（第二AA Bn）的美国海军陆战队作为第一个在北卡罗莱纳州海军陆战队大本营Lejeune新开设的领导反应课程（LRC）中航行的部队，接受了一项挑战。60多名海军陆战队第二AA Bn通过了四个不同的障碍，海军陆战队士兵从这次训练中获益匪浅，最重要的是，他们能够在时间紧迫、压力巨大的情况下思考问题，陆军中士唐纳德・麦克比（Donald McBee Jr.）说，他是第二海军陆战队士兵的地雷对抗排中士。“有摩擦抛向他们，必须在压力下思考，让他们能够在行动中解决问题。”海军陆战队分成12个小组，每组5人，轮流穿越不同的障碍，每个小组都需要批判性思维和解决问题的技能来操作。每个空间站都有自己的规则和目标：红色表面不能触摸，只能使用提供的材料，所有的海军陆战队成员必须安全地通过障碍物。小组还必须在不到15分钟的时间内完成每一站。在每一个障碍物上，一名新的海军陆战队队员都有机会成为小组的消防队长。海军陆战队的职责是制定一个计划，组织和指挥现有的海军陆战队在规定的时间内解决障碍。海军陆战队领导的目标是培养海军陆战队的领导素质，使他们能够逐步承担更大的责任。无论军衔高低，每个海军陆战队员都必须做好领导的准备。“我在批判性思维方面获得了很多经验，这是我在日常工作中通常得不到的，”第二航空局Bn的金属工人阿瑟・莱索下士说。“我肯定会再做一次。这有助于领导者和那些不想成为领导者的人锻炼肌肉，并找出一个不容易解决的问题。”McBee说，第二位AA Bn作为他们的后备马鞍训练参加了LRC，准备从2020年开始。BITS的目标是在假期后重新关注海军陆战队，为下一年做好准备。“LRC绝对是很棒的训练，我很高兴他们回来了，”McBee说。“我保证我们会回来这里进行后续培训。”

column2: Then and Now- African American ERG’s Black History Celebration Ceremony
column3:
Lift Every Voice and Sing, adopted in 1919 by the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) as the “Black National Anthem,” was a fitting opening song for Norfolk Naval Shipyard’s (NNSY) African American Employee Resource Group’s (AA-ERG) 3rd annual Black History Celebration Feb. 20. Located near the waterfront for accessibility, the workforce was graced with the beautifully full voices of engineers Brian Darden (Code 105) and Andre Johnson (Code 900T) when they sang the song. Founder and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Zel Technologies, LLC (ZELTECH) Jack L. Ezzell Jr. was the speaker of the event. 

Born and raised in North Carolina, Ezzell discussed his journey of joining the United States Air Force and later becoming a successful African American entrepreneur. Moving onto the struggles and prejudices he faced along the way, he made it clear that his intention was not to shame anyone for something others did long ago, but rather to help people understand the present, in lieu of his theme ‘Lest We Forget.’ “There’s a lot we can learn from examining our past,” Ezzell said. “It is useful because it can be used to understand where people are coming from today.” 

Moreover, Black History Month exists to celebrate those who came before us and paved the way for the freedoms society has now. Ezzell said, “we are here to step back and recognize the many great gifts that African Americans have brought to our nation.” 

Aligning with the shipyard’s C.O.R.E. value of Respect, Ezzell also encouraged others to listen to each other. “Engage with people of different perspectives from your own,” he urged. “Listen with kindness in your heart, not anger. If we listen to each other and treat each other with respect, we can find ways to solve the problems of today.”
column9: 美国弗吉尼亚州朴茨茅斯
column10: 时过境迁――非裔美国人ERG的黑人历史庆祝仪式
column11: 1919年，全国有色人种进步协会（NAACP）将“扬声歌唱”作为“黑人国歌”，这首歌是诺福克海军造船厂（NNSY）非裔美国人员工资源小组（AA-ERG）于2月20日举行的第三届黑人历史庆祝活动的一首合适的开场歌。工作人员位于靠近海滨的无障碍地带，当他们唱这首歌时，布莱恩・达登（代码105）和安德烈・约翰逊（代码900T）的声音优美而饱满。Zel Technologies，LLC（ZELTECH）创始人兼首席执行官（CEO）Jack L.Ezzell Jr.是此次活动的发言人。在北卡罗莱纳州出生和长大的埃泽尔讲述了他加入美国空军并后来成为一名成功的非洲裔美国企业家的历程。谈到他在这一过程中所面临的斗争和偏见，他明确表示，他的意图不是让任何人为他人很久以前所做的事情感到羞耻，而是帮助人们理解现在，而不是他的主题“以免我们忘记”。埃泽尔说：“我们可以从审视过去中学到很多东西。”。“这是有用的，因为它可以用来了解人们今天从哪里来。”此外，黑人历史月的存在是为了庆祝那些走在我们前面并为社会现在的自由铺平道路的人。埃泽尔说：“我们在这里退一步，承认非洲裔美国人给我们国家带来的许多伟大礼物。”埃泽尔与造船厂的C.O.R.E.尊重价值观保持一致，并鼓励其他人相互倾听。“与你自己不同观点的人接触，”他敦促道。“用心倾听，而不是愤怒。如果我们彼此倾听，相互尊重，我们就能找到解决当今问题的方法。”

column2: Norwegian ambassador visits Camp Lejeune, Marine Corps Air Station New River
column3:
The Carolina Marine Air Ground Task Force hosted Norwegian Ambassador K?re R. Aas during his visit to North Carolina, April 22-24, 2019.

The ambassador toured Camp Lejeune and Marine Corps Air Station New River to help ensure the relationship between Marines and Norwegians can continue to develop. 

“I always think that working in Washington D.C., you can get an impression or idea of a topic or issue but to better understand something I believe you have to come see it for yourself,” said Aas. “I’ve heard so much about the Marines and I have also spoken to the commander several times but I wanted to see with my own eyes.”

The ambassador, along with his defense attachés, began their visit at MCAS New River and met with Col. Robert Morgan, Marine Aircraft Group-29 commanding officer, before touring multiple units within the 2nd Marine Air Wing. He paid a visit to Marine Heavy Helicopter Squadron 366, Marine Light Attack Helicopter Squadron 269 and Marine Medium Tiltrotor Squadron 365.

“I have been on base for less than a day and I have learned so much,” said Aas. “To hear directly from the pilots about command and control, what can be improved as well as the conditions they operated under, it is important to me.”

The ambassador departed New River and headed toward Camp Lejeune to meet with the Lt. Gen. Robert F. Hedelund, II MEF commanding general, to discuss future training opportunities between the U.S. Marines and the Norwegian Army.

“What I heard from [Lt. Gen.] Hedelund, and his closest advisors, is the continued interest to work with Norway and learn how to operate in arctic environments. Hearing that from them personally is important and it is something I can tell my superiors about,” said Aas. “Having the Marines there on a rotational basis is important in our bilateral relationship between the United States, Norway and the Marines but also as a deterrence measure.” 

Toward the end of his visit, Aas emphasized the importance of the relationship between the Marines and Norway, elaborating on the success of Trident Juncture and the approval of the Norwegian people.

“We have to recognize that the Marines in Norway behave in a very positive manner when interacting with Norwegians. [Respect] is a two-way street and we have worked very closely together, which is why I believe it is so successful,” said Aas. “We are not only exercising [with the U.S.] in Norway, we have been standing shoulder-to-shoulder in Iraq and in Afghanistan. There has always been mutual respect from both countries about the integrity and professionalism of U.S. Marines and Norwegian soldiers.”
column9: 美国北卡罗来纳州勒琼营
column10: 挪威大使访问海军陆战队新河航空站Lejeune营地
column11: 2019年4月22日至24日，在挪威大使K?re R.Aas访问北卡罗来纳州期间，卡罗莱纳州海军陆战队空地特遣部队接待了他。大使参观了勒琼营地和海军陆战队新河航空站，以帮助确保海军陆战队和挪威人之间的关系能够继续发展。Aas说：“我一直认为，在华盛顿工作，你可以对一个主题或问题有一个印象或想法，但为了更好地理解一些东西，我相信你必须亲自来看看。”。“我听说过很多关于海军陆战队的事，我也和指挥官谈过好几次，但我想亲眼看看。”大使和他的国防武官开始了他们在麦卡斯新河的访问，并会见了海军陆战队飞机集团29号指挥官罗伯特・摩根上校，在第二海军航空联队内巡演多个机组之前。他参观了海军陆战队重型直升机中队366、海军陆战队轻型攻击直升机中队269和海军陆战队中型倾转旋翼机中队365。“我在基地呆了不到一天，学到了很多东西，”Aas说。“要直接从飞行员那里了解指挥和控制、可以改进的地方以及他们所处的条件，这对我来说很重要。”大使离开新河，前往Lejeune营地，会见第二代MEF指挥官罗伯特・赫德隆中将，讨论美国海军陆战队和挪威陆军之间未来的训练机会赫德隆德和他最亲密的顾问们一直有兴趣与挪威合作，学习如何在北极环境中运作。亲自听取他们的意见很重要，我可以告诉我的上级，”Aas说。“海军陆战队轮流驻扎在美国、挪威和海军陆战队之间的双边关系中很重要，但也是一种威慑措施。”在访问结束时，Aas强调了海军陆战队和挪威关系的重要性，谈到“三叉戟连接”的成功和挪威人民的认可。“我们必须认识到，挪威海军陆战队在与挪威人互动时表现得非常积极。[尊重]是一条双向的道路，我们一直密切合作，这就是我认为它如此成功的原因，”Aas说。“我们不仅在挪威（与美国）进行演习，我们还在伊拉克和阿富汗并肩作战。两国一直相互尊重美国海军陆战队和挪威士兵的正直和专业精神。”

column2: Norfolk Naval Shipyard Hosts Virtual Celebration in Honor of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.
column3:
Every year in January, the Norfolk Naval Shipyard (NNSY) African American Employee Resource Group (AA-ERG) hosts its annual celebration in honor of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., celebrating his life and accomplishments while also recognizing the federal holiday as a day of service and a time to remember, celebrate, and act. In the wake of the ongoing pandemic, it was clear it would be difficult to host the ceremony like years past C so the AA-ERG took charge in developing a virtual event filmed by NNSY’s Instructional Design Center (Code 1170). 

“It was important for us to find a way to continue our annual celebration and to bring our workforce together in whatever way we could while remaining safe,” said AA-ERG Chair Michael Taylor. “Our team brainstormed ideas and decided to film the program in segments to be included in our first-ever virtual event. The celebration also provides our audience with the opportunity to see this program at any time, so that they don’t miss what’s being shared. It was a big step for us and I’m happy we were able to make it happen.” 
	
While following NNSY COVID-19 guidelines, the virtual event was filmed with participants individually, featuring Shipyard Commander Capt. Dianna Wolfson, Taylor, AA-ERG Co-Chair Ciara Mason, Vocalist Michael Bauswell, and guest speaker Minister Rashad Cartwright of the Experience Life Church in Hampton and Little Piney Grove Baptist Church, the oldest African American Baptist Church in Virginia Beach. The event premiered Jan. 20 at 11 a.m. on NNSY’s social media platforms and Defense Visual Information Distribution Service (DVIDS). 

“Dr. King took tremendous strides to advance civil rights, and inspired our community and country to commit to service, promote the disadvantaged and encourage unity,” said Capt. Wolfson. “His efforts were joined by many others who fought every day to bring equality for all. His words echoed across the country, powerful statements bringing a call to action for others to do their part. With the recent civil unrest in our country, we should each remember his resounding call for equality for all and judging one by the content of their character.  If anything, Dr. King’s words are more important than ever today.” 

Minister Cartwright shared his thoughts on the dedication to service, as well as Dr. King’s legacy as someone who wasn’t afraid to challenge social inequality. “Dr. King lived his life not only for the service of himself but for the service of others. Because true service is the care and consideration one has for the need of others. When we think of the word service C in many ways it is a synonym of the word discomfort. Because true service for a cause, community, or culture causes one to have discomfort,” said Minister Cartwright. “I tell you if there is one word that is manipulative in the English dictionary C it is the word comfortable. Because being too comfortable will keep you hindered. Comfortable will stop your potential for growth. Comfortable will keep people stuck in stagnation when greatness is calling their name. Dr. King knew better than anyone to make a difference, you have to get a little uncomfortable.” 

He continued, “I hope that we all can strive to get a little uncomfortable, to be an agitator, to make a difference - whether it be to feed every child or ensure justice across our land until there is equality for all. Think of it like a washing machine. When you have a stain that is too great, you need some agitation to remove it. Be the agitator. Help make a difference.” 

Capt. Wolfson added, “At America’s Shipyard, we work together as a team leveraging our ideas and our innovations in ship repair and modernization. We are nearly 11,000-members strong and each one of us has an important role to play in maximizing the mission. We are a melting pot of different cultures, ethnicities, genders, races, and more C all coming together to support the U.S. Navy. We are all unique individuals who are key players on the great team that make our shipyard so great. It’s up to every one of us to take care of one another at our shipyard C showing each other the utmost respect and striving each day to do the right thing. We truly are ONE team serving ONE mission.” 

You can watch the video on the NNSY Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/NorfolkNavalShipyard1/posts/10158160879962799, the NNSY YouTube page at https://youtu.be/g6_DWJd6I28and on DVIDS at https://www.dvidshub.net/video/780934/norfolk-naval-shipyard-mlk-celebration-2021.
column9: 美国弗吉尼亚州朴茨茅斯
column10: 诺福克海军造船厂举办虚拟庆典，纪念马丁・路德・金博士。
column11: 每年1月，诺福克海军造船厂（NNSY）非裔美国人员工资源集团（AA-ERG）举办年度庆典，纪念马丁・路德・金博士（Martin Luther King Jr.）的一生和成就，同时也将联邦假日视为服务日和纪念、庆祝和行动的日子。在这场大流行之后，很明显很难像多年前那样举办这场仪式――因此AA-ERG负责开发一个由NNSY教学设计中心拍摄的虚拟活动（代码1170）。AA-ERG主席迈克尔・泰勒（Michael Taylor）说：“对于我们来说，找到一种方法继续我们的年度庆祝活动，并尽可能地将我们的员工聚集在一起，同时保持安全，这一点很重要。”。“我们的团队集思广益，决定将该节目分段拍摄，并将其纳入我们的首次虚拟活动中。庆祝活动还为我们的观众提供了随时观看该节目的机会，这样他们就不会错过正在分享的内容。这对我们来说是迈出了一大步，我很高兴我们能够做到这一点。”在遵循NNSY新冠病毒-19指南的同时，虚拟活动由参与者单独拍摄，参与者包括造船厂指挥官Dianna Wolfson上尉、Taylor、AA-ERG联合主席Ciara Mason、歌手Michael Bauswell以及汉普顿体验生活教堂和小松林浸信会教堂的客座演讲部长Rashad Cartwright，弗吉尼亚海滩最古老的非裔美国浸信会教堂。该活动于1月20日上午11点在NNSY的社交媒体平台和国防可视信息发布服务（DVIDS）上首次亮相。沃尔夫森上尉说：“金博士在推进公民权利方面迈出了巨大的步伐，激励我们的社区和国家致力于服务，促进弱势群体，鼓励团结。”。“他的努力得到了每天为实现人人平等而斗争的许多其他人的支持。他的话在全国各地回响，有力的声明呼吁采取行动，让其他人尽自己的一份力量。在我国最近的内乱中，我们每个人都应该记得他响亮的呼吁人人平等，并根据宪法的内容来判断一个人卡特莱特部长分享了他对服务奉献的看法，以及作为一个不怕挑战社会不平等的人，金博士的遗产。“金博士的一生不仅为自己服务，也为他人服务。因为真正的服务是对他人需要的关心和考虑。当我们想到“服务”这个词时――在许多方面，它是“不适”这个词的同义词。因为真正为某一事业、社区或文化服务会让人产生迪斯科舞厅卡特赖特部长说。“我告诉你，如果在英语词典中有一个词是操纵性的，那就是舒适这个词。因为过于舒适会阻碍你的发展。舒适会阻止你的发展潜力。当伟大呼唤人们的名字时，舒适会让人们陷入停滞。金博士比任何人都更清楚如何做出决定“冷漠，你得有点不舒服。”他继续说，“我希望我们都能努力让自己感到不舒服，成为一个鼓动者，做出改变――无论是喂养每一个孩子，还是确保整个国家的正义，直到人人平等。把它想象成一台洗衣机。当你身上的污渍太大时，你需要一些鼓动来去除它。成为鼓动者。帮助制造污渍。”沃尔夫森上尉补充道，“在美国造船厂，我们作为一个团队一起工作，利用我们在船舶维修和现代化方面的理念和创新。我们有将近11000名成员，我们每个人都在最大限度地实现使命方面发挥着重要作用。我们是不同文化、种族、性别、种族等的大熔炉――所有人都聚集在一起，共同完成这一使命o支持美国海军。我们都是独一无二的个人，都是使我们的造船厂如此伟大的伟大团队中的关键人物。我们每个人都有责任在我们的造船厂相互关照，相互尊重，每天努力做正确的事。我们真的是一个团队，为一项任务服务。”你可以在NNSY的Facebook页面上观看视频https://www.facebook.com/NorfolkNavalShipyard1/posts/10158160879962799，NNSY YouTube页面位于https://youtu.be/g6_DWJd6I28and 关于DVIDS athttps://www.dvidshub.net/video/780934/norfolk-naval-shipyard-mlk-celebration-2021.

column2: Airstreams Renewables, Inc. opens first campus on a Marine Corps base
column3:
Earlier this week, 13 Marines started their first day of class at Airstreams Renewables, Inc. (ARI), aa skill bridge program to help military service members transition into a civilian career after their service. 
“You hear a lot of companies say ‘veteran friendly’ but what does that really mean if you don’t have the proof,” said Brandon Richardson, training specialist. “Airstreams does that. We give training and skills to these transitioning service members to get them certified and make connections with employers.”
ARI is a seven-week course with several modules in the curriculum that leave service members certified in 12 different areas of work. Certifications include  authorized climber and rescue, electrical metering safety, CADWELD and several others.
“Everybody loves service members,” said Andrew Mejia, training supervisor. “We just want to provide the service member, that they already love, with some nationally recognized and nationally accredited skills.”
ARI currently has seven campuses with six of those on military installations.
“This grand opening is our first campus aboard a Marine Corps base,” Mejia said. “They are predominantly for service members who will be leaving the Marine Corps. We have another campus which is also our corporate headquarters out of Tehachapi, California. This is where we send our veterans, civilians and dependents.”
As these transitioning service members complete this course, they will also be placed with a job before the end of their seven weeks.
“The ‘making a connection’ is my favorite part of the company,” Mejia said. “It is called our career placement. Once you are a part of the Airstreams family, you are always a part of the Airstreams family.”
Service members that complete this course at ARI will have a lifetime of help. ARI will continue to go over resumes and mock interviews as well as continue with job placement years after course completion. 
“We don’t give them anything, it is a learning process,” said Richardson. “We’re a family for life, so as a graduate, you can come back to the career placement so that we can help you with what you need toget that next job.”
For more information, call 910-939-6290 or visit www.air-streams.com.
column9: 美国北卡罗来纳州勒琼营
column10: Airstreams可再生能源公司在海军陆战队基地开设了第一个校区
column11: 本周早些时候，13名海军陆战队士兵在Airstreams Renewables，Inc.（ARI）开始了他们的第一天课程。ARI是一个技能桥项目，帮助军人服役后过渡到平民职业。培训专家布兰登・理查森（Brandon Richardson）说：“你听到很多公司都说‘老兵友好’，但如果你没有证据，这到底意味着什么？”。“Airstreams做到了这一点。我们为这些过渡服务人员提供培训和技能，使他们获得认证，并与雇主建立联系。”ARI是一个为期七周的课程，课程中有几个模块，让服务人员在12个不同的工作领域获得认证。培训主管安德鲁・梅加（Andrew Mejia）说：“每个人都喜欢服务人员。”。“我们只想为他们已经热爱的军人提供一些国家认可和国家认可的技能。”阿里目前有七个校区，其中六个在军事设施上。“这是我们在海军陆战队基地的第一个校区，”梅加说。“他们主要面向即将离开海军陆战队的服役人员。我们还有一个校园，也是我们在加利福尼亚州特哈查比的公司总部。这是我们派遣退伍军人、平民和家属的地方。”随着这些过渡服役人员完成本课程，他们还将在七周结束前找到一份工作。“建立联系”是我在公司最喜欢的部分，”Mejia说。“这被称为我们的职业安置。一旦你成为Airstreams家庭的一部分，你就永远是Airstreams家庭的一部分。”在ARI完成此课程的服务人员将得到终生的帮助。ARI将继续审查简历和模拟面试，并在课程结束后几年继续安排工作。理查森说：“我们不给他们任何东西，这是一个学习的过程。”。“我们是一个终生的家庭，所以作为一名毕业生，你可以回到就业岗位，这样我们可以帮助你找到下一份工作。”有关更多信息，请致电910-939-6290或访问www.air-streams.com。

column2: Norfolk Naval Shipyard’s African American Employee Resource Group’s 2nd Annual Open Mic- How Did I Make It?
column3:
As the last of many events celebrating African American History Month in 2020, Norfolk Naval Shipyard’s (NNSY) African American Employee Resource Group (AA-ERG) held its second annual open microphone session. This year, the panel featured five senior level leaders from the Department of Defense (DoD), Naval Criminal Investigative Service (NCIS), Office of Civilian Human Resources (OCHR), and Senior Executive Service (SES) members from Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA). 

The topic was “How Did I Make It?” The panelists answered questions from the audience about what they have learned from their journeys to get to where they are now professionally. Many questions were asked, but the main takeaways for the attendees were these: bring something to the table, keep going, and do not be afraid to ask for help. 

Bring Something to the Table 

Division Head of Human Resources at OCHR Norfolk Operations Center, who services Fleet Forces Command and Commander Navy Reserve Force Danielle Dutton said, “One of the biggest challenges is making sure you are regularly evaluating your skillset. When you are looking for an opportunity, make sure that you look at your resume, that it really conveys everything you do and have done, and that you take credit for what you do on a daily basis.”  

One recurring subject was the value of providing solutions to a problem. SES Deputy Director of Operations Support NCIS Mark N. Russ mentioned when talking about how he came up with a $500 million program for NCIS that took five years to develop. “Think about all those things that are really hard to do and come up with a bright idea to fix it.” 

Keep Going 

When asked about what she has learned from her biggest failure, DoD Associate Director of Diversity Management Operations Center Victoria L. Bowens said, “you cannot be successful if you do not make mistakes. When a job has become too easy, it is time to move, develop, and stretch yourself.” 

In response to the same question, NCIS Division Chief of Special Agent Career Services Angela R. Sanders said that her biggest mistake was letting people in her inner circle hold her back, even though they had good intentions. “There were people who were supportive of me early on in my career, but they were risk-adverse and would say things like ‘you’re probably not ready for that assignment. You should probably go somewhere else before you apply for that position,’ when I was actually ready for advancement.” She then explained how important it was to maintain professional networks outside one’s comfort zone because you are more likely to receive unbiased feedback, which is critical for growth and success.   

Do Not Be Afraid to Ask for Help 

There are people above you in the chain of command who are more than willing to help when asked. To this willingness, Russ pointed out the number of NNSY leaders present and said “They could have been anywhere today. Yet they came to this event―that says that they care about your future.”

Addressing the C.O.R.E. value of Care, the panel touched on how help is available in more than just the professional capacity. When Shipyard Commander Capt. Kai Torkelson asked about how to help federal civilian employees after experiencing trauma as a leader would in active service, Russ told him about the system of peer support that his organization developed and grew in response to similar situations. “It’s okay to ask for help,” Russ added. “You have options.” 

Closing remarks  

 At the end of the panel, each of the panel members were rewarded with a certificate of appreciation from the AA-ERG and a shipyard plaque for imparting their wisdom to the NNSY workforce, but they wanted to emphasize the main points one last time before they left.  

“Get yourself a mentor” SES of the Year and Director of Small Business Programs Jimmy D. Smith said towards the end of the discussion. “Keep growing and keep up the strong desire to do more. If there are roadblocks and you can’t clear them, find someone who can help.” Dutton chimed in and said, “Give it your one hundred percent. Show up, and do the work.”
column9: 美国弗吉尼亚州朴茨茅斯
column10: 诺福克海军造船厂的非裔美国人员工资源小组的第二届年度公开话筒――我是如何做到的？
column11: 作为2020年庆祝非裔美国人历史月的众多活动中的最后一项，诺福克海军造船厂（NNSY）的非裔美国人员工资源小组（AA-ERG）举行了第二届年度公开话筒会议。今年，该小组由国防部（DoD）、海军刑事调查局（NCIS）、文职人力资源办公室（OCHR）的五名高级领导以及海军海洋系统司令部（NAVSEA）的高级执行官组成。主题是“我是如何做到的？”小组成员回答了观众提出的问题，这些问题是关于他们从职业生涯中学到了什么。与会者提出了许多问题，但主要的收获是：带些东西到桌上，继续前进，不要害怕寻求帮助。向OCHR诺福克行动中心人力资源部门负责人提出一些建议，该部门负责为舰队司令部和海军预备役部队司令Danielle Dutton说，“最大的挑战之一是确保你定期评估自己的技能。当你寻找机会时，确保你看了自己的简历，它真实地传达了你所做和所做的一切，并确保你每天都为自己所做的事情感到自豪。”一个反复出现的话题是为问题提供解决方案的价值。SES NCIS运营支持副总监Mark N.Russ在谈到他如何为NCIS制定了一个花费5年时间的5亿美元的项目时提到，“想想所有那些确实很难做到的事情，想出一个好主意来解决它。”当被问及她从自己最大的失败中学到了什么时，国防部多元化管理运营中心副主任维多利亚・L・伯恩斯说：“如果你不犯错误，你就不可能成功。当一项工作变得太容易时，是时候让自己行动、发展和拓展了。”在回答同样的问题时，NCIS特别探员职业服务处处长安吉拉・R・桑德斯（Angela R.Sanders）说，她最大的错误是让她的核心圈子里的人阻止她，尽管他们有良好的意图。“在我职业生涯的早期，有人支持我，但他们对风险持负面态度，他们会说‘你可能还没有准备好接受那项任务。在申请那份工作之前，你可能应该去别的地方’，而我实际上已经准备好晋升了。”然后，她解释了在自己的舒适区之外维持专业关系网是多么重要，因为你更有可能获得公正的反馈，这对成长和成功至关重要。不要害怕寻求帮助在指挥链中，你之上的人在被要求时会非常愿意提供帮助Russ指出了NNSY领导人出席的人数，并说“他们今天可能去了任何地方。但他们来参加这次活动，说他们关心你的未来。”在谈到C.O.R.E.护理的价值时，该小组谈到了如何在不仅仅是专业能力的情况下提供帮助。当造船厂指挥官Kai Torkelson上尉询问如何帮助联邦文职雇员在经历了作为现役领导人的创伤后，Russ告诉他，他的组织tion在类似情况下发展壮大。“寻求帮助是可以的，”Russ补充道，“你有选择。”闭幕词在小组结束时，每个小组成员都获得了AA-ERG颁发的感谢证书和造船厂牌匾，以表彰他们向NNSY员工传授了自己的智慧，但他们想在离开前最后一次强调要点。“给自己找个导师”年度SES和小企业项目总监吉米・D・史密斯在讨论结束时说：“继续成长，保持做更多事情的强烈愿望。如果有路障，你无法清除，请找一个能帮助你的人。”达顿插嘴说，“全力以赴。来吧，做你的工作。”

column2: African American-ERG Hosts Annual MLK Celebration
column3:
The Norfolk Naval Shipyard (NNSY) African American Employment Resource Group (AA-ERG) hosted its annual Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Celebration Jan. 16 to honor the life and accomplishments of the late civil rights leader.

Martin Luther King Jr. Day, celebrated on the third Monday of January, coincides with King’s birthday. Known widely as a day of service, the theme observed each year is, “Remember. Celebrate. Act. A day on, not a day off.” The day provides those with an opportunity to not only remember the impact Dr. King had on the world, but also an opportunity to service their community.

“Dr. King was a man who put purpose above self,” said Shipyard Commander Capt. Kai Torkelson. “He gave his time and effort to make a change. And his legacy continues to live on to this day.” 

Torkelson continued, “We at America’s Shipyard follow in King’s footsteps to make lasting change. Every problem we face is an opportunity to make lasting change for the community, for the country, and for the world. We can serve others with our actions, our ambitions, and our drive. There is always work to be done and it takes that desire and that dream to make it a reality.” 

Rev. Dr. Jacqueline Hardy-Harris was the guest speaker for the event. She spoke of King’s dreams and efforts to bring equal rights to the forefront of America. 

“King was more than a civil rights leader. He was a prophet for change,” said Hardy-Harris. “He was not afraid to face what would test his faith. His efforts were catapulted in the national gaze. His non-violent campaigns were instrumental in the civil rights movement and ensuring equal rights in our country.” 

“King lived in constant danger for his dreams and actions. He was relentlessly harassed and jailed,” she added. “Yet he persevered. He would not back down from the fight. Because he believed that what he did was right.” 

Hardy-Harris then shared how King inspired her personally. “When I was nine years old, I had a dream of being a police officer,” she said. “There were no women on TV that were black and police officers and there were no black women on the police force. People would question my dream but I didn’t care. I wanted to be a police officer and help people. Just as King had a dream and fought to make it happen, so would I.” 

She continued, “In 1981, I was the first African American female officer assigned to the Kendall District in Miami. Within a year, I was promoted to detective and worked undercover in vice, narcotics, robbery and homicide. It was dangerous work and there were many days where I was scared for my life. But I enjoyed my career because I was making a difference. I was fulfilling a dream I had since I was a little girl. It was my destiny. King said I could do whatever I put my mind to. So I accomplished what I set out to do.” 

Torkelson said in closing, “At NNSY, our mission is any ship, any time, anywhere. Today’s message from Dr. Hardy-Harris is about turning dreams into reality and working to honor King’s legacy to guarantee equal rights and opportunities for all. In our command philosophy, we speak on the people being at the heart of our mission. We’re trying to build to our fullest potential as a high performing team that treats one another exceptionally well. By following that philosophy, we build on Care, Ownership, Respect, and Excellence C C.O.R.E. King once said, ‘life’s most persistent and urgent question C what are you doing for others?’ I encourage each of you to think on those words. We are entrusted with continuing the legacy of King and do our part to make positive change.” 

The NNSY AA-ERG’s goal is promoting economic opportunities, providing mechanisms for inclusion, and facilitating growth and advocacy by increasing knowledge and appreciation for the historical and cultural heritage of African Americans throughout NNSY and the surrounding communities. 

The NNSY AA-ERG meets the third Thursday of every month in Bldg. M-1 from 1:30 to 3 p.m. All shipyard employees, Sailors, and tenants are invited to attend. For more information, please contact Mike Taylor at 967-3286 or email Michael.Taylor7@navy.mil.

column10: 非裔美国人ERG举办一年一度的MLK庆祝活动
column11: 诺福克海军造船厂（NNSY）非裔美国人就业资源集团（AA-ERG）于1月16日举办了一年一度的马丁・路德・金博士庆祝活动，以纪念这位已故民权领袖的一生和成就。马丁・路德・金纪念日在1月的第三个星期一，恰逢金的生日。每年的主题是“记住。庆祝。行动。一天开始，而不是一天休息”。这一天不仅让人们记住金博士对世界的影响，也让人们有机会为自己的社区服务。“金博士是一个将目标置于自我之上的人。”船厂指挥官凯・托克尔森上尉说。托克尔森继续说道：“他付出了时间和努力来做出改变。他的遗产一直延续到今天。”，“我们在美国造船厂追随金的脚步，实现持久的变革。我们面临的每一个问题都是一个为社会、国家和世界实现持久变革的机会。我们可以用我们的行动、我们的雄心壮志和我们的动力为他人服务。总有工作要做，而这需要我们的愿望和梦想。”这是一个现实。“杰奎琳・哈迪・哈里斯牧师博士是这次活动的客座发言人。她谈到了金的梦想以及为将平等权利带到美国前线所做的努力。”哈迪・哈里斯说：“金不仅仅是一位民权领袖。他是一位变革的先知。”。她补充说：“他不怕面对考验他的信仰的事情。他的努力在全国范围内大放异彩。他的非暴力运动在民权运动和确保我国的平等权利方面发挥了重要作用。”“金因为他的梦想和行动而活在不断的危险中。他遭到无情的骚扰和监禁。”。“但他坚持了下来。他不会放弃战斗。因为他相信自己所做的是正确的。”哈迪・哈里斯随后分享了金如何亲自激励她。“当我九岁时，我梦想成为一名警官，”她说。“电视上没有黑人女性和警察，警察队伍中也没有黑人女性。人们会质疑我的梦想，但我不在乎。我想成为一名警察，帮助人们。正如金有一个梦想，并为实现这一梦想而奋斗，我也会这样做。”她继续说道，“1981年，我是第一位被派到迈阿密肯德尔区的非裔美国女警官。不到一年，我就被提升为侦探，并在卖淫、毒品、抢劫和杀人等领域从事卧底工作。这是一项危险的工作，有很多天我都为自己的生命感到恐惧。但我很享受我的职业生涯，因为我正在发挥作用。我实现了我小时候的梦想。这是我的命运。金说我可以做任何我想做的事。所以我完成了我开始做的事。”托克尔森在结束时说，“在NNSY，我们的使命是任何船只、任何时间、任何地点。哈迪・哈里斯博士今天的讲话是关于将梦想变为现实，并致力于尊重金的遗产，以保障所有人的平等权利和机会。在我们的指挥哲学中，我们谈到人民是我们使命的核心。我们正在努力实现我们最大的目标作为一支表现出色、彼此相处异常融洽的团队，我们秉承这一理念，建立在关怀、所有权、尊重和卓越的基础上――C.O.R.E.金曾说过，“生命中最持久、最紧迫的问题――你在为他人做什么？”我鼓励你们每个人思考这些话。我们被委托给C.O.R.E.金继续继承国王的遗产，尽我们的力量做出积极的改变。”NNSY AA-ERG的目标是促进经济机会，提供包容机制，通过增加对整个NNSY和周边社区的非裔美国人历史和文化遗产的了解和欣赏，促进增长和宣传。NNSY AA-ERG将于每月的第三个星期四在Bl举行会议dg.M-1下午1:30至3:00。欢迎所有船厂员工、水手和承租人参加。有关更多信息，请致电967-3286联系Mike Taylor或发送电子邮件给Michael。Taylor7@navy.mil.

column2: NNSY ERG Spotlight- African American Employee Resource Group
column3:
Norfolk Naval Shipyard’s (NNSY) African American C Employee Resource Group (AA-ERG) is one of seven ERGs hosted NNSY. Its goal is to be a place where an employee can go to get resources to help better both the shipyard and employee.

“The name of the ERG can be misleading,” said AA-ERG’s Chair, Michael Taylor. “The AA-ERG is open to all races, creeds, religions and so forth.”

The AA-ERG hosts the annual Martin Luther King, Jr. celebration every January as well as a variety of events during February for African American History Month. 

“This is a chance to remind everyone of the struggles and experiences that our ancestors went through,” said AA-ERG member, Ashley Chew. “Some people take for granted the freedom and opportunities that we have today.”

“We share the past so we can better ourselves in the future,” said Taylor. “We have to remember that we can’t change the past, but we can change the future.”

The AA-ERG helps to introduce people to opportunities. Members mentor and coach other shipyard employees so that they can reach their career and personal goals. They also promote internal job opportunities.

“We’re also a group where one can come to discuss matters and to vent,” said Taylor. “It’s a chance to learn from each other and to provide and receive perspectives on any given situation.”

If employees are having challenges with a variety of shipyard matters, they have a place to go to find out what is the best action to take.

“The AA-ERG helps employees by showing them not every issue needs to go to the Equal Opportunity Office,” said Taylor. “There are other ways that an issue could be resolved and we provide the resources to show them the way.”

The AA-ERG also partners with NNSY’s other resource groups.
“Throughout the year we join forces with the other shipyard ERGs,” said Taylor. “Working with other groups like the Federal Women’s Program, Native American Heritage C ERG and the others gives us a chance to show that we are all on one team. We all have the same kind of issues.”

For more information on AA-ERG, please contact Michael Taylor at 967-3286, Michael.taylor7@navy.mil.
column9: 美国弗吉尼亚州朴茨茅斯
column10: NNSY ERG聚光灯-非裔美国人员工资源组
column11: 诺福克海军造船厂（NNSY）的非裔美国人雇员资源小组（AA-ERG）是由NNSY主办的七个ERG之一。它的目标是成为一个员工可以获得资源的地方，以更好地帮助造船厂和员工。“ERG的名称可能会产生误导，”AA-ERG的主席迈克尔・泰勒（Michael Taylor）说。“AA-ERG向所有种族、信仰、宗教等开放。”AA-ERG每年1月都会举办一年一度的马丁・路德・金庆祝活动，并在2月为非洲裔美国人历史月举办各种活动。AA-ERG成员Ashley Chew说：“这是一个提醒大家我们祖先所经历的斗争和经历的机会。”。泰勒说：“有些人认为我们今天拥有的自由和机会是理所当然的。”“我们分享过去，这样我们就能在未来变得更好。”。“我们必须记住，我们不能改变过去，但我们可以改变未来。”AA-ERG有助于向人们介绍机会。成员指导和指导其他造船厂员工，使他们能够实现职业和个人目标。他们还促进内部就业机会。“我们也是一个可以讨论问题和发泄的团体，”泰勒说。“这是一个相互学习的机会，可以提供和接受对任何特定情况的看法。”如果员工在各种造船厂事务中遇到挑战，他们可以去寻找最佳行动。泰勒说：“AA-ERG通过向员工展示并非所有问题都需要提交平等机会办公室来帮助他们。解决问题还有其他方法，我们提供资源向他们展示方法。”AA-ERG还与NNSY的其他资源小组合作。泰勒说：“在这一年中，我们与其他造船厂ERG联手。与联邦妇女计划、美洲原住民遗产――ERG等其他组织合作，让我们有机会表明我们都是一个团队。我们都有同样的问题。”有关AA-ERG的更多信息，请致电967-3286与Michael Taylor联系。taylor7@navy.mil.

column2: The amphibious tip of the spear
column3:
MARINE CORPS BASE CAMP PENDLETON, California C Amphibious warfare is the  cornerstone of how the Marine Corps trains and fights. For Assault Amphibious Vehicle (AAV) crewmen or Amtrackers as they are often identified, the role is critical and contributes immensely to the Marine Corps warfighting capability. “AAV crewman are the tip of the spear when it comes to amphibious operations,” said U.S. Marine Corps Sgt. Kevin Storman, instructor, Assault Amphibian School (AAS) Battalion, Training Command. 

At AAS the curriculum is focused on training Marines in the military occupational field of an AAV  crewmen, which entails learning the base knowledge of how to operate, fix and tactically employ an AAV. 

The AAV crewmen course is 55 training days long. In the first phase of the course, Marines are taught how to drive an AAV on land. The second phase teaches the basics for water driving and the third phase teaches employment of the vehicle’s two weapon systems; the  MK19 40 mm grenade launcher and the M2   .50 caliber machine gun. In the final portion of the course, students learn how the AAV compliments non-motorized infantry forces, and advanced amphibious assault tactics.

“We teach the students everything from starting the vehicle to all the components on the vehicle and what they are called,” said Storman. “We also teach them how to drive the AAV on land and on in the water. Finally, how to shoot the vehicle weapons and how to employ them tactically.” 

Amphibious assault school’s instructors are hand-picked for being the best in their community, and because they possess increased levels of experience. The greatest advantage of this selection process is that it ensures their knowledge and expertise is passed to new students, and that the probability of continued success on the battlefield improves. 

“Amtraking  isn’t just about what you learn in the classroom, it’s about what you can come up with on the fly,” said Storman. “As an amtraker you have to be able to think on your feet. Come up with the best solution for the situation that is going to help you to complete the overall mission.” 

AAVs transport Marines from ship to shore and can move inland up to 200 miles supporting the infantry along the way with fire power and supply.  

“The amtrak community is very prideful in what we do,” said Storman. “We are what makes the Marine Corps amphibious, and we believe that to the core of our soul. We take what we do very seriously and we are some of the hardest working Marines  you will find.”          

Storman said it is important to continue to pass AAV skills down to new Marines to keep the Marine Corps alive and fighting hard. Adding that the “ball needs to keep rolling,” and AAV crewman must keep applying their knowledge and skills now and with future amphibious vehicle technologies.

U.S. Marine Corps Pvt. Abel Vasquez, a student currently going through the AAV crewman course stated: “My goal for the future is to be like my instructors.   I want to be as good at being an AAV crewman as my instructors so in the future I can pass on that information to younger Marines. I hope I can build that foundation for future Marines.”
column9: 美国加利福尼亚州彭德尔顿营地
column10: 矛的两栖尖端
column11: 加利福尼亚州彭德尔顿海军陆战队大本营――两栖作战是海军陆战队训练和作战的基石。对于经常被识别的突击两栖车辆（AAV）乘员或AMTRACKER而言，该角色至关重要，并对海军陆战队的作战能力做出了巨大贡献。训练司令部突击两栖动物学校（AAS）营讲师、美国海军陆战队中士凯文・斯托曼（Kevin Storman）说：“在两栖作战中，AAV乘员是最重要的。”。AAS的课程重点是在AAV乘员的军事职业领域培训海军陆战队，这需要学习如何操作、修理和战术使用AAV的基本知识。AAV乘员课程为期55天。在课程的第一阶段，海军陆战队将学习如何在陆地上驾驶AAV。第二阶段讲授水上驾驶的基础知识，第三阶段讲授车辆两种武器系统的使用；MK19 40毫米榴弹发射器和M2.50口径机枪。在本课程的最后一部分，学生们将学习AAV如何与非机动化步兵部队和先进的两栖攻击战术相结合。“我们教给学生从启动车辆到车辆上的所有部件以及它们被称为什么的一切。”斯托曼说。“我们还教他们如何在陆上和水中驾驶AAV。最后，如何射击车辆武器以及如何在战术上使用它们。”两栖突击学校的教员是经过精心挑选的社区中最好的，因为他们拥有更高水平的经验。这一选拔过程的最大优势在于，它确保了他们的知识和专业技能被传递给新生，并且提高了在战场上继续取得成功的概率。斯托曼说：“美国铁路公司不仅仅是你在课堂上学到了什么，而是你能在飞行中想出什么。”。“作为一名美国铁路公司，你必须能够独立思考。为这种情况想出最好的解决方案，帮助你完成整个任务。”AAV将海军陆战队从一艘船运送到岸上，并可以向内陆移动200英里，沿途为步兵提供火力和补给。斯托曼说：“美国铁路公司（amtrak）社区对我们所做的事情感到非常自豪。”。斯托曼说：“我们是海军陆战队水陆两栖作战的关键，我们坚信这一点。我们非常认真地对待我们所做的事情，我们是你会发现的最努力的海军陆战队中的一员。”继续将AAV技能传授给新的海军陆战队以保持海军陆战队的活力和战斗力是很重要的。他还补充道，“球需要继续滚动”，AAV乘员必须继续运用他们的知识和技能，无论是现在还是将来的两栖车辆技术。现役海军陆战队队员PVT阿贝尔巴斯克斯是一名AAV船员课程的学生，他说：“我未来的目标是像我的教练一样，我想成为一名AAV船员，就像我的教练一样，所以将来我可以把这些信息传递给年轻的海军陆战队。我希望我能为未来的海军陆战队建立基础。”

column2: Improving leadership from the inside out
column3:
MARINE CORPS BASE CAMP PENDLETON, California C “Don’t be afraid to try it,” proclaimed Staff Sgt. Molly Koman, platoon sergeant, 3rd Assault Amphibian Battalion,1st Marine Division. “With the 21 Area Mentorship Workshop Program, all are welcome. It’s a great opportunity to learn from Marines of different ranks; learning how to be better leaders so we can mold others to exceed the expectations that we have for the future of the Marine Corps.” 

Capt. Tonie Williams, logistics officer, Assault Amphibian School Battalion (AAS Bn), Training Command, created the 21 Area Mentorship Workshop Program in June of this year. The workshop is held at the Del Mar Beach Resort bi-monthly and open to anyone who has base access. The program’s mission is to encourage leaders to strive to be their best self by bettering one another mentally, emotionally, physically and spiritually. Overall this workshop prepares leaders for some of the unique challenges they could potentially face in constantly changing environments. The course introduces participants to diverse training, perspectives and resources that show leaders how to improve their skills in working with co-workers and peers in their everyday lives and professional careers. 

“My intention is to work from the inside out because there are so many different types of leaders,” Williams said. “I really want to create that space for people to start or keep exercising that [mental] muscle as a leader.”

The 21 Area Mentorship Workshop Program works to unite Marines, Sailors and civilians from all walks of life, both personal and professional on MCB Camp Pendleton. They are encouraged to work and learn from one another to gain new perspectives in achieving goals. The program additionally focuses on different types of spiritualties to create stronger self-awareness. 

The workshop typically begins with a group activity called “the human knot,” which promotes teamwork and communication, and then immediately followed by team discussion. The participants then conduct yoga, also lead by Williams and Anna Packham, a yoga instructor with Marine Corps Community Services. After yoga, attendees are given an hour for lunch and a discussion about nutrition. The next activity called “the perfect circle,” is designed to strengthen leadership skills before concluding the workshop with one more group discussion. 

“The yoga was my favorite,” exclaimed Pfc. Cameron McCain, assault amphibian vehicle technician, AAS Bn, Training Command. “The yoga was unexpectedly hard. Some were better than others but I think that’s part of the lesson. Not everyone is equal, but we all still have to do our best.”

Williams said that working on spiritual fitness gives her a clear understanding of her goals. This in-turn, creates a better relationship with her Marines where she is able to understand and respect that everyone is unique. 

“You hear the saying that we have to be a well-rounded Marine all the time,” Koman said. “Most of the time, it’s misconstrued as we have to get a 300 on our [Combat Fitness Test], be an expert on the range, and get your [Professional Military Education] done. You also need to practice your core beliefs and values. It’s important to have those building blocks as an individual so that when you go into work and you have to lead others, you’ll be ready because you’ve already taken those steps.” 

For more information on the 21 Area Mentorship Workshop Program or for registration inquiries, email Capt. Williams at tonie.williams@usmc.mil or Staff Sgt. Koman at molly.koman@usmc.mil.
column9: 美国加利福尼亚州彭德尔顿营地
column10: 从内而外提高领导能力
