In a message that resonated with BAE’s workforce, Mullins stressed the collective responsibility everyone has to provide the best possible products to protect the men and women serving our nation.

“What you do matters and how well you do it is significantly important to the lives of Marines," said Mullins to the workforce. “It’s important that we―the collective we―give Marines the very best pieces of equipment, specifically, the very best vehicles we can provide to them. What you do is a matter of life or death for a Marine on the battlefield."
 
From a high-level perspective, building each ACV is not unlike building a car, albeit a highly sophisticated one. Pieces must be welded together, parts will be integrated and the systems require safety testing once assembled.

Though certain components of the vehicle may be built elsewhere, each vehicle itself is integrated and assembled at York. For a day, the Marine Corps customers were given a behind-the-scenes glimpse of this all in action.

“Seeing the ACV in its various stages of production―from bits and pieces of metal to a full tactical combat vehicle―was definitely enlightening to me,” said Maj. Mark Patridge, a logistics officer from 3rd AA Bn. “What surprised me during our visit―aside from the high-tech stuff that they have there to put the vehicles together―was the level of artisanry, individual skills and personal work required to build each vehicle. It’s actually a very high quality piece of equipment that has had a lot of personal time, personal attention and expertise put into it to be able to provide all of the capabilities that the ACV provides.”

The ACV is the Corps’ answer to the decades-old Assault Amphibious Vehicle, which has been in service since the 1970s. A next-generation vehicle designed to provide increased lethality, survivability and protected mobility to the warfighter, the ACV will be carrying and fighting alongside Marines for generations to come.

“The ACV represents a new chapter in the development of amphibious combat systems, not only building on lessons learned within the amphibious assault community, but also outside the community with its advanced communications systems, weapons systems and the safety features the ACV has to offer,” said Patridge. “The ACV has the potential to enable many of the fundamental concepts―like expeditionary advanced base operations and distributed operations―that the Marine Corps is trying to put into practice.”

The Marine Corps started accepting delivery of the ACV earlier this summer. The AAA program office is currently conducting live fire testing and performing logistics demonstration procedures on the vehicles in preparation for integration, operational tests and evaluation scheduled for next summer.
column9: 美国宾夕法尼亚州约克
column10: 海军陆战队与两栖作战车辆制造商会面
column11: 宾夕法尼亚州约克――第三突击两栖作战营的海军陆战队预定接收美国陆军陆战队第一辆新型两栖作战车辆，他们有难得的机会参观ACV的主要生产设施，并与制造车辆的工人会面。10月16日，采办项目经理的代表在采办项目执行官陆地系统部、海军陆战队作战发展司令部、作战发展与集成部和第三陆军基地高级两栖攻击部任职。参观了位于宾夕法尼亚州约克市的ACV主要生产设施之一，参观了装配线，并与负责制造美国陆军新一代车辆的承包商交谈。美国汽车协会（AAA）的项目经理柯克・马林斯（Kirk Mullins）表示，此次活动是他本人和汽车制造商BAE领导层之间的集体决定。马林斯说：“我们认为，让工作人员与他们正在为之建造车辆的一些海军陆战队士兵会面，他们将驾驶这些车辆并使用这些车辆，这对他们来说确实是一件好事。”。“从海军的角度来看，我们通常处于‘接收’新设备的模式，但我们从未真正理解或欣赏制造该设备所花费的工作量和精力。”在访问期间，马林斯和他的团队强调了按时向BAE员工交付高质量车辆的重要性。在与BAE员工产生共鸣的信息中，马林斯强调了每个人都有集体责任提供最好的产品，以保护为国家服务的男男女女。“你做什么以及你做得如何对海军陆战队的生活至关重要，”马林斯对工作人员说。“重要的是，我们集体向海军陆战队提供最好的装备，特别是我们能提供给他们的最好的交通工具。你所做的事关系到一名海军陆战队在战场上的生死。”从高层次的角度来看，制造每一辆ACV与制造一辆汽车没有什么不同，尽管这是一辆非常复杂的汽车。零件必须焊接在一起，零件将集成在一起，系统组装后需要进行安全测试。尽管车辆的某些部件可能在其他地方制造，但每辆汽车本身都是在约克进行集成和组装的。For一天，海军陆战队的客户们在幕后看到了这一切。美国陆军第三航空局Bn的后勤官马克・帕特里奇少校说：“看到ACV从零碎的金属到完整的战术战车的各个生产阶段，对我来说无疑是一种启发。”。“在我们访问期间，除了他们用来组装汽车的高科技设备外，让我惊讶的是制造每辆汽车所需的工匠水平、个人技能和个人工作。我认为，这实际上是一件非常高质量的设备，拥有大量的个人时间、个人注意力和专业知识我们希望它能够提供ACV提供的所有功能。”ACV是美国陆军对已有数十年历史的两栖攻击车的回应，自20世纪70年代以来一直在服役。ACV是一种旨在为作战人员提供更高杀伤力、生存能力和机动保护的下一代车辆，将在未来几代人中与海军陆战队并肩作战。帕特里奇说：“ACV代表着两栖作战系统发展的新篇章，它不仅借鉴了两栖攻击社区内的经验教训，而且借鉴了社区外先进的通信系统、武器系统以及ACV必须提供的安全功能。”。“ACV有潜力实现海军陆战队正在尝试实施的许多基本概念，如远征先进基地作战和分布式作战。”海军陆战队今年夏天早些时候开始接受ACV的交付。AAA项目办公室目前正在对车辆进行实弹测试和后勤演示程序，为明年夏天计划的集成、作战测试和评估做准备。

column2: RHC-P empowers Soldiers through NIMS
column3:
HONOLULU, Hawaii (Feb. 21, 2017) -- Regional Health Command-Pacific (RHC-P) has rolled out the Army’s Not in My Squad (NIMS) initiative C a grass roots approach to creating a climate of dignity, respect and cohesion.

The Army leadership series builds upon the premise that the best place to check the pulse of an organization and to impact change is at the squad level.  

RHC-P Sexual Harassment/Assault Response and Prevention Program Manager, Master Sgt. Kevin Edmondson has spearheaded the workshop initiative for select sergeant and staff sergeant Medical Command (MEDCOM) Soldiers in the Pacific region and says the seminar is structured to test and assess the state of trust and cohesion of squad units, the foundation upon which the Army builds its formations. “During the workshop, participants are asked questions that get them thinking about the challenges that they may be facing. Often times, they realize that the challenges they’ve identified might be shared across the group and that they already have a solution from within their group that can be implemented immediately. This is what our  program facilitators strive to accomplish C to empower squad leaders to not only voice their challenges, but to provide potential solutions in an effort to build and  maintain dignity and respect throughout the command,” said Edmondson. 

Staff Sgt. Dawn Irvine an RHC-P NIMS facilitator, says the initiative reshapes the way change can be made in the Army.  “We’re empowering junior NCOs to come up with their own ways to solve challenges at their level versus having to always to get the solutions from up top. When Soldiers feel they can make change at their level, it helps foster a better environment and culture across the entire team,” she said. 

NIMS is essentially helping Soldiers become better NCOs. With such an important focus, facilitators took extra steps to ensure maximum impact. “We took the Soldiers away from their daily work areas and placed them in a neutral setting and also allowed them to wear civilian attire for the week,” said Edmondson. “This took away uniform barriers and allowed the squad units to more freely speak their minds,” he said.

The workshop concludes with Soldiers briefing any challenges that can’t be solved at their levels to leaders, along with potential solutions. RHC-P command teams can then implement a plan of action to address legitimate concerns that may arise during the NIMS workshop in order to affect positive change, strengthen the organization and improve the Army leadership culture as a whole.

Edmondson, who helped RHC-P become the first organization in the active Army to independently, and without on-site assistance from the Center for the Army Profession and Ethics (CAPE) and Army Research Institute (ARI)  launch the NIMS program, is now set to lead an Army Medical Command-level workshop, along with other RHC-P leaders, Sgt. 1st Class Kristen Stall, Staff Sgt. India Marquez, Staff Sgt. Trisha Ronk and Staff Sgt. Dawn Irvine, March 1-3, 2017. 

Attendees at the workshop will include select non-commissioned officers from all organizations within MEDCOM.

About RHC-P:

RHC-P's mission is to provide Combatant Commanders with medically ready forces and ready medical forces conducting health service support in all phases of military operation.
column9: 檀香山，你好，美国
column10: RHC-P通过NIMS授权士兵
column11: 夏威夷火奴鲁鲁（2017年2月21日）--太平洋地区卫生司令部（RHC-P）推出了陆军的“不在我的队伍中”（NIMS）计划，这是一种创造尊严氛围的基层方法，尊重和凝聚力。陆军领导系列建立在这样一个前提之上，即检查组织脉搏和影响变革的最佳场所是在班一级。RHC-P性骚扰/攻击应对和预防计划经理凯文・埃德蒙森上士带头为太平洋地区的精选军士和参谋军士医疗司令部（MEDCOM）士兵举办了研讨会，并表示研讨会旨在测试和评估班单位的信任和凝聚力，军队建立它的阵地的基础。“在研讨会期间，向参与者提问，让他们思考他们可能面临的挑战。通常情况下，他们意识到他们发现的挑战可能会在整个团队中共享，并且他们已经从团队内部找到了可以立即实施的解决方案。这就是我们的项目m协导员努力做到――让班长不仅能够表达他们的挑战，而且能够提供潜在的解决方案，努力在整个指挥部建立和维护尊严和尊重，”Edmondson说。RHC-P NIMS调解人、参谋中士道恩・欧文（Dawn Irvine）说，这项计划重塑了军队变革的方式。她说：“我们正在授权初级士官想出他们自己的方法来解决他们级别的挑战，而不是总是从上级那里得到解决方案。当士兵们觉得他们可以在他们级别上做出改变时，这有助于在整个团队中培养更好的环境和文化。”。尼姆基本上是在帮助士兵成为更好的士官。有了这样一个重要的重点，主持人采取了额外的步骤以确保产生最大的影响。埃德蒙森说：“我们把士兵们从日常工作区带走，把他们安置在一个中立的环境中，并允许他们在一周内穿平民服装。”。他说：“这消除了制服上的障碍，让小队能够更自由地表达自己的想法。”研讨会结束时，士兵们向领导介绍了他们级别无法解决的任何挑战，以及可能的解决方案。然后，RHC-P指挥团队可以实施一项行动计划，以解决NIMS研讨会期间可能出现的合理问题，从而影响积极变革，加强组织并改善整个陆军领导文化。Edmondson帮助RHC-P成为现役陆军中第一个独立，在没有陆军职业道德中心（CAPE）和陆军研究所（ARI）的现场协助的情况下，NIMS计划的启动，现在将与其他RHC-P领导人、一级克里斯汀・斯泰尔中士、印度马奎兹中士、特里沙・朗克中士和道恩・欧文中士一起领导陆军医疗指挥级研讨会，2017年3月1日至3日。参加研讨会的人员将包括来自MEDCOM内所有组织的精选士官。关于RHC-P：RHC-P的任务是为作战指挥官提供医疗准备部队，以及在军事行动的所有阶段提供医疗服务支持的医疗准备部队。

column2: USAID senior advisor visits RHC-P
column3: HONOLULU-- Natalie Freeman, U.S. Pacific Command’s (PACOM) Senior Development Advisor for U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) visited Regional Health Command-Pacific (RHC-P) on Dec. 15. During the meeting Freeman received a command briefing which included an in-depth discussion with RHC-P leaders focusing on scaling up interagency global health engagements. Brig. Gen. Ronald T. Stephens, deputy commanding general, RHC-P, provided Freeman with background on the U.S. Army Medicine transformation in the Indo-Asia-Pacific region and the various capabilities of RHC-P’s nine direct reporting units. Freeman presented an overview of the USAID organization, portfolios and capabilities with a focus on the PACOM area of responsibility.  RHC-P’s future collaboration with USAID include areas of interest such as maternal and child health, environmental health, infectious disease and health systems strengthening.
column9: 檀香山，你好，美国
column10: 美国国际开发署高级顾问访问RHC-P
column11: 檀香山――12月15日，美国太平洋司令部（PACOM）驻美国国际开发署（USAID）高级发展顾问娜塔莉・弗里曼访问了太平洋地区卫生司令部（RHC-P）。会议期间，弗里曼听取了指挥部简报，其中包括与RHC-P领导人深入讨论，重点是扩大跨机构全球卫生服务。布里格。RHC-P副司令罗纳德・斯蒂芬斯（Ronald T.Stephens）将军向弗里曼介绍了印度-亚太地区美国陆军医学转型的背景以及RHC-P九个直接报告单位的各种能力。弗里曼概述了美国国际开发署的组织、投资组合和能力，重点介绍了PACOM责任领域。RHC-P未来与美国国际开发署的合作包括母婴健康、环境健康、传染病和加强卫生系统等感兴趣的领域。

column2: RHC-P participates in annual AMSUS meeting
column3:
(WASHINGTON) -- Regional Health Command-Pacific’s (RHC-P) global health engagement team recently participated in the Association of Military Surgeons United States’ (AMSUS) 125th annual meeting. Lt. Col. Derek Licina, chief, global health engagements and Brad Cogswell, Deputy Chief, global health engagements offered a presentation and displayed a poster titled “Army Medicine Transformation in the Pacific: Enhancing Theater Security Cooperation While Generating Readiness”. The material described the policies and procedures the team used to improve the quantity and quality of global health engagements used in the Pacific region.

The information generated interest among attendees from all service branches as a way to standardize global health efforts, approaches and standard operating procedures for future global health engagements.
column9: 檀香山，你好，美国
column10: RHC-P参加年度AMSU会议
column11: （华盛顿）――太平洋地区卫生司令部（RHC-P）的全球卫生参与团队最近参加了美国军事外科医生协会（AMSUS）第125届年会。全球卫生行动负责人德里克・利西纳中校和全球卫生行动副负责人布拉德・科格斯韦尔中校作了介绍，并展示了一张题为“太平洋地区的陆军医学转型：在做好准备的同时加强战区安全合作”的海报。该材料描述了团队用于提高太平洋地区全球卫生服务的数量和质量的政策和程序。这些信息引起了所有服务部门与会者的兴趣，作为全球卫生工作标准化的一种方式，未来全球卫生服务的方法和标准操作程序。

column2: Pendleton Marines put Amphibious Combat Vehicle to the test
column3:
The world is constantly advancing around us. As the most feared fighting force in the world, it is imperative Marines advance their capabilities along with it. The Corps’ new Amphibious Combat Vehicle is here to improve Marines’ amphibious capabilities. 

Marines with the Amphibious Vehicle Test Branch, Marine Corps Tactical Systems Support Activity, tested the ACV’s maneuverability and performance during low-light and night operations on Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton’s beaches, Dec. 16-18. The Marines spent hours driving ACVs the Southern California surf and in the open ocean to assess how well they could interface with the vehicle and conduct operations in low light.
  
“AVTB has been on Camp Pendleton since 1943,” said David Sandvold, the director of operations for AVTB. “We are the only branch in the military who uses our warfighters to test equipment that is in development.” 

The ACV will be replacing the Amphibious Assault Vehicle starting in late 2020. The AAV has been in service since 1972, serving in countries around the world. The AAV has been the go-to vehicle to carry Marines and gear from ship to shore, but with adversaries around the world growing more powerful, the ACV was created to enhance the capabilities of ship to shore missions and amphibious assaults. 

The ACV will come in four different variants derived from the armored personnel carrier base. There’s a recovery variant, a command and control variant, and an up-armed variant to engage enemy armored vehicles. Each ACV comes equipped with eight wheels instead of the tracks originally on the AAV. 

“It’s a huge difference on how the ACV and the AAV drive and handle,” said Marine Sgt. Fernando Alvarez, an AAV operator with AVTB. “The main difference (with wheels) is that it’s a lot faster on land. But instead of pivoting like the AAV, we have to make three-point turns now, which is not a problem.”
 
The ACV powers through high surf, traverses over trenches and trucks over sloped terrain. The ACV’s significant protective assets make it resilient to direct attacks and allow it to operate with degraded mobility in an ever-changing battle environment. The vehicle possesses sufficient lethality to deliver accurate fire support to infantry, whether stationary or on the move.

“Technology is modernizing,” explained Sandvold. “As we learn about the ACV, we see everything it has to offer.” 

The ACV also has a unique V-shape underbelly to deflect the blast of improvised explosive devices. Since IED’s were the most lethal weapons used against AAV’s, the new ACV was designed to take a blast from an IED, continue the mission and bring Marines home safely.

“I am loyal to tracks, but the more I learn about these vehicles, the more impressed I get with all its features and how it will improve our warfighting capabilities,” said Sandvold.
column9: 美国加利福尼亚州彭德尔顿营地
column10: 彭德尔顿海军陆战队对两栖作战车辆进行了测试
column11: 世界在我们周围不断前进。作为世界上最令人畏惧的战斗力量，海军陆战队必须提高自身能力。美国海军陆战队的新型两栖作战车辆是为了提高海军陆战队的两栖作战能力。12月16日至18日，海军陆战队战术系统支持活动两栖车辆测试分队的海军陆战队在彭德尔顿海军陆战队基地的海滩上，在微光和夜间作战中测试了ACV的机动性和性能。海军陆战队花了数小时驾驶ACV在南加州冲浪和公海中，以评估他们与车辆的接口以及在弱光下进行操作的能力。“自1943年以来，AVTB一直在彭德尔顿营地，”AVTB的运营总监David Sandwold说。“我们是军队中唯一一个使用我们的作战人员测试正在开发中的装备的部门。”ACV将从2020年底开始取代两栖攻击车。AAV自1972年起投入使用，服务于世界各国。AAV一直是将海军陆战队和装备从一艘船运送到另一艘船的通行工具，但随着世界各地的对手越来越强大，ACV的诞生是为了增强船对岸任务和两栖攻击的能力。ACV将有四种不同的变种，它们来自装甲运兵车基地。有一种恢复型，一种指挥控制型，还有一种上装型，用来对付敌人的装甲车。每个ACV都配备了八个车轮，而不是AAV上最初的轨道。AVTB的AAV操作员、海军陆战队中士费尔南多・阿尔瓦雷斯（Fernando Alvarez）说：“ACV和AAV的驾驶和操控方式有着巨大的差异。”。“主要的区别（带轮子）是它在陆地上的速度要快得多。但是我们现在必须做三点转弯，而不是像AAV那样旋转，这不是一个问题。”ACV通过高浪驱动，穿过沟渠，卡车穿过斜坡。ACV的重要保护资产使其能够抵御直接攻击，并允许其在不断变化的作战环境中以降级的机动性运行。该车具有足够的杀伤力，可以为步兵提供精确的火力支援，无论是静止的还是移动的。“技术正在现代化，”桑德沃尔德解释道。“随着我们对ACV的了解，我们看到了它所能提供的一切。”ACV还有一个独特的V形下腹，可以偏转简易爆炸装置的爆炸。由于IED是对付AAV最致命的武器，新的ACV被设计用来承受IED的爆炸，继续执行任务并将海军陆战队安全带回家。“我忠于轨道，但我对这些车辆了解得越多，我对其所有功能以及它将如何提高我们的作战能力印象就越深刻。”桑德沃德说。

column2: Marine Corps will start fielding Amphibious Combat Vehicle
column3:
Marine Corps Base Quantico, Va.―Marines will soon start receiving the long-awaited Amphibious Combat Vehicle.

Program Executive Officer Land Systems approved initial fielding of the Marine Corps’ new ACV, which will eventually replace the Corps’ legacy Assault Amphibious Vehicles. 

“This is truly a significant moment, given the many years the Marine Corps has invested in trying to replace the AAV,” said Col. Kirk Mullins, program manager for Advanced Amphibious Assault at PEO Land Systems. “While we still have work ahead of us, this is a historical first step toward delivering this materiel capability to our Marines, which is what our mission is all about.”

The initial fielding decision, which the PEO finalized in late September, enables the AAA program office to start distributing the vehicle to the fleet. The Marine Corps will deliver the first set of ACVs―the personnel-carrier variant―to Marines starting in October.

In the future, the Corps intends to develop, procure and field three additional variants that specialize in command and control, recovery operations and increased firepower.

The ACV is designed to fully replace the Corps’ aging fleet of AAVs through the 2020s. Expeditionary and modernized in design, the ACV integrates with naval shipping and ship-to-shore connectors. The ACV’s ability to use the ocean and waterways to carry Marines and equipment make it well-suited for various operating environments, including Expeditionary Advanced Base Operations.
column6: MARINE CORPS BASE QUANTICO, VA, UNITED STATES
column9: 美国弗吉尼亚州匡蒂科海军陆战队基地
column10: 海军陆战队将开始部署两栖作战车辆
column11: 弗吉尼亚州匡蒂科海军陆战队基地――海军陆战队不久将开始接收期待已久的两栖作战车辆。项目执行官陆地系统部批准了海军陆战队新型ACV的初步部署，该车辆将最终取代海军陆战队遗留的两栖攻击车辆。“鉴于海军陆战队多年来一直在努力更换AAV，这确实是一个重要时刻，”PEO陆地系统公司高级两栖攻击项目经理柯克・马林斯上校说。“虽然我们还有工作要做，但这是向我们的海军陆战队交付这种装备能力的历史性第一步，这也是我们的使命所在。”PEO在9月底最终确定的最初部署决定，使AAA项目办公室能够开始向舰队分发车辆。海军陆战队将从10月开始向海军陆战队交付第一套ACV（人员运载器变体）。未来，海军陆战队打算开发、采购和部署另外三种专门用于指挥和控制的变体，恢复行动和增强火力。ACV的设计目的是在20世纪20年代完全取代美国陆军部老化的AAV机队。远征和现代化的设计，ACV集成了海军航运和船岸连接器。ACV能够利用海洋和水路运送海军陆战队和设备，因此非常适合各种作战环境，包括远征先进基地作战。

column2: P-S GAR celebrates Month of the Military Child
column3:
PETERSON AIR FORCE BASE, Colo. C Col. James Smith, Peterson-Schriever Garrison commander, signed a proclamation to begin Month of the Military Child for the garrison on April 2, 2021. Activities for the month long celebration include a door decorating contest, a masquerade ball, a gratitude garden and community library grand opening. 

“It’s a time that the community can come together and support military-connected children,” said Ruth Moore, Schriever Air Force Base school liaison. “These kids deserve our support as they support their family members who serve.” 

In 1986, Defense Secretary Casper Weinberg established April as Month of the Military Child in order to celebrate military children and the sacrifices they make in order for their loved ones to continue to serve our country. A parent’s military career can be difficult on children; from constantly changing schools and having to make new friends, to saying goodbye to their parents for months on end. This requires an underestimated amount of resiliency and strength.

“The official flower of the military child is the dandelion,” said Moore. “The plant puts down roots almost anywhere, and it’s almost impossible to destroy."

The garrison community is also encouraged to participate in “Purple-Up Day” on April 16. When combining the official colors of each military branch it creates purple; which symbolizes support for military families and children.

A complete list of garrison Month of the Military Child events can be found on the 21st and the 50th Force Support Squadron websites.

For specific event details for Peterson AFB, please contact Victoria Henderson, Peterson AFB school liaison, at 719-556-7832 or victoria.henderson.1@spaceforce.mil and Ruth Moore, Schriever AFB school liaison, at 719-567-6176 or ruth.moore.1@spaceforce.mil.
column9: 美国科罗拉多州斯普林斯
column10: P-S GAR庆祝军人儿童月
column11: 科罗拉多州彼得森空军基地――彼得森・施里弗（PETERSON Schriever）驻军指挥官詹姆斯・史密斯（James Smith）上校签署了一份公告，宣布在2021年4月2日开始驻军的军事儿童月。为期一个月的庆祝活动包括门装饰比赛、化妆舞会、感恩花园和社区图书馆盛大开幕。施里弗空军基地学校联络员露丝・摩尔（Ruth Moore）说：“这是一个社区能够团结起来支持与军队有联系的儿童的时刻。”。1986年，国防部长卡斯珀・温伯格（Casper Weinberg）将4月定为军人儿童月，以庆祝军人儿童以及他们为让亲人继续为国家服务而做出的牺牲。父母的军旅生涯对孩子来说可能很困难；从不断更换学校到结交新朋友，再到连续几个月与父母道别。这需要被低估的韧性和力量。“军队孩子的官方花朵是蒲公英，”摩尔说。“这种植物几乎在任何地方生根，几乎不可能被摧毁。”驻军社区也被鼓励参加“紫色行动日”4月16日。当将每个军种的官方颜色组合在一起时，它会产生紫色；这象征着对军人家庭和儿童的支持。在21日和50日部队支援中队网站上可以找到军队儿童活动驻军月的完整列表。有关彼得森空军基地的具体活动详情，请联系Vict奥里亚・亨德森，彼得森空军基地学校联络员，电话719-556-7832或维多利亚・亨德森。1@spaceforce.mil和Ruth Moore，Schriever AFB学校联络员，电话719-567-6176或Ruth.Moore。1@spaceforce.mil.

column2: USS William P. Lawrence Holds Change of Command
column3:
Cmdr. Kevin S. McCormick, Jr. relieved Cmdr. Dawn C. Allen as commanding officer of Arleigh Burke-class guided-missile destroyer USS William P. Lawrence (DDG 110) in a change of command ceremony on board Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam Jan. 21.
 
Allen assumed command in August 2019 as William P. Lawrence’s seventh commanding officer and led the ship through two deployments in support of operations in U.S. 7th and 4th Fleets including enhanced counter-narcotics operations that disrupted more than $200 million of narcotics. Under her command, the ship completed several freedom of navigation operations, participated in numerous exercises including an integrated Air Defense Exercise with Colombian and U.S. Air Forces, PASSEXs with Brazil, and supported humanitarian aid in Central America after Hurricanes Eta and Iota. 
 
“It has been an absolute honor to serve with the resilient, capable and highly engaged warfighters of the William P. Lawrence, they never cease to impress and they epitomize the ship’s motto: Never Give In!” said Allen.
 
Allen is transferring to Yokosuka, Japan to assume the duties as Reactor Officer aboard USS Ronald Reagan (CVN 76). Allen, a Texas native, enlisted in the U.S. Navy serving as an aviation ordnanceman and helicopter rescue swimmer prior to commissioning as a Surface Warfare Officer with a specialty in nuclear power. 
 
McCormick, a Delaware native, is a 2002 graduate of the United States Naval Academy. He most recently served as the ship’s Executive Officer from July 2019 until August 2020. His previous sea tours include USS Arleigh Burke (DDG 51), USS McCampbell (DDG 85), executive officer of USS Defender (MCM 2) and Command of USS Warrior (MCM 10). 
 
“It is a privilege to join and lead such a talented crew and the best ship in the Navy. We will continue to honor Admiral Lawrence’s legacy serving with honor as we defend our Nation’s interests at home and abroad,” said McCormick.
 
Commissioned in 2011 and homeported in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, William P. Lawrence is the Navy’s 59th guided missile destroyer. Its namesake honors Vice Adm. William P. Lawrence, a naval aviator, test pilot, Vietnam Prisoner of War, and U.S. 3rd Fleet commander.
column9: 珍珠港，你好，美国
column10: 威廉・P・劳伦斯号航母指挥权变更
column11: 凯文・S・麦考密克少校接替道恩・C・艾伦少校担任威廉・P・劳伦斯号“阿利・伯克”级导弹驱逐舰指挥官（DDG 110）在珍珠港联合基地希卡姆1月21日的指挥权交接仪式上，艾伦于2019年8月担任威廉・P・劳伦斯的第七任指挥官，并领导该舰进行了两次部署，以支持美国第七舰队和第四舰队的行动，包括强化缉毒行动，打乱了200多美元的预算数百万的毒品。在她的指挥下，该舰完成了几次航行自由行动，参加了多次演习，包括与哥伦比亚和美国空军的综合防空演习，与巴西的PASSEXs演习，并在埃塔和伊奥塔飓风后支持中美洲的人道主义援助。艾伦说：“能与威廉・P・劳伦斯号（William P.Lawrence）的坚韧、能干、高度投入的作战人员一起服役是一种绝对的荣誉，他们从未停止给人留下深刻印象，他们体现了该舰的座右铭：永不屈服。”艾伦将调任日本横须贺，担任罗纳德・里根号（CVN 76）上的反应堆军官。艾伦是德克萨斯州人，在被任命为具有核动力专业的水面作战军官之前，他曾在美国海军服役，担任航空指挥和直升机救生员。麦考密克是特拉华州人，2002年毕业于美国海军学院。他最近在2019年7月至2020年8月担任该船的执行官。他之前的海上旅行包括阿利・伯克号（DDG 51）、麦坎贝尔号（DDG 85）、防守者号（MCM 2）执行官和勇士号（MCM 10）司令部。麦考密克说：“能够加入并领导这样一支才华横溢的船员队伍和海军中最优秀的战舰，我感到非常荣幸。我们将继续尊重劳伦斯海军上将的遗产，在我们捍卫国家在国内外的利益时，我们将继续为之服务。”，威廉・劳伦斯是海军第59艘导弹驱逐舰。它的名字是为了纪念海军飞行员、试飞员、越南战俘和美国第三舰队指挥官威廉・P・劳伦斯副上将。

column2: RHC-P Recognizes Soldiers, Civilians at Hail and Farewell
column3:
JOINT BASE LEWIS-McCHORD, Wash. -- Some said hello, some said goodbye, as Regional Health Command-Pacific held a hail and farewell ceremony here Tuesday, Feb. 25.

Nineteen Soldiers and Civilians were recognized during the event, a military tradition that celebrates those arriving at or departing a command.

The ceremony also recognized a number of Soldiers and Civilians upon their retirements, and six civilian Length of Service awards were presented.

Terence Finnerty of RHC-P's clinical operations section was presented with an award recognizing him as the command's Category III employee of the year.

Dr. Glenn McDermott, also of the clinical operations section, received special recognition for nearly 50 years of military and civilian service.

"This all started in 1971, when I became a cadet at West Point," McDermott said. Originally commissioned in the infantry in 1975, McDermott became a Green Beret and later attended medical school.

RHC-P oversees Army medical treatment facilities and units in the Pacific Northwest, Alaska, Hawaii, Japan and South Korea.

A list of awardees and those recognized follows.

HAIL:

Sarah Bannan, Command Group

Lt. Col. Robert Gray, Warrior Transition Office

Staff Sgt. Kristopher MacDonald, Command Group

Gerald Headley, G-6

FAREWELL:

Dr. Glenn McDermott, Clinical Operations

Staff Sgt. Davin Langston, Command Group

Dr. (Col.) Irene Rosen, Clinical Operations

Master Sgt. Sharon Liehr, Clinical Operations

Lt. Col. Gail Raymond, Clinical Operations

AWARDS:

Dr. Glenn McDermott, Clinical Operations, Meritorious Civilian Service Medal, Certificate of     Appreciation, Certificate of Retirement

Terence Finnerty, Clinical Operations, Civilian Service Commendation Medal

Lt. Col Gail Raymond, Clinical Operations, Meritorious Service Medal

Master Sgt. Sharon Liehr, Clinical Operations, Meritorious Service Medal

Staff Sgt. Davin Langston, Command Group, Meritorious Service Medal

Dr. Gary Southwell, Clinical Operations, Commanding General's Coin

CIVILIAN LENGTH OF SERVICE AWARDS:

Johnny Garnett, G-3, 40 years

Ruth Compton, Command Group, 35 years

Donna Gray, Command Group, 30 years

Ernest Williams, Warrior Transition Office, 30 years

Derek Shoup, Command Judge Advocate Office, 25 years

Joseph Wall, Clinical Operations, 25 years

column9: 美国华盛顿州刘易斯-麦考德联合基地
column10: RHC-P向士兵、平民致意并告别
column11: 华盛顿州路易斯・麦考德联合基地2月25日，星期二，太平洋地区卫生司令部在这里举行了欢迎和告别仪式，一些人说了你好，一些人说了再见。19名士兵和平民在活动中被认出，一种庆祝到达或离开指挥部的军人的军事传统。该仪式还表彰了一些退役的士兵和平民，RHC-P临床操作科的特伦斯・芬纳蒂获得了一个奖项，表彰他为司令部年度第三类员工。格伦・麦克德莫特（Glenn McDermott）也是临床手术科的一员，他在军民服务近50年，获得了特别的认可。“这一切都始于1971年，当时我在西点军校（West Point）当了一名学员，”麦克德莫特说。麦克德莫特于1975年加入步兵部队，后来成为一名绿色贝雷帽，并进入医学院学习。RHC-P负责监督太平洋西北部、阿拉斯加、夏威夷、日本和韩国的陆军医疗设施和部队。获奖者和被认可者名单如下。哈伊尔：莎拉・班南，指挥组LT。罗伯特・格雷上校，勇士过渡办公室塔夫军士克里斯托弗・麦克唐纳中士，指挥组杰拉尔德・赫德利，G-6告别：格伦・麦克德莫特医生，临床手术人员大卫・兰斯顿中士，指挥组医生。（上校）艾琳・罗森，临床手术大师莎伦・利尔中士，临床手术LT。Gail Raymond上校，临床手术奖：Glenn McDermott博士，临床手术，优秀文职服务奖章，感谢证书，退休证书Terence Finnerty，临床手术，文职服务奖状医学奖。盖尔・雷蒙德上校，临床行动部，医疗功勋司令官莎伦・利尔中士，临床行动部，医疗功勋司令官达文・兰斯顿中士，医疗功勋司令部，医疗功勋司令部。加里・索斯韦尔，临床行动，将军军龄奖：约翰尼・加内特，G-3，40岁鲁斯・康普顿，指挥小组，35岁唐纳・格雷，指挥小组，30岁塞内斯特・威廉姆斯，战士过渡办公室，30岁德雷克・舒普，指挥法官辩护办公室，25岁约瑟夫・沃尔，临床行动，25岁

column2: Sexual Assault Awareness and Prevention Month in RHC-P
column3:
HONOLULU C April is Sexual Assault Awareness and Prevention Month. Regional Health Command-Pacific’s command team signed a proclamation here recently signifying its support for eliminating sexual assault and harassment in the Army.

Brig. Gen. Jack M. Davis, commanding general of RHC-P, and Sgt. Maj. Conrad Walters, acting command sergeant major, signed the proclamation to bring awareness to and show support of the Army’s continuing efforts to eliminate sexual assault and harassment, something the leaders called “a scourge” on the service’s reputation, ethics and values.

The Army continues to fight sexual harassment and assault in its ranks, increasing the amount of money and personnel in the fight to reduce the number of incidents, leaders said.

Despite the Army’s efforts, however, reported instances of sexual harassment and assault continue to increase, according to results of a Department of Defense study released last year.

The study, reflecting data from Fiscal Year 2018, found a “statistically significant increase” of sexual assault in the military.

The study stated that about 6.2 percent of active duty women indicated having experienced a sexual assault in the year before the survey, up from the 4.3 percent measured in the 2016 survey. The estimated prevalence rate for active duty men in the 2018 survey was 0.7 percent, statistically unchanged from the previous assessment.

Using these rates, the DoD said, an estimated 20,500 service members experienced some kind of sexual assault in 2018, up from 2016’s estimate of approximately 14,900.

Sgt. 1st Class Melissa Arizmendi, RHC-P’s SHARP program manager, said her office is adjusting its emphasis in an effort to change trends and reduce incidents in the command.

“We have focused on response since the start of the program,” Arizmendi said. “Now, we are focusing more on prevention.”

Arizmendi said this year’s SAAPM theme is, “Building Cohesive Teams through Character, Trust, and Resilience. Protecting Our People Protects Our Mission.”

“This theme was chosen because character and trust are the cornerstones of cohesive teams, and cohesive teams are built by engaged leaders that are trusted by their subordinates,” she said.

Arizmendi said RHC-P’s SHARP office is using some new tactics in the battle against sexual assault and harassment.

“We are working to ensure that incoming personnel get a responsible sponsor,” she said. “These personnel get SHARP training within days, so they know the risks for their area.”

Arizmendi has been the RHC-P SHARP program manager since August, 2017, and said the team works directly with equal opportunity and equal employment opportunity teams to ensure all service members, civilians, contractors and family members are shown the required dignity and respect.

“Anyone witnessing an event outside of dignity and respect is asked to intervene,” she said. “Workplace inspections are conducted on a regular basis.

“Leaders must not tolerate any form of sexual harassment or assault,” she said.

There are a number of resources available to RHC-P members who feel they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, Arizmendi said.

“If they are unable or unwilling to visit the SHARP office, they can use any other SHARP office, the chaplain, behavioral health, special victims’ counsel, office of personnel management, DoD Safe helpline, Military OneSource, the Rape Abuse and Incest National Network, or their local installation 24/7 hotline,” she said.

“Victims of sexual harassment and/or sexual assault will have different needs based on their individual situation, option they choose to report, and willingness to share,” Arizmendi added.

There are two types of reporting available to victims of sexual harassment or assault: restricted and unrestricted.

Arizmendi said restricted reporting gives the victim the opportunity to report the incident, receive SHARP services, get medical treatment, including a sexual assault forensic examination, and receive legal services, including having a dedicated special victim advocate with more control over release of information.

An unrestricted report includes all the above as well as support from the command, a military protective order, civilian protective order, and an investigation, with the ability to charge the alleged offender with a crime.

Arizmendi, a licensed practical nurse, said Sexual Assault Awareness Month has been observed nationwide since 2001, after building on efforts since the 1970s to bring more attention to the problem.

Arizmendi said her job as the SHARP program manager fits her personality.

“I enjoy helping people,” she said. “It has always been part of my identity. I also like that at this level, I can have an influence on change and policy rewrites.”

HELP IS AVAILABLE

If you have been sexually assaulted or harassed, contact your chain of command or reach out to the following resources:

RHC-P SHARP office: 808-777-9157

RHC-P Equal Opportunity office: 253-966-5507

RHC-P Chaplain: 808-594-8031 or 808-741-3049

Veterans' Crisis Line:  800-273-8255 or text 838255; in Korea, call 0808-555-118 or DSN 118

DoD Safe Helpline: 877-995-5247

Rape Abuse and Incest National Network (RAIN): 800-656-HOPE (4673)

For additional information, visit the Department of Defense’s Sexual Assault Prevention and Response Office website at www.sapr.mil.

column10: RHC-P性侵犯意识和预防月
column11: 檀香山―4月是性侵犯意识和预防月。太平洋地区卫生司令部的指挥小组最近在这里签署了一项声明，表示支持消除军队中的性攻击和性骚扰。RHC-P司令杰克・M・戴维斯将军和代理司令军士长康拉德・沃尔特斯中士签署了公告，以唤起人们对军队继续努力消除性攻击和性骚扰的认识并表示支持，领导人称这是对军队声誉的“祸害”，道德和价值观。领导人说，军队继续打击其队伍中的性骚扰和性攻击，增加了战斗中的资金和人员，以减少事件数量。尽管军队做出了努力，但据报道的性骚扰和性攻击事件仍在增加，根据国防部去年发布的一项研究结果。该研究反映了2018财年的数据，发现军队中的性侵犯“在统计上显著增加”。该研究指出，约6.2%的现役女性表示在调查前一年经历过性侵犯，从2016年调查的4.3%上升。2018年调查中，现役男性的估计患病率为0.7%，与之前的评估相比，在统计上没有变化。国防部表示，根据这些比率，2018年估计有20500名军人经历过某种形式的性侵犯，高于2016年估计的约14900.Sgt。RHC-P的SHARP项目经理一等兵梅丽莎・阿里兹门迪（Melissa Arizmendi）说，她的办公室正在调整工作重点，以改变趋势，减少指挥部的事故。“自项目开始以来，我们一直关注应对措施，”阿里兹门迪说。“现在，我们更加注重预防。”阿里兹门迪说，今年的SAAPM主题是“通过性格、信任和韧性建立团结的团队。保护我们的人民保护我们的使命。”她说：“之所以选择这个主题，是因为性格和信任是凝聚力团队的基石，而凝聚力团队是由敬业的领导者建立的，他们的下属也信任他们。”阿里兹门迪说，RHC-P的夏普办公室在打击性攻击和性骚扰的斗争中采用了一些新策略。“我们正在努力确保新来的员工得到一个负责任的赞助者，”她说。“这些员工在几天内得到了严格的培训，因此他们知道自己所在领域的风险。”Arizmendi自2017年8月起担任RHC-P SHARP项目经理，并表示该团队直接与平等机会和平等就业机会团队合作，以确保所有服务人员、平民、承包商和家庭成员获得所需的尊严和尊重。她说：“任何目睹不尊重尊严和尊严的事件的人都被要求进行干预。工作场所的检查是定期进行的。领导者不得容忍任何形式的性骚扰或性攻击。”Arizmendi说，RHC-P成员如果觉得自己受到了性侵犯或骚扰，可以利用很多资源。她说：“如果他们不能或不愿意访问夏普办公室，他们可以使用任何其他夏普办公室、牧师、行为健康、特别受害者律师、人事管理办公室、国防部安全热线、军事OneSource、强奸虐待和乱伦全国网络，或他们当地的24/7热线。”。“性骚扰和/或性攻击的受害者将根据其个人情况、选择报告的选项以及愿意分享的意愿而有不同的需求。”Arizmendi补充道。性骚扰或性攻击的受害者有两种报告：限制性报告和非限制性报告。Arizmendi说，限制性报告使受害者有机会报告事件，接受尖锐的服务，接受医疗，包括性攻击法医检查，并接受法律服务，包括有一个专门的受害者特别辩护律师，对信息的发布有更多的控制权。一份不受限制的报告包括上述所有内容，以及来自司令部、军事保护令、平民保护令和调查的支持，有能力指控被指控的罪犯犯罪。Arizmendi，一名持证从业人员cal nurse说，自上世纪70年代以来，她一直在努力提高人们对这一问题的关注度，自2001年以来，全国各地都举办了性侵犯意识月活动。Arizmendi说，她作为夏普项目经理的工作符合她的个性。“我喜欢帮助别人，”她说。“这一直是我身份的一部分。我也喜欢在这个层次上，我可以对变革和政策改写产生影响。”如果您受到性侵犯或骚扰，请联系您的指挥系统或联系以下资源：RHC-P SHARP办公室：808-777-9157RHC-P平等机会办公室：253-966-5507RHC-P牧师：808-594-8031或808-741-3049退伍军人危机热线：800-273-8255或短信838255；在韩国，请致电0808-555-118或DSN 118DoD安全求助热线：877-995-5247强奸虐待和乱伦全国网络（RAIN）：800-656-HOPE（4673）有关更多信息，请访问国防部性攻击预防和应对办公室网站www.sapr.mil。

column2: PHC-P Soldier and entomologist promoted to lieutenant colonel
column3:
TRIPLER ARMY MEDICAL CENTER, Hawaii -- Public Health Command C Pacific chief of Operations, Hee Kim, was promoted to lieutenant colonel on Jan. 1, 2020.

In honor of Kim’s promotion, a ceremony was held Jan. 24 at Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam, Hawaii. Col. Heidi Mon., PHC-P commander, was the host of ceremony.
  
“Good afternoon one and all, and thank you all for joining me today on this auspicious occasion of the promotion of Hee Kim to lieutenant colonel,” said Mon. “If you have been to a promotion ceremony or two you are probably expecting me to say that Hee is a great Army officer and he is. He is likely the smartest person that I know, and I am surrounded by brilliant minds in Public Health Command C Pacific. But Maj. Kim, Lt. Col. Kim, is extraordinarily bright, as well as perceptive, creative, and enterprising.”

Kim represents one of 59 active duty Entomology officers currently serving in the U.S. Army. In 1991, Kim and his family emigrated from Seoul, South Korea, to the United States. Since leaving South Korea, Kim always wanted to practice Medical Entomology, and after the Sept. 11 attacks, those two factors solidified his desire to join the Army in 2005. 
 
“I give this glory and honor to God first and foremost, because it is amazing what he has allowed me to accomplish throughout my life,” said Kim. “I was an immigrant boy who didn’t speak a lick of English at 11 years old, and just had a fascination with bugs. Fast forward 29 years later, here we are in this awesome setting, sharing this special moment with friends and family.”

Kim recognized his fellow officers, enlisted Soldiers and Army Civilian employees, adding they are the biggest reason he is where he is today.

“I love promotions, because they are a platform that we can use to thank those people who put you here. We have all been in this business for a long time, you don’t get here by yourself,” said Kim. “I want to thank everyone who has been instrumental in my place here.”
  
Kim also thanked friends and family for attending the ceremony, particularly Mirka, his wife of 14 years.

“I really appreciate your support, and how amazing and talented you are,” said Kim “If you didn’t know, she is an artist, and keeps a professional career while also caring for our three children and me ??C amazing!”

Kim also thanked his children, Aila, Eelis, and Liina.  
 
“I know I said this before when I got my Ph.D., but daddy loves you, and I do this every day for you guys,” said Kim. 

As the ceremony came to a close, Kim was presented the Order of Military Medical Merit medallion for distinguished service, excellence, and promoting fellowship and espirit de corps among Army Medical Department personnel.

Membership in the order recognizes those individuals who have clearly demonstrated the highest standards of integrity and moral character, displayed an outstanding degree of professional competence, with selflessness, and have made a sustained contribution to the betterment of Army Medicine.
column9: 檀香山，你好，美国
column10: PHC-P士兵和昆虫学家晋升为中校
column11: 夏威夷TRIPLER陆军医疗中心――公共卫生司令部――太平洋作战司令Hee Kim于2020年1月1日晋升为中校。为纪念Kim的晋升，1月24日在夏威夷珍珠港希卡姆联合基地举行了仪式。PHC-P指挥官Heidi Mon上校主持了仪式。“大家下午好，谢谢你们今天和我一起参加这个喜庆的场合，把希金提升为中校。”蒙说。“如果你参加过一两次晋升仪式，你可能希望我说Hee是一位伟大的陆军军官，他确实是。他可能是我所认识的最聪明的人，我周围都是太平洋公共卫生司令部的才华横溢的人。但是金少校，金中校，非常聪明，而且有洞察力，有创造力，而且非常聪明。”金代表目前在美国陆军服役的59名现役昆虫学军官之一。1991年，金正日和他的家人从韩国首尔移民到美国。自离开韩国以来，金正恩一直想从事医学昆虫学研究，而在9・11袭击后，这两个因素使他在2005年参军的愿望更加坚定。金说：“我把这份荣耀和荣誉首先献给上帝，因为他让我一生都能完成的事情令人惊讶。”。“我是一个移民男孩，11岁时一点英语都不会说，只是对虫子很着迷。快进29年后，我们来到了这个令人敬畏的环境中，与朋友和家人分享这一特殊时刻。”Kim认出了他的同事、士兵和军队文职雇员，金说：“我喜欢促销活动，因为这是一个平台，我们可以用来感谢那些让你来到这里的人。我们都从事这一行业很长时间了，你不是一个人来的。”。“我要感谢所有在我这里发挥作用的人。”金姆还感谢朋友和家人参加仪式，特别是他14年的妻子米尔卡。“我真的很感谢你的支持，以及你是多么的了不起和有才华，”金姆说“如果你不知道，她是一名艺术家，在照顾我们的三个孩子和我的同时保持着职业生涯――太棒了！”金姆还感谢了他的孩子，艾拉、伊利斯和莉娜。“我知道我在拿到博士学位时说过这句话，但爸爸爱你们，我每天都为你们这样做。”仪式接近尾声时，金正日被授予军事医学功勋勋章，以表彰其卓越的服务、卓越的表现以及在陆军医疗部门人员中促进团契和团队精神。该勋章的成员资格认可那些明确表现出最高标准的完整性的个人具有高尚的道德品质，表现出卓越的专业能力和无私奉献精神，为军队医疗事业的发展做出了持续的贡献。

column2: USS William P. Lawrence Returns from Deployment
column3:
Arleigh-Burke class guided-missile destroyer USS William P. Lawrence (DDG 110), along with an embarked detachment from Helicopter Maritime Strike Squadron (HSM) 37 “Easyriders”, returned to its homeport of Joint Base Pearl Harbor Hickam following a independent deployment to the U.S. 3rd and 7th Fleet areas of operations, Nov 7.

“Our forward operations demonstrated the U.S. Navy’s commitment to maintaining a free and open Indo-Pacific,” said Cmdr. Dawn Allen, commanding officer aboard William P. Lawrence. “Nowhere in the world will you find a better fighting team that is ready both to preserve peace and prevent conflict.  As advertised, the Sailors of William P. Lawrence ‘never give in!’”

During its time in 7th Fleet, William P. Lawrence conducted operations in the South and East China Seas, joined the Reagan Carrier Strike group off the coast of Australia during joint exercise Talisman Sabre, and participated in the ASEAN Defence Ministers' Meeting-Plus Maritime Security Field Training Exercise 2019 as well as the International Maritime Defence Exhibition (IMDEX) Asia 2019 in Singapore. The Maritime Security Field Training Exercise, which included 18 participating countries, focused on enhanced cooperation between ADMM-Plus nations and information sharing, interoperability and multinational response to maritime security issues.

The destroyer also joined numerous bi-lateral and multi-lateral operations, which included sailing with the Indian Navy, Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force, and the Republic of Philippine Navy in the South China Sea in May. 

The ship covered approximately 60,000 nautical miles over the course of its deployment. 

U.S. 3rd Fleet leads naval forces in the Indo-Pacific and provides the realistic, relevant training necessary for an effective global Navy. U.S. 3rd Fleet works in close coordination with U.S. 7th Fleet to provide commanders with capable, ready assets across the spectrum of military operations in the Indo-Pacific.

For more news from Commander, U.S. 3rd Fleet, visit www.navy.mil/local/c3f/. 

For more information on USS William P. Lawrence, please visit https://www.public.navy.mil/surfor/ddg110/Pages/default.aspx.
column9: 珍珠港，美国
column10: 威廉・P・劳伦斯号从部署中返回
column11: 11月7日，美国海军威廉・P・劳伦斯号驱逐舰（DDG 110）阿利・伯克级导弹驱逐舰连同37“易瑞尔”直升机海上打击中队（HSM）的一支登船分遣队，在独立部署到美国第三舰队和第七舰队作战区后，返回其母港珍珠港联合基地希卡姆。威廉・P・劳伦斯号上的指挥官道恩・艾伦中校说：“我们的前沿行动表明，美国海军致力于维护一个自由开放的印太地区。”。“世界上没有任何地方能找到一支更好的战斗队伍，既能维护和平又能防止冲突。正如宣传的那样，威廉・P・劳伦斯的水手们‘永不屈服！’William P.Lawrence在第七舰队服役期间，在中国南海和东海进行了作战，在澳大利亚海岸参加了里根航母打击小组的“护身符佩剑”联合演习，并参加了2019年东盟国防部长会议和海上安全实地训练演习，以及国际军事演习印度国防展览会（IMDEX）2019年亚洲海事安全实地训练演习在新加坡举行。该演习包括18个参与国，重点是加强ADMM Plus国家之间的合作，以及信息共享、互操作性和对海事安全问题的多国反应。该驱逐舰还参加了多个双边和多边行动，包括：ch包括5月在南中国海与印度海军、日本海上自卫队和菲律宾共和国海军一起航行。该船在部署过程中行驶了约60000海里。美国第三舰队领导印度洋-太平洋地区的海军部队，并为未来的海洋航行提供了现实的相关训练有效的全球海军。美国第三舰队与美国第七舰队密切合作，为指挥官提供印度洋-太平洋军事行动范围内的能力、现成资源。有关美国第三舰队指挥官的更多新闻，请访问www.Navy.mil/local/c3f/。有关美国海军威廉・P・劳伦斯号的更多信息，请访问https://www.public.navy.mil/surfor/ddg110/Pages/default.aspx。

column2: Acting SecAF Matthew P. Donovan visits Tyndall
column3:
Honorable Matthew P. Donovan, acting Secretary of the Air Force, visited Tyndall Air Force Base, Florida, June 2, 2019, after assuming the position June 1.

“It’s our privilege to be the first base visit for our [acting] Secretary of the Air Force, the Honorable Matthew Donovan,” said Col. Brian Laidlaw, 325th Fighter Wing commander.

Donovan was stationed at Tyndall twice when he served in the military. He flew the U.S. Air Force F-15 Eagle fighter aircraft in the 1990s as an instructor pilot and later as an Air Combat Command demonstration pilot. He returned to Tyndall in 2001 as the 95th Fighter Squadron commander. 

“It’s really great to be back in Bay County and Panama City and Tyndall AFB,” Donovan said. “It was the best time of my life here, flying Eagles on the beach.”

Donovan toured the base to see the destruction Hurricane Michael caused, the recovery efforts already completed and future plans for the base rebuild.

“It’s really important that we continue to advocate for Tyndall AFB and getting it rebuilt,” Donovan said. “We’re cautiously optimistic that we’re pretty close on a supplemental now.”

Donovan held a press conference during his visit, discussing the strategic importance of Tyndall and answering questions about updates on the base’s recovery. He also met with Tyndall Airmen to thank them for their hard work, resiliency and dedication to execute the mission.

“I want to put a shout out to all the Airmen,” Donovan said. “That was always the best part of any tour I had in the Air Force, was interacting with the Airmen cause they’re what makes it so special.”
column6: TYNDALL AIR FORCE BASE, FL, UNITED STATES
column9: 美国佛罗里达州廷德尔空军基地
column10: 代理秘书马修・P・多诺万访问廷德尔
column11: 尊敬的空军代理部长马修・多诺万（Matthew P.Donovan）于2019年6月2日就任后访问了佛罗里达州廷德尔空军基地。布赖恩・莱德劳上校说：“我们很荣幸成为我们空军代理部长马修・多诺万（Matthew Donovan）的首次基地访问。”，第325战斗机联队指挥官。多诺万在军队服役时曾两次驻扎在廷德尔。20世纪90年代，他作为教练飞行员驾驶美国空军F-15鹰式战斗机，后来又作为空战司令部示范飞行员。他于2001年返回廷德尔，担任第95战斗机中队指挥官。多诺万说：“回到海湾县、巴拿马城和廷德尔空军基地真是太棒了。”。“这是我生命中最美好的时光，在海滩上飞翔的老鹰。”多诺万参观了基地，了解了飓风迈克尔造成的破坏、已经完成的恢复工作以及基地重建的未来计划。“我们继续支持廷德尔空军基地并使其得到重建，这真的很重要，”多诺万说。多诺万在访问期间举行了一次新闻发布会，讨论了廷德尔的战略重要性，并回答了有关基地恢复最新情况的问题。他还会见了廷德尔空军，感谢他们为执行任务所付出的辛勤工作、坚韧精神和献身精神。“我想向所有空军发出一声呐喊，”多诺万说。“这一直是我在空军的任何一次旅行中最精彩的部分，与飞行员的互动是因为他们让这一切变得如此特别。”

column2: Sailors and Marines Integrate Aboard John P. Murtha
column3:
By Mass Communication Specialist 2nd Class Kyle Carlstrom, USS John P. Murtha Public Affairs

PACIFIC OCEAN C Sailors and Marines aboard the San Antonio-class amphibious transport dock ship USS John P. Murtha (LPD 26) are preparing for their upcoming deployment by learning to combine their individual skills to complete ship, strike group and Marine missions.

As part of the Boxer Amphibious Ready Group (ARG), John P. Murtha Sailors and the Marines of the 11th Marine Expeditionary Unit (MEU) are using their current at-sea time to further interoperability aboard the ship and within the ARG.

“The ability to integrate with our sister services is one of the fundamentals that makes the U.S. military the best in the world,” said Capt. Anthony Roach, commanding officer of John P. Murtha. “Bringing combat and/or “soft” power to bear anywhere in the world continues to demonstrate our resolve to our partner nations. Without that integration and ability to answer the call worldwide we couldn’t be the leaders of the international community that the world expects from us.”
From daily flight operations to replenishments-at-sea, the Sailors and Marines find themselves working hand-in-hand, ensuring success in each task. 

“We always have areas that we can improve upon but the key take-away is the relationships and trust that we’re building between the Sailors and Marines,” said Roach. “Fostering and nurturing those good relationships now in training will facilitate accurate and efficient response when needed, whether that’s in combat or during a potential humanitarian assistance mission. The relationships built this winter and spring will carry us through to success whatever deployment brings.”

Sailors and Marines also benefit from the integration by getting hands-on experience with new equipment in a different environment.
John P. Murtha is underway conducting routine operations as a part of USS Boxer Amphibious Ready Group (ARG) in the eastern Pacific Ocean.
column9: 美国
column10: 水手和海军陆战队联合登上约翰・P・默萨号
column11: 大众传播专家凯尔・卡尔斯特罗姆，美国海军约翰・P・穆尔塔号公共事务部太平洋分部――圣安东尼奥级两栖运输码头船美国海军约翰・P・穆尔塔号（LPD 26）上的水手和海军陆战队正在为即将到来的部署做准备，他们将学习如何结合各自的技能来完成该船，攻击群和海军陆战队任务。作为义和团两栖战备群（ARG）的一部分，约翰・P・默塔（John P.Murtha）水兵和第11海军陆战队远征部队（MEU）的海军陆战队正在利用他们在海上的电流，进一步加强船上和ARG内的互操作性。约翰・P・穆尔塔的指挥官安东尼・罗奇上尉说：“与我们的姐妹军种相结合的能力是使美国军队成为世界上最好的军队的基本要素之一，它带来了战斗力和/或“软实力”在世界任何地方承担责任的能力继续向我们的伙伴国家表明我们的决心。如果没有这种一体化和在全世界响应号召的能力，我们就不可能成为世界期望我们成为的国际社会领导人。”从日常飞行操作到海上补给，水兵和海军陆战队发现自己携手合作，确保每项任务的成功。“我们总是有可以改进的地方，但关键是我们在水兵和海军陆战队之间建立的关系和信任，”罗奇说。“培养和培育目前正在训练中的良好关系将有助于在需要时做出准确和有效的反应，无论是在战斗中还是在潜在的人道主义援助任务中。今冬和今春建立的关系将使我们无论部署带来什么样的成功。”水兵和海军陆战队也通过在不同环境中使用新设备获得实际操作经验而受益。John P.Murtha作为美国海军“拳击手”两栖战备小组（ARG）的一员，正在东太平洋进行常规作战。

column2: RHC-P commanding general celebrates Thanksgiving with soldiers
column3:
JOINT BASE LEWIS-MCCHORD, Wash. - Each year military commanders set aside time to thank service members during the holidays. This year is no different.  

For this Thanksgiving holiday, Brig. Gen. Dennis LeMaster, commanding general, Regional Health Command-Pacific, continued that tradition and spent time serving meals to soldiers at dining facilities throughout Joint Base Lewis-McChord. LeMaster and his wife Traudi Retzlaff spent time at four dining facilities on Nov. 21 and 22.  

They visited the 1st SFG - Airborne DFAC, 201st EMIB Courage Inn and the 16th CAB Raptors Nest DFAC the day before Thanksgiving, and Madigan Army Medical Center DFAC on the holiday.

The holidays are a joyous time, and as LeMaster reminded the team at Region in his yearly Thanksgiving message, we should always hold on to the memories of those who have made the ultimate sacrifice and who were not with their loved ones at the dinner table.
column6: JOINT BASE LEWIS-MCCHORD, WA, UNITED STATES

column10: RHC-P指挥官将军与士兵庆祝感恩节
column11: 华盛顿州路易斯-麦考德联合基地-每年，军队指挥官都会在节日期间留出时间感谢服役人员。今年也不例外。为了这个感恩节，布里格。太平洋地区卫生司令部司令丹尼斯・勒马斯特将军延续了这一传统，并花时间在刘易斯・麦克霍德联合基地的餐饮设施为士兵提供膳食。11月21日和22日，勒马斯特和妻子特劳迪・雷茨拉夫在四家餐厅用餐。感恩节前一天，他们参观了第一家SFG-空降DFAC、第201家EMIB勇气酒店和第16家出租车猛禽巢DFAC，并在节日期间参观了麦迪根陆军医疗中心DFAC。节日是一个欢乐的时刻，正如勒马斯特在其每年的感恩节致辞中提醒该地区的团队的那样，我们应该永远记住那些做出了最大牺牲的人，那些没有和亲人一起吃饭的人。

column2: RHC-P supports blood safety program in Cambodia
column3:
JOINT BASE LEWIS-MCCHORD, Wash. C A team of medical professionals from Regional Health Command-Pacific’s medical treatment facilities and units, in partnership with U.S. Indo-Pacific Command and the U.S. Army in the Pacific, recently supported a blood safety global health engagement in the Kingdom of Cambodia. 

Lt. Col. Teresa Terry, Chief, Clinical Laboratory and Blood Operations, 18th Medical Command (Deployment Support) has been overseeing this humanitarian assistance and disaster relief health engagement effort.

“A focus of the Blood Safety Program in Cambodia is to support vital lifesaving efforts through the improvement of blood product collection, manufacturing and storage,” said Terry.  

This recent mission in Cambodia marks the grand opening of two blood donor centers, and paves the way for the next step, which is the accreditation of the facilities. During the trip another milestone was achieved with the help of the first volunteer blood donors, where blood was collected at these new facilities.

“The highlight for this mission was the completion of the last two out of five U.S. Indo-PACOM funded Blood Transfusion Centers in Cambodia,” said Terry. “The completion of this phase of the project culminated with a ribbon cutting event which was attended by the Cambodia Ministry of Health and representatives from the U.S. Embassy in Cambodia,” Terry added. 

Providing a safe and secure blood supply while improving quality processes with Cambodian blood bank laboratory staff was also a key phase of this project. 

“Lt. Col. Terry and I accomplished another phase of this project which included standardization and validation of equipment for new and relocated instruments used for blood collection,” said Sgt. 1st Class Jason Timberlake, Dept. of Pathology, Madigan.

The overall effort from the entire team was a contribution to the international community and went towards building the host nation’s biosecurity capacity as well as a sustainable blood program to support humanitarian assistance and disaster relief.

As for Terry, the opportunity to improve anyone’s quality of life, and promote goodwill is a life changing experience.

column9: 美国华盛顿州刘易斯-麦考德联合基地
column10: RHC-P支持柬埔寨的血液安全计划
column11: 华盛顿州LEWIS-MCCHORD联合基地-太平洋区域卫生司令部医疗设施和单位的一组医疗专业人员与美国印度太平洋司令部和太平洋美军合作，最近支持柬埔寨王国的血液安全全球卫生活动。特蕾莎・特里中校（Teresa Terry）是第18医疗司令部（部署支持）临床实验室和血液操作负责人，一直在监督这项人道主义援助和救灾卫生工作。“柬埔寨血液安全计划的一个重点是通过改进血液产品的收集、制造和储存，支持重要的救生工作。”特里说。最近在柬埔寨的这项任务标志着两个献血中心的隆重开幕，并为下一步（即设施的认证）铺平了道路。在这次旅行中，在第一批自愿献血者的帮助下，实现了另一个里程碑，在这些新设施中采集血液。Terry说：“这次任务的重点是在柬埔寨完成了五个由美国Indo PACOM资助的输血中心中的最后两个。”。“该项目这一阶段的完成以柬埔寨卫生部和美国驻柬埔寨大使馆代表参加的剪彩活动而告终。”Terry补充道，提供安全可靠的血液供应，同时与柬埔寨血库实验室工作人员一起改进质量流程也是该项目的关键阶段。“特里中校和我完成了该项目的另一个阶段，其中包括用于血液采集的新仪器和重新安置的仪器的标准化和验证。”麦迪根病理学系一等军士Jason Timberlake说。整个团队的整体努力是对国际社会的贡献，并致力于建设东道国的生物安全能力以及支持人道主义援助和救灾的可持续血液计划。对于Terry来说o提高任何人的生活质量，增进亲善是一种改变生活的体验。

column2: RHC-P brings awareness to breast cancer in October
column3:
JOINT BASE LEWIS-MCCHORD, Wash. -- October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, and each year health professionals in the United States rally to bring awareness to an international health issue that affects both women and men. Regional Health Command-Pacific and its providers at its military treatment facilities are part of the health care professionals who provide support in the form of screening, prevention awareness, treatment, and after-care to those who are affected by the disease.

At RHC-P’s medical centers, Saturday breast cancer screening events will be held to increase access to care opportunities for beneficiaries. Tripler Army Medical Center’s Family Medicine Clinic providers have partnered with Tripler’s Radiology Department to conduct a Women's Wellness Clinic that will offer both pap smears and mammogram screenings to eligible beneficiaries in Hawaii. While RHC-P’s Madigan Army Medical Center will host its third annual breast cancer screening event for their eligible beneficiaries in the Pacific Northwest.

According to the American Cancer Society, breast cancer is the second leading cause of cancer related death in women.  Lung cancer is the number one cancer that kills women each year. In 2018, there will be approximately 40,920 breast cancer deaths, and over 330,000 new cases of breast cancer among women in the United States. According to the National Breast Cancer Foundation, one in eight women will be diagnosed with breast cancer in her lifetime. 

A World Health Organization study found that breast cancer is the most common cancer in women globally, and affects countries at all levels of modernization. But breast cancer does not only affect women. While statistics from the National Breast Cancer Foundation indicate that breast cancer in men is rare, approximately 2,470 men are diagnosed with breast cancer, leading to 460 deaths, annually. 

Early detection saves lives, contact your provider to ensure you are properly screened. Talk to your provider if you are unsure if you are at risk for breast cancer. To learn more about breast cancer go to nationalbreastcancer.org
column9: 塔科马，华盛顿州，美国
column10: RHC-P将于10月提高人们对乳腺癌的认识
column11: 华盛顿州路易斯-麦考德联合基地10月是乳腺癌宣传月，每年美国的卫生专业人员都会聚集一堂，提高人们对一个影响男女的国际卫生问题的认识。太平洋地区卫生司令部及其军事治疗设施的提供者是卫生保健专业人员的一部分，他们以筛查、预防意识、治疗和善后护理的形式向受疾病影响的人提供支持。在RHC-P的医疗中心，周六将举行乳腺癌筛查活动，以增加受益人获得护理的机会。Tripler陆军医疗中心的家庭医学诊所提供商与Tripler的放射科合作，成立了一家妇女健康诊所，为夏威夷的合格受益人提供巴氏涂片和乳房X光检查。RHC-P的Madigan陆军医疗中心将在太平洋西北部为其合格受益人举办第三届年度乳腺癌筛查活动。据美国癌症协会称，乳腺癌是女性癌症相关死亡的第二大原因。肺癌是每年夺去女性生命的头号癌症。2018年，美国女性乳腺癌死亡人数约为40920人，新增乳腺癌病例超过33万例。根据国家乳腺癌基金会，八个妇女中有一个将在一生中被诊断出患有乳腺癌。世界卫生组织的一项研究发现，乳腺癌是全球妇女中最常见的癌症，影响到各个现代化水平的国家。但是乳腺癌不仅仅影响女性。虽然美国乳腺癌基金会的统计数据表明，男性乳腺癌是罕见的，约2470人被诊断为乳腺癌，每年导致460人死亡。早期检测可以挽救生命，请联系您的提供商以确保您得到了正确的筛查。如果您不确定自己是否有患乳腺癌的风险，请咨询您的医生。要了解更多关于乳腺癌的信息，请访问nationalbreastcancer.org

column2: RHC-P staff awarded for medical readiness contribution
column3:
HONOLULU, Hawaii (July 9, 2018) --- Regional Health Command-Pacific (RHC-P) inducts four new members into prestigious Order of the Military Medical Merit, also known as O2M3. 

Founded in 1982 by the Commanding General of the U.S. Army Health Service Command, the honor recognizes people who have served in the Army Medical Department and through selflessness, have made a sustained contribution to the betterment of Army Medicine. 

RHC-P Commanding General, Brig. Gen. Dennis LeMaster, spoke during the ceremony and emphasized the significance of the award and the arduous selection process. “This award is a big deal and very hard to attain. You’ve had to prove yourselves with contributions having been…recognized, codified, presented and decided upon,” Lemaster said as he congratulated recipients. 

The region’s newest inductees, Master Sgt. James Falls and Sgt. First Class Kristen Stalls from Public Health Command-Pacific, as well as Sgt. First Class Monias Allen and Anton Smith from Regional Health Command-Pacific demonstrated high standards of integrity, moral character and professional competence, earning them the award. 

“Every day I try and do something that inches me closer to a better tomorrow. For me…I’m just doing my job and doing it to my best ability. But to have someone take notice and think me worthy of such an award is a huge surprise and a special honor,” Allen said. 

Falls also shared his sentiment in receiving the medal. “This award is an achievement that a lot of people strive for…the pinnacle of awards in Army Medicine and to be approved and accepted into this very small and professional community is an honor for me,” said Stalls. 

Stalls, who thanked RHC-P Soldier, Master Sgt. Kevin Edmondson for the nomination, says she hopes that earning the recognition provides an example for other Soldiers. “I am so thankful and am honored. This is an opportunity to inspire other Soldiers to go above and beyond and find opportunities where you can do more than what’s required,” Stalls added.  

Smith, who is now the Hospital Administrator and Chief Executive Officer at Shriners Hospitals for Children, a Pediatric Specialty Care non-profit, expressed his appreciation for the recognition. "I am honored to have received this prestigious award and am deeply humbled to be counted among such a high caliber group of Soldiers and civilians, stated Smith. "As a former RHC-P team member, I'm keenly aware of the positive impact Army Medicine is making and am looking forward to our ongoing partnerships between Shriners and Tripler," added Smith in reference to Tripler pediatric orthopedic residential training opportunities provided by Shriners.
column9: 檀香山，你好，美国
column10: RHC-P员工因医疗准备就绪贡献而获奖
column11: 夏威夷火奴鲁鲁（2018年7月9日）--太平洋地区卫生司令部（RHC-P）将四名新成员纳入享有盛誉的军事医学功勋勋章，也称为O2M3。荣誉勋章于1982年由美国陆军卫生服务司令部司令创建，表彰在陆军医疗部门服役并通过无私奉献为改善陆军医疗做出持续贡献的人员。RHC-P指挥官，准将。丹尼斯・勒马斯特将军在仪式上发言，强调了该奖项的重要性和艰难的评选过程。勒马斯特在向获奖者表示祝贺时说：“这个奖项意义重大，很难获得。你们必须证明自己的贡献……得到了认可、编纂、颁发和决定。”。该地区最新的应征者，太平洋公共卫生司令部的詹姆斯・福尔斯上士和克里斯汀・斯泰尔斯上士，以及太平洋地区卫生司令部的莫尼亚斯・艾伦上士和安东・史密斯上士，表现出高度的正直、道德品质和专业能力，赢得了该奖项。艾伦说：“每天我都在努力做一些能让我更接近美好明天的事情。对我来说……我只是在尽我最大的努力做好我的工作。但是有人注意到并认为我配得上这样一个奖项是一个巨大的惊喜和特殊的荣誉。”。福尔斯也分享了他获得奖牌的感想。Stalls说：“这个奖项是很多人努力争取的成果……这是军队医学奖项的顶峰，能够被这个非常小的专业团体认可和接受对我来说是一种荣誉。”。斯塔尔斯感谢RHC-P士兵凯文・埃德蒙森上士的提名，她说她希望获得这一荣誉能为其他士兵树立榜样。史泰尔斯补充道：“我非常感激，也很荣幸。这是一个激励其他士兵超越自我的机会，在那里你可以做更多的事情。”。史密斯现在是一家非盈利的儿科专科护理机构――希尔克斯儿童医院的医院管理者和首席执行官，他对这一认可表示赞赏。史密斯说：“我很荣幸能获得这一荣誉，也为能跻身于如此高水平的士兵和平民群体而深感谦卑。作为前RHC-P团队成员，我非常清楚陆军医学正在产生的积极影响，并期待着我们在Shiners和Tripler之间的持续合作，Smith补充道，他提到了由Histers提供的三倍儿童整形外科住院培训机会。

column2: RHC-P names 2018 Best Warrior winners
column3:
HONOLULU (May 17, 2018) C A Regional Health Command-Pacific (RHC-P) Soldier and Non-Commissioned Officer take home the title of 2018 RHC-P Best Warrior. 

Sgt. Noel Gonzalez, 18th Medical Command (Deployment Support) and Spc. Jan Leo Ras, Dental Health Command-Pacific are the winners of the region’s premier competition, earning a designation as the command’s finest Soldiers, demonstrating commitment to Army values, embodying the Warrior Ethos and representing the force of the future. 

During the three-day challenge, 17 Soldiers from across the command vied for the top spot, where their knowledge, skills and abilities were tested through urban warfare simulations, formal board interviews, physical fitness challenges, written exams and warrior tasks and battle drills. 

The rigorous events are designed to represent today’s operating environment and to develop Soldiers to think critically in a complex and ever changing environment. 

Brig. Gen. Bertram Providence, RHC-P commanding general, provided remarks during the ceremony and highlighted that competitions like Best Warrior are a reminder of how important Army Medicine’s capability is to the warfighter. “With an all-time high survival rate exceeding 90 percent, the Army marches forward with the knowledge that the medic marches right alongside them,” stated Providence.

The commanding general also added that, while RHC-P is an organization that consists of medical personnel, each service member must always remember that being a Soldier comes first. “When battles are waged, it is the medic that may be called upon to climb a mountain in order to render life-saving aid to wounded comrades. But we must first get to the top of that mountain…and then get back down, with patient in tow.  And that takes strength C strength that was displayed among these competitors here today,” he said.

Providence also encouraged the Best Warrior candidates to take their knowledge and share it with other Soldiers. 

Gonzalez, who described his reaction as in shock when his name was called, says he’s relieved the competition is over, but knows the work isn’t done yet. “I have a big responsibility on my shoulder because I’ve got to represent Regional Health Command-Pacific in the next level of the competition,” said Gonzalez. 

The region’s Non-Commissioned Officer of the Year also added his thoughts on what he’ll cherish most about the competition. “The highlight was definitely the other competitors. These guys were a bunch of great people. They made it that much more bearable, especially in the toughest times with lack of sleep, long miles, hard events, but it was good stuff,” Gonzalez added.  

Ras, much like Gonzalez, had no idea he would take home the tile. “It took me by surprise when they called my name. I didn’t think to step forward. I felt someone else might have had the edge over me the entire time so I didn’t expect it at all,” stated Ras. 

The region’s Soldier of the Year says also sid that Best Warrior prepares Soldiers for the next level. “Waking up early in the morning and pushing through until late at night, it really tests your physical and mental abilities. Over the course of three days, you’ve got to keep your composure. You’ve got to maintain your bearing,” said Ras. 

Reflecting back on the competition, Ras also said he’s gained a new perspective of Soldier readiness levels across RHC-P. “I can see that Soldiers represented across RHC-P in the competition are extremely strong competitors. They are all very well trained. They put up a very tough fight. Overall, I am overjoyed to have completed the competition alongside these other warriors. I want to congratulate all of the competitors for an outstanding job,” he added.   

While only two Soldiers were selected, Master Sgt. Fulton Winder III, RHC-P Best Warrior Competition non-commissioned officer in charge, says he’s proud of the level of Soldier readiness, grit and endurance that competitors displayed during the competition. “Every Soldier competed well and showed the tenacity to finish the events. There is no other option in war, but to win. And that’s what the Soldiers did…compete to win. Because in combat, there are no trophies for second place.”

The win also qualifies the RHC-P Best Warriors for the next phase of the competition at the Army Medical Command level competition in June. From there, finalists enter the Army-level competition Sept. 30 C Oct. 5 at Fort A.P. Hill, Virginia.
column9: 檀香山，你好，美国
column10: RHC-P评选2018年最佳勇士奖
column11: 檀香山（2018年5月17日）――太平洋地区卫生司令部（RHC-P）士兵和士官获得2018年RHC-P最佳战士称号。第18医疗司令部（部署支持）的Noel Gonzalez中士和太平洋牙科健康司令部的Spc.Jan Leo Ras中士都是该地区首屈一指的比赛的获胜者，获得了司令部最优秀士兵的称号，展示了对军队价值观的承诺，体现了战士精神，代表了未来的力量。在为期三天的挑战赛中，来自整个司令部的17名士兵争夺冠军，他们的知识、技能和能力通过城市战争模拟、正式董事会面试、体能挑战、笔试、战士任务和战斗演习进行测试。严格的活动旨在代表当今的作战环境，培养士兵在复杂多变的环境中进行批判性思考。布里格。RHC-P指挥官伯特伦・普罗维登斯将军在仪式上发表了讲话，并强调像《最佳战士》这样的比赛提醒我们，陆军医学能力对作战人员来说是多么重要。普罗维登斯说：“由于有史以来最高的存活率超过90%，军队在知道医务人员就在他们身边的情况下向前行进。”指挥官还补充说，虽然RHC-P是一个由医务人员组成的组织，每个军人都必须永远记住，当兵是第一位的。“当战斗开始时，可能会要求医疗人员爬山，以便为受伤的同志提供救生援助。但我们必须先爬到那座山的山顶……然后再下来，带着病人。这需要力量――今天在这里的竞争对手中表现出的力量。”普罗维登斯还鼓励最好的战士候选人利用他们的知识与其他士兵分享。冈萨雷斯说，当他的名字被传唤时，他的反应令人震惊。他说，比赛结束后，他松了一口气，但知道工作还没有完成。冈萨雷斯说：“我肩负着巨大的责任，因为我必须代表太平洋地区卫生司令部参加下一轮的比赛。”。该地区的年度军士长还补充说，他最珍视的比赛是什么。冈萨雷斯补充道：“最引人注目的肯定是其他竞争者。这些人是一群伟大的人。他们让这一切变得更容易忍受，特别是在睡眠不足、长途旅行、艰苦比赛等最艰难的时候，但这是件好事。”。Ras和冈萨雷斯很像，不知道他会把瓷砖带回家。Ras说：“当他们叫我的名字时，我感到很惊讶。我不想站出来。我觉得可能有人在整个过程中都占了我的上风，所以我一点也没想到。”。该地区的年度最佳士兵席德还说，最好的战士为下一个级别的士兵做好准备。Ras说：“早上早起，一直坚持到深夜，这真的考验了你的身体和精神能力。在三天的时间里，你必须保持镇定。你必须保持你的姿态。”。回顾这次比赛，Ras还表示，他对整个RHC-P的士兵战备水平有了新的认识。“我可以看到RHC-P中的士兵都是非常强大的竞争对手。他们都受过良好的训练。他们进行了非常艰苦的战斗。总的来说，我很高兴能与其他战士一起完成比赛。我要祝贺所有竞争对手的出色表现。”虽然只有两名士兵入选，但RHC-P最佳战士竞赛的非委任负责人富尔顿・温德尔三世上士说，他对参赛者在比赛中表现出的士兵准备、毅力和耐力水平感到自豪。“每个士兵都表现得很好，并表现出完成比赛的顽强精神。在战争中，除了胜利，别无选择。这就是士兵们所做的……为了胜利而竞争。因为在战斗中，没有第二名的奖杯。”这场胜利也使RHC-P最佳战士有资格参加6月举行的陆军医疗指挥级比赛的下一阶段比赛。从那时起，入围者将于9月30日至10月5日在弗吉尼亚州A.P.山堡参加陆军级比赛。

column2: RHC-P enhancing readiness through human resources
column3:
Regional Health Command-Pacific (RHC-P) is enhancing medical readiness through an unlikely avenue C the human resources department.

RHC-P held a training and leadership summit Feb. 5-9 in Honolulu, Hawaii, where 45 G-1 professionals and select staff came together from across the pacific region to enhance leadership capabilities, increase knowledge-base in the field and to refine hiring and personnel management processes. 

“Army hospitals and support units are as good as the doctors and team members that work in them. Our team of G-1 professionals are responsible for bringing in the best of the best so that military members, their families, and retirees get the best healthcare possible,” said Col. Samantha Hinchman, RHC-P G-1 director. “When we enhance health, we enhance medical readiness, as well as family wellness. There’s a direct correlation there and we have an important role to play in the hiring, retaining and leading of healthcare providers and support staff,” she said. 

Summit leaders also emphasized the G-1’s vision and how RHC-P nested with the Army’s Medical Command, which is the higher headquarters for RHC-P. Attendees also received information on the way ahead for military and civilian human resources and how to better coordinate in the execution of tasks. 

“We were able to share ideas and processes that enabled us to streamline some functions while pointing out possible issues and how to avoid them,” said Daniel Blashill, the chief of military human resources at Medical Activity-Alaska. “The goal is for the RHC-P G-1 folks to attain top proficiency so that we ensure Soldier and civilian readiness,” he added. 

As part of the agenda, participants also completed a training from the Arbinger Institute, which, according to the foundation’s website, equips employees with practical strategies and tools to implement an outward mindset approach to their work. 

“It was extremely important for us to include this mentoring and coaching aspect to the summit since enabling excellence starts with leaders who not only embrace an outward mindset but practice it on a daily basis. This training further cultivates a leadership approach that moves beyond conflict resolution to conflict transformation,” said Kimberly Reinbrecht, chief of civilian human resources for RHC-P. “This commitment to leadership will no doubt positively impact all aspects of human resources, which, at the end of the day, makes our organization better as we contribute to the medical readiness mission,” added Reinbrecht.

About RHC-P:  RHC-P’s mission is to provide combatant commanders with medically ready forces and ready medical forces conducting health service support in all phases of military operation.
column9: 檀香山，你好，美国
column10: RHC-P通过人力资源提高准备状态
column11: 太平洋地区卫生司令部（RHC-P）正在通过一个不太可能的途径――人力资源部――提高医疗准备状态。RHC-P于2月5日至9日在夏威夷檀香山举行了一次培训和领导力峰会，来自太平洋地区的45名G-1专业人员和精选员工齐聚一堂，以提高领导能力，增加实地知识库，完善招聘和人事管理流程。RHC-P G-1负责人萨曼莎・辛奇曼上校说：“军队医院和支援部队与在其中工作的医生和团队成员一样优秀。我们的G-1专业团队负责引进最好的人，以便军人、他们的家人和退休人员尽可能获得最好的医疗保健。”。她说：“当我们增进健康时，我们就增强了医疗准备和家庭健康。这两者之间有着直接的关系，我们在雇用、留住和领导医疗保健提供者和支持人员方面发挥着重要作用。”。峰会领导人还强调了G-1的愿景，以及RHC-P如何与陆军医疗司令部（RHC-P的上级总部）融为一体。与会者还收到了有关军事和文职人力资源未来发展方向以及如何更好地协调执行任务的信息。阿拉斯加州医疗活动部军事人力资源主管丹尼尔・布拉希尔说：“我们能够分享一些想法和流程，使我们能够简化一些职能，同时指出可能存在的问题以及如何避免这些问题。”。“我们的目标是让RHC-PG-1人员达到最高水平，从而确保士兵和平民做好准备，”他补充道。作为议程的一部分，与会者还完成了阿宾格研究所的培训，根据基金会的网站，他们为员工提供了实用的策略和工具，以实现他们工作的外部思维方式。“对我们来说，将这一指导和辅导方面纳入峰会极为重要，因为实现卓越始于领导者，他们不仅接受外向思维，而且每天都在实践。这一培训进一步培养了一种超越冲突解决到冲突转化的领导方法。”RHC-P文职人力资源主管金伯利・莱因布雷希特（Kimberly Reinbrecht）说，“这种对领导力的承诺无疑将对人力资源的各个方面产生积极影响，最终使我们的组织在为医疗准备任务做出贡献的同时变得更好。”Reinbrecht补充道。关于RHC-P：RHC-P的任务是为战斗指挥官提供医疗准备部队和医疗准备部队，在军事行动的所有阶段提供卫生服务支持。

column2: Fairchild supports Marine Battery P to ‘Fire Mission!’
column3:
At the ready:
On a brisk October morning, The Marines of Battery P, 5th Battalion, 14th Marines, 4th Marine Division, U.S. Marine Forces Reserve, stood ready at their firing positions in the hills of the Yakima Training Center, WA.

Four artillery gun sections stood camouflaged against the surrounding scrubland, unimposing at a distance; a battery of Marines milled about handling minor tasks and talked amongst themselves as they waited.

“Fire mission! Fire mission!” squawked the radio at artillery gun emplacement two.

“Fire mission! Fire mission!” the team of Marines cried out in unison as they leaped to task, dropping everything else.

The gun section leader, Staff Sgt. Alexx Bullion, Reserve Marine Battery P 5/14 artillery section chief, huddles with the radio operator to receive specifics from the battery’s fire direction center on the number of shots, ammunition type, fuse setting, charge strength, bearing and elevation. The chief relays the directions to the hustling crew and in one swift motion, the Marines of gun emplacement two readied their Howitzer with well-oiled precision.

Fairchild reinforces USMC Battery P:
Marine Battery P commenced their latest exercise October 11-14, 2017, one of four live-fire artillery exercises performed each year, in addition to small-arms marksmanship and machine gun training. This most recent display of skill was a direct result of their dedicated training efforts, aided by the support of Fairchild Air Force Base.

“We've been working with Fairchild for the past five years to service the guns, not long after the M777 Howitzer was adopted for use with this unit,” said Capt. Andrew J. Miller, Spokane U.S. Marine Corps support inspector instructor. “We service the guns at the base when possible, because they have the maintenance spaces with the overhead cranes needed to lift the barrels from the howitzers for high-level servicing. It saves us a lot of time and headache it would take to maintain the guns otherwise.”

This support is possible due to service agreements the Department of Defense provides, allowing different service branches and allied partners to assist one another, saving resources, time and money.

“We all fall under the DoD as one military, so the funding also comes from one place and is dispersed according to needs,” said Tech. Sgt. James Williams, 92nd Logistics Readiness Squadron plans and programs NCO in charge. “If Fairchild can support any of our sister service team members, we will do so.”

Battery P lives a significant distance away from a Marine base, so Fairchild fills the gap; supporting them with medical care, continuing education, legal assistance, chapel services and even housing.

"We have a healthy relationship with Fairchild,” Miller said. “We don't have allocation or space for everything here as we are stationed far from the rest of our cloth, so it’s great to have support for our troops and our mission.”

Battery P means business:
"Papa Battery is a Marine Core artillery unit that utilizes six M777A2 155 mm lightweight, medium-towed Howitzers,” said Miller. “They have the mission of providing fire support to infantry ground forces down-range, typically the reserve component, but may serve the active component if the need arises.”

An artillery Battery is expected to be self-sufficient when deployed, where each Marine is charged with providing multiple roles as weapon systems crew and fighters to handle missions, security and transport, Miller said.

“These Reserve Marines are highly skilled to operate these weapon systems," Miller said. “Their performance speaks to their level of dedication to the mission, to their personal sacrifice and accomplishments. Their proficiency is amazing if you consider that they only shoot four times a year vs. an active unit that receives significantly more time training.”

Battery P has safely and accurately fired over 2,000, 155mm projectiles during training exercises over the past year, said Gunnery Sgt. Alton Currie, Battery P 5-14 operations chief.

“It was a good exercise. Training readiness standards is our top priority,” Currie said. “Some Marines have stepped up to greater responsibilities as new emplacement chiefs and this was essential training for them, breaking out all our gear and working with it to get ready for the year ahead.”

Semper Fidelis:
The breech is opened; the barrel cleared, oiled and made ready for action. The loader lugs a 100-pound, 155 mm projectile to the gun, and has Bullion check the fuze prior to placing it onto the loading slide. A long metal rod wielded by two Marines ram the ordnance into the barrel, propellant charges are added; the breach closed and locked.

A Marine announces the gun is ready to fire. Bullion raises his hand: “Prepare to fire!” he warns, less than a minute after the crew was given the fire mission order.

“Fire!” Bullion ordered with a chopping motion.

The howitzer thundered: firing with a power that quaked the ground, causing the surrounding dirt and dust to fly into the air; the shockwave crashing against the crew and reverberating throughout the firing position.

“Reload!” Bullion ordered -- the firing process began anew.
column6: FAIRCHILD AIR FORCE BASE, WA, UNITED STATES
column9: 美国华盛顿州飞兆半导体空军基地
column10: 飞兆半导体支持海军P号炮台执行“火力任务！”
column11: 准备就绪：10月一个轻快的早晨，美国海军陆战队预备役第4海军陆战队师第14海军陆战队第5营P炮台的海军陆战队在西澳州亚基马训练中心山丘上的射击阵地做好了准备。四个火炮组在周围灌木丛中伪装起来，在远处不起作用；一队海军陆战队士兵在等待的时候，在处理一些小任务，互相交谈。“火力任务！火力任务！”无线电在第二炮台发出嘎嘎声。“火力任务！火力任务！”海军陆战队队员们齐声喊着，他们跳到任务上，放下了所有其他的东西。火炮组组长，预备役海军炮兵连P 5/14炮兵科科长亚历克斯・布利恩上士与无线电接线员聚在一起，接收炮兵连火力指挥中心关于射击次数、弹药类型、引信设置、充电强度、方位和高度的详细信息。酋长将方向转达给推搡的船员，在一个快速的动作中，炮位二的海军陆战队以良好的精度准备好了榴弹炮。飞兆半导体加强了美国海军陆战队P连：海军P连于2017年10月11日至14日开始了最新的演习，这是每年进行的四次实弹火炮演习之一，除了小武器射击和机关枪训练。这项最新的技能展示是他们在飞兆半导体空军基地的支持下致力于训练的直接结果。“在M777榴弹炮被用于该部队后不久，我们与飞兆半导体在过去五年中一直在为火炮提供服务，”安德鲁・J・米勒上尉说，斯波坎美国海军陆战队支援检查员讲师。“我们尽可能在基地维修火炮，因为他们有维修空间，需要用高架起重机将炮管从榴弹炮上吊起来进行高水平维修。这为我们节省了大量时间，也为我们节省了维护火炮所需的大量头痛。”这种支持之所以可能，是因为国防部提供了服务协议，允许不同的服务部门和盟军合作伙伴相互协助，节省资源、时间和金钱。“我们都属于国防部，作为一支军队，因此资金也来自一个地方，并根据需要分散。”负责计划和项目的92后勤准备中队士官詹姆斯・威廉姆斯中士说。“如果Fairchild能够支持我们的姐妹服务团队成员，我们会这样做。”P号电池距离海军基地很远，因此Fairchild填补了这一空白；通过医疗、继续教育、法律援助、礼拜堂服务甚至住房来支持他们。“我们与Fairchild有着健康的关系，”米勒说。“我们在这里没有任何分配或空间，因为我们驻扎的地方远离我们的其他地方，所以能为我们的部队和我们的使命提供支持真是太好了。”炮台P意味着业务：“Papa炮台是一个海军核心火炮单元，使用六门M777A2 155毫米轻型中型牵引榴弹炮，”米勒说。“他们的任务是向步兵地面部队的下射程提供火力支援，通常是预备役部队，但如果需要，可以为现役部队提供服务。”火炮连预计在部署时能够自给自足，米勒说，每一名海军陆战队成员都负责提供武器系统乘员和战斗机的多重角色，以处理任务、安全和运输。米勒说：“这些预备役海军陆战队成员非常熟练地操作这些武器系统。”。“他们的表现说明了他们对使命的奉献程度，以及他们个人的牺牲和成就。如果你认为他们一年只射击四次，而不是一个活跃的单位接受更多的时间训练，那么他们的能力是惊人的。”“在过去一年的训练中，P连已经安全、准确地发射了2000多枚155毫米炮弹，”P连5-14作战负责人、炮兵中士阿尔顿・库里（Alton Currie）说。“这是一次很好的演习。训练准备标准是我们的首要任务。”库里说。“一些海军陆战队已经承担起了新的炮位指挥官的更大责任，这对他们来说是必不可少的训练，他们将突破我们所有的装备，并与之一起为来年做好准备。”Semper Fidelis：枪膛打开；枪管清理干净，上油并准备好行动。装弹机将一枚100磅155毫米的弹丸挂在火炮上，并在将引信放在装弹滑道上之前让金条检查引信。两名海军陆战队士兵挥舞着一根长金属棒将弹药撞击到枪管中，添加推进剂装填；缺口关闭并关闭锁定。一名海军陆战队士兵宣布枪准备开火。布利恩举手警告：“准备开火！”在船员接到开火任务命令不到一分钟后，他发出警告。“开火！”布利恩以斩波动作命令射击。榴弹炮雷鸣般地鸣响：发射威力震动地面，使周围的泥土和灰尘飞入空中；冲击波撞击乘员，并在整个射击位置回响。“重新装填！”布利恩命令――射击过程重新开始。

column2: RHC-P top leaders mentor next generation
column3:
HONOLULU -- (Oct. 16, 2017) Regional Health Command-Pacific Commanding General, Brig. Gen. Bertram Providence and RHC-P Senior Enlisted Advisor, Command Sargent Maj. Richard Watson, provide mentorship to Moanalua High School students and Air Force Junior ROTC participants as part of a formal mentorship session with the cadre.

The RHC-P senior leaders visited the military cadets to provide leadership guidance on being good citizens, developing "smart" objectives and career planning.

Providence and Watson have made mentorship a regular effort, making time for student mentorship at various public high schools across the island of Oahu, despite the military leaders' hectic and long work schedules. 

As part of the commanding general's guidance published in December of 2016, Providence placed a focus, one of three, on people. "We must never forget that our people are the foundation to our success and the key to our future," stated Providence. 

RHC-P's mission is to provide combatant commanders with medically ready forces and ready medical forces conducting health services support in all phases of operation.
