column11: 诺福克―北约总部最高盟军司令部转型能力发展副参谋长布鲁斯・格罗姆斯（Bruce Grooms）副上将在每月的专业军事教育期间与海军陆战队成员和退役军人交谈，强调他“永远不会错过与你关心的人聊天的机会”（PME）会议，由国家海军军官协会（NNOA）潮水分会于3月10日主办。在诺福克海军站Breezy Point的谈话中，新郎强调了NNOA的重要性。“NNOA是我们――穿制服的人和退休的人――分享有用的论坛的绝佳机会，”新郎说：“像这样的房间里总有人去过。更重要的是，像这样的房间里总有人真正关心你。关心是帮助你克服障碍的第一步。”此外，新郎还鼓励与会者在他们认为自己可能面临挑战时会面并公开讨论，将寻求帮助与拨打电话相比较。“拨打411电话――让我分享一些信息――总比拨打911好，我的生活着火了，紧急电话。”新郎说。“我能解决任何411的问题；911很难。”新郎出生于克利夫兰，毕业于美国海军学院，后来成为该校第一位非裔美国海军军校军校军校学员指挥官。此外，完成核动力训练的新郎几乎在各种潜艇上担任过各种职务。他是“七周年纪念”在潜艇服役的头100年中指挥过一艘船的七名非裔美国军官。同时，马罗斯被选为1999年斯托克代尔海军中将励志领导力奖得主。马罗斯还提供职业指导。他讨论了真正了解健康报告（FITREP）数据的重要性作为一种了解个人在他或她的命令下的立场的方法。“FITREPS上的数据永远不会让人感到惊讶，”新郎说。“如果你不知道自己的立场，那么你就不知道自己想去哪里。”新郎还提醒与会者，NNOA全国会议将于7月在圣地亚哥举行，与会者通常包括高层领导。“过去几年中，每年海洋服务主管都会出席全国会议，因为他们关心这次会议。但缺少的是你们。”新郎说：“我需要尽可能多的人到场，因为我们试图做的是有机会谈论真正重要的话题，而一些高层领导只会有短暂的时间与你们谈论这些重要的话题。”潮水NNOA在每个月的第三个星期二举行会议。NNOA的任务是通过招募、保留和职业发展，积极支持海军陆战队、海军和海岸警卫队等海上服务部门发展多样化的军官和文职领导团队。

column2: A Crisis Leader -- Vice Adm. Diego E. Duke Hernandez -- Decorated Pilot and Hispanic Hero
column3:
In the lead of a flight of Navy F-4B aircraft from the aircraft carrier USS Ranger (CV-61) into North Vietnam on Dec. 16, 1967, Lt. Cmdr. Diego “Duke” Hernandez’ orders were to destroy a heavily defended bridge, electrical transformer and motor maintenance facility near the port city of Haiphong.

As the flight leader, he had planned a two-prong attack to knock out the facility, but instead of leading the main attack, he took the role of flack suppression, selflessly exposing himself to danger, to pave the way for his squadron mates from Fighter Squadron 21 to deal the decisive blow on the main target. 

According to the citation awarding him the Silver Star -- the nation's third highest decoration for valor in combat Hernandez, "silenced an 85-mm site near the Kien An Highway Bridge with a perfectly placed rocket salvo and then, while checking the other half of his group, sighted an active anti-aircraft site at Kien An Airfield," threatening his squadron mates. He chose to make a second flack suppression run, the citation detailed, knocking out the site and saving the mission. 

"As he pulled out of this run his aircraft sustained a direct hit which destroyed both hydraulic systems and rendered the control stick useless," the citation reads. "With the stabilizer locked in the full up position, Hernandez flew the aircraft through a series of high G, rudder-controlled barrel rolls out of enemy territory.”

Once out to sea in the Gulf of Tonkin, Hernandez and his radar officer ejected and were quickly rescued.

That wasn't the only narrow escape Hernandez had during his two combat tours that saw him rack up 147 combat missions over North Vietnam and having two aircraft shot out from under him. 

His combat service would also see him awarded the Purple Heart, the Distinguished Flying Cross, ten air medals and three Navy Commendation Medals, all with Combat V devices. Along the way he racked up 5,732 flight hours and 750 carrier landings.

Born and raised in San Juan, Puerto Rico, Hernandez was the son of two working class schoolteachers.  His love of reading and continuous learning, a habit recognized for creating strong minds, great leaders, and military professionals, began with the subtle example his parents provided and set him on a path to be one of our great Naval heroes.

"I didn't plan to have a career as a naval officer, I saw a chance to get a free education in the United States and I took it," Hernandez said in a 2011 interview. "When I was in high school in Puerto Rico, I heard the Navy gave scholarships to study in the United States,” referring to the Navy Reserve Officers Training Corps scholarship, which still remains as one of the premier commissioning programs available to high school seniors.

Hernandez would rise to command Fighter Squadron 84, the oiler USS Truckee (AO-147) and the aircraft carrier USS John F. Kennedy (CV-67).  As a flag officer, he commanded Naval Forces, Caribbean, Carrier Strike Group SIX, and U.S. Third Fleet.  He finished his incredible career as deputy commander of U.S. Space Command and vice commander of North American Aerospace Defense Command before retiring in 1991.  At the time, he was the senior Naval Officer of Hispanic descent on active-duty.

After his retirement, he served on the advisory committee for the Department of Veterans Affairs' Center for Minority Veterans, helped plan future transportation needs for Miami-Dade County, and even co-founded the Town of Miami Lakes Veterans Affairs Committee, where he called home.

Still, he never forgot his Puerto Rican roots. In 1998, Hernández testified before the Senate urging Congress to respond in the Puerto Rican struggle to achieve political self-determination as a state of their own, consistent with the sacrifice to our nation he and others like him had, and continue to fight, to defend.

Hernandez passed away July 7, 2017 after a long battle with Parkinson’s Disease.

Hernandez’s contribution to our Navy’s legacy came from his own words in that 2011 interview about an inner feeling all who serve on active-duty and in the reserves today can identify with:  “I was a professional pilot and naval officer. [It] was not what I did, it was who I was.”

For more news from Chief of Naval Personnel, follow us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/mynavyhr, Twitter at https://twitter.com/mynavyhr or visit https://www.navy.mil/cnp.

Lt. Cmdr. Rolando Machado contributed to this story.
column9: 美国
column10: 危机领导人迭戈・E・杜克・埃尔南德斯（Diego E.Duke Hernandez）副上将被授予飞行员和西班牙裔英雄勋章
column11: 1967年12月16日，在海军F-4B飞机从美国“Ranger”号航空母舰（CV-61）飞往北越南的飞行中，Diego“Duke”Hernandez中校下令摧毁港口城市海防附近一座戒备森严的桥梁、变压器和电机维修设施。作为飞行领导人，他曾计划进行双管齐下的攻击以摧毁该设施，但他没有主导主要攻击，而是扮演了高射炮压制的角色，无私地将自己暴露在危险之中，为来自21战斗机中队的中队队友对主要目标进行决定性打击铺平道路。根据授予他银星奖的引文――国家第三高的战斗英勇勋章埃尔南德斯，“用一枚完美安置的火箭齐射使基安公路桥附近的一个85毫米场地沉默，然后，在检查他的另一半队员时，看到基安机场的一个活跃防空场地，”威胁他的中队队友。他选择进行第二次高射炮压制行动，引证详细，摧毁了现场，拯救了任务。引文中写道：“当他退出这次飞行时，他的飞机遭受了直接撞击，摧毁了两个液压系统，使操纵杆失效。”。“稳定器锁定在完全向上位置时，埃尔南德斯驾驶飞机通过一系列高G、舵控枪管滚出敌方领土。”一旦在东京湾出海，埃尔南德斯和他的雷达官员弹射并迅速获救。这不是埃尔南德斯在两次战斗中唯一的一次侥幸逃生当时，他在北越上空完成了147次战斗任务，两架飞机从他脚下起飞。他的战斗服务还将授予他紫心勋章、杰出飞行十字勋章、10枚空军勋章和3枚海军表彰勋章，所有这些勋章都配有战斗V型装置。一路上，他共飞行5732小时，航母着陆750次出生并成长于波多黎各圣胡安的埃尔南德斯是两位工人阶级教师的儿子。他热爱阅读和持续学习，这是一种公认的培养坚强头脑、伟大领袖和军事专业人士的习惯，从他父母提供的微妙榜样开始，让他走上了成为我们伟大海军英雄之一的道路。”赫尔南德斯在2011年的一次采访中说：“我不打算从事海军军官的职业，我看到了一个在美国接受免费教育的机会，我抓住了这个机会。当我在波多黎各读高中时，我听说海军提供奖学金到美国学习，”指的是海军预备役军官训练团奖学金，埃尔南德斯将升任84战斗机中队司令、加油机特鲁基号（AO-147）和约翰・F・肯尼迪号（CV-67）航空母舰司令。作为一名旗舰军官，他指挥着海军、加勒比海、第六航母战斗群和美国第三舰队。1991年退休前，他以美国航天司令部副司令和北美航空航天防御司令部副司令的身份结束了令人难以置信的职业生涯。当时，他是现役西班牙裔的高级海军军官。退休后，他在退伍军人事务部少数派退伍军人中心的咨询委员会任职，帮助规划迈阿密戴德县未来的交通需求，甚至与他人共同创建了迈阿密湖镇退伍军人事务委员会，尽管如此，他从未忘记自己的波多黎各血统。1998年，埃尔南德斯在参议院作证，敦促国会在波多黎各争取实现政治自决的斗争中作出反应，作为一个属于自己的国家，这与他和其他像他一样的人为捍卫国家所做的牺牲是一致的。埃尔南德斯于7月7日去世，2017年，在与帕金森病长期斗争之后。埃尔南德斯对我们海军遗产的贡献来自他自己在2011年的采访中所说的话，关于所有现役和预备役军人都能认同的内心感受：“我是一名专业飞行员和海军军官。[这]不是我所做的，而是我是谁。”有关海军参谋长的更多消息，请访问Facebook上的https://www.facebook.com/mynavyhr，推特https://twitter.com/mynavyhr 或参观https://www.navy.mil/cnp.Lt. 罗兰多・马查多中校促成了这个故事。

column2: Welcome Aboard, Rear Adm. Selby! New CNR Takes Helm at Office of Naval Research
column3:
The Office of Naval Research (ONR) ushered in a new era of leadership Friday, as Rear Adm. Lorin C. Selby―a decorated submarine commander, naval engineer, and acquisition officer―was sworn in as the new Chief of Naval Research (CNR).

In a first for ONR, the change-of-command ceremony took place at ONR headquarters in Arlington, Virginia, but was streamed virtually to the wider CNR community, due to COVID-19 safety concerns.
 
Vice Chief of Naval Operations Adm. Robert P. Burke was the guest speaker at the ceremony.

As the new head of ONR, Selby will oversee the roughly $2 billion Department of the Navy budget for naval science and technology programs. 
 
ONR supports science efforts around the world, from basic and conceptual research to applied research and quick-turnaround technologies requested by Sailors and Marines. Established in 1946 by public law, ONR’s mission is to “plan, foster and encourage scientific research in recognition of its paramount importance as related to the maintenance of future naval power, and the preservation of national security.”

“I’m excited and honored to take command of ONR,” said Selby, “which is an essential organization ensuring our Sailors and Marines are fully equipped with the weaponry and technology needed to remain dominant in the battlespace of today and the future.”

Concurrent with the duties of CNR, he also will serve as director, Innovation, Technology Requirements and Test and Evaluation (OPNAV N94).

Selby holds a Bachelor of Science in nuclear engineering from the University of Virginia―as well as a Master of Science in nuclear engineering and a Nuclear Engineer degree from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
 
He takes ONR’s helm after serving as the Naval Sea Systems Command’s chief engineer and deputy commander for Ship Design, Integration and Naval Engineering. That command is responsible for providing the engineering and scientific expertise, knowledge, and technical authority necessary to design, build, maintain, repair, modernize, certify, and dispose of the Navy’s ships, submarines, and associated warfare systems.

“ONR is rightly celebrated as the Navy’s leading science and technology organization,” he said. “I hope to build on that legacy by stimulating collaboration and partnerships that will enable our warfighters to tackle the challenges of 21st-century warfare.”

Selby succeeds Rear Adm. David J. Hahn, himself a decorated submarine commander and acquisition officer, who is retiring after a distinguished naval career.
 
During his tenure as CNR, Hahn promoted a vision to significantly unify and enhance the relevance and responsiveness of ONR to the Department of the Navy. This involved investing in the right scientists to ensure the Navy and Marine Corps are always linked to scientific discovery; providing a steady infusion of relevant technology into existing programs of record; and disrupting adversaries’ calculus through innovative capabilities. 
 
Hahn accelerated development in such areas as directed-energy weapons, cyber, artificial intelligence, and autonomous vehicles.
 
Hahn said ONR will be in excellent hands with Selby.
 
“Rear Adm. Selby brings to ONR dynamic leadership, a strong engineering background, and invaluable experience in the federal acquisition process,” said Hahn. “In this time of increased competition with emergent powers, he is the right person to lead the command as it continues to enhance the scientific and technological capabilities of the Navy and Marine Corps.”  
 
Warren Duffie Jr. is a contractor for ONR Corporate Strategic Communications.
column9: 美国弗吉尼亚州阿灵顿
column10: 欢迎登机，塞尔比少将！新CNR将执掌海军研究办公室
column11: 海军研究办公室（ONR）于周五迎来了一个新的领导时代，海军研究办公室（ONR）的新任首席海军研究官、海军工程师和采办官洛林・C・塞尔比海军少将在弗吉尼亚州阿灵顿的ONR总部宣誓就任，但由于新冠病毒-19的安全问题，它几乎被传播到了更广泛的CNR社区。海军作战部副部长罗伯特・P・伯克上将是仪式的嘉宾发言人。作为ONR的新任主管，塞尔比将监督海军部大约20亿美元的海军科技项目预算。ONR支持世界各地的科学工作，从基础和概念研究到应用研究，以及海员和海军陆战队要求的快速周转技术。ONR于1946年根据公法成立，其使命是“规划、促进和鼓励科学研究，认识到其对维护未来海军力量和维护国家安全的极端重要性。”“我很高兴并荣幸能指挥ONR，”塞尔比说，“这是一个重要的组织，确保我们的水兵和海军陆战队拥有在当今和未来战场上保持主导地位所需的武器和技术。”在履行CNR职责的同时，他还将担任创新、技术要求和测试与评估总监（OPNAV N94）塞尔比拥有弗吉尼亚大学核工程学士学位、核工程硕士和麻省理工学院核工程硕士学位，担任海军海上系统司令部总工程师和舰船设计副指挥官。集成和海军工程。该司令部负责提供设计、建造、维护、维修、现代化、认证和处置海军舰艇、潜艇和相关作战系统所需的工程和科学专业知识、知识和技术权威。他说：“ONR被誉为海军领先的科学技术组织，这是理所当然的。我希望通过促进合作和伙伴关系，在这一传统的基础上再接再厉，使我们的战士能够应对21世纪战争的挑战。”塞尔比接替海军少将大卫・J・哈恩（David J.Hahn），他本人是一名获得勋章的潜艇指挥官和采办官，在出色的海军生涯后即将退休。在担任CNR期间，哈恩提出了一个愿景，即显著统一和提高ONR对海军部的相关性和响应能力。这涉及到投资正确的科学家确保海军和海军陆战队始终与科学发现联系在一起；将相关技术稳步注入现有的记录项目；并通过创新能力打破对手的计算。哈恩加速了定向能武器、网络、人工智能等领域的发展，哈恩说，ONR将与塞尔比携手合作。哈恩说：“塞尔比少将为ONR带来了充满活力的领导力、强大的工程背景以及在联邦收购过程中的宝贵经验。”。“在这个与紧急力量竞争日益激烈的时代，他是领导司令部的合适人选，因为司令部将继续提高海军和海军陆战队的科技能力。”Warren Duffie Jr.是ONR公司战略通信的承包商。

column2: ‘Tropic Lightning’ Soldiers earn coveted EIB
column3:
SCHOFIELD BARRACKS, Hawaii ― More than 160 Soldiers were awarded the prestigious Expert Infantryman Badge at F Quad, here, on June 15, 2018.

Infantrymen assigned to the 25th Infantry Division’s, “Tropic Lightning,” 2nd Brigade Combat Team and 3rd Bde. Combat Team, participated in the grueling weeklong testing. 

Command Sgt. Major Brian A. Hester, senior enlisted advisor, 25th Infantry Division, gave his remarks on congratulating the newly minted expert infantrymen.

“I’m very honored to be among such great Americans,” Hester said. “One day after the 243rd birthday of our Army, which has had millions of infantrymen serve and defend this nation within its ranks. In fact the first Soldiers in our Army were infantrymen.”

“This is a defining moment in an infantryman’s career,” he said. “Earning the Expert Infantryman Badge is a difficult task that requires the completion of almost 40 individual tasks. You mastered each one of these tasks and were evaluated against a demanding standard.”

The Soldiers also participated in an Army Physical Fitness Test, day and night land navigation at East Range, and a 12-mile ruck march around the post to earn the coveted EIB.

“The EIB was created in 1944 by then Chief of Staff of the Army, General George C. Marshall, to honor the United States Army infantryman,” he said. “It was instituted to build and maintain esprit de corps within the U.S. Army infantry units.”

Sgt. Roynald Allen, infantryman, 2nd Battalion, 35th Inf. Regiment, 3rd BCT, 25th ID, described what he had to do to earn the EIB.

“The EIB was a variety of multiple tasks that I trained up for weekly,” Allen said. “I studied in my off time to better prepare myself. Once the time came I was able to actually get everything correct in sequence in order to get a go.”

Out of the numerous infantry tasks Allen had to accomplish at Area X-ray, he had to work extra hard at one of the most difficult event.

“I was worried about the patrol lane,” he said. “Last year I got a double no-go at the grenade station. This year I got my first time go, so I was really proud of that.”
column9: 斯科菲尔德兵营，你好，美国
column10: “热带闪电”士兵赢得令人垂涎的EIB
column11: 肖菲尔德兵营，夏威夷-2018年6月15日，160多名士兵在F Quad被授予著名的步兵专家徽章。步兵被分配到第25步兵师的“热带闪电”、第2旅战斗队和第3 Bde。战斗队，参加了为期一周的艰苦测试。海军司令部中士、第25步兵师高级应征顾问布赖恩・海丝特少校在祝贺新成立的专家步兵时说：“我很荣幸能成为如此伟大的美国人之一。”。“在我军243岁生日后的一天，我军有数百万步兵在其军队中服役和保卫国家。事实上，我军的第一批士兵是步兵。”“这是步兵职业生涯的决定性时刻，”他说。“获得步兵专家徽章是一项艰巨的任务，需要完成近40项个人任务。你掌握了这些任务中的每一项，并根据严格的标准进行了评估。”士兵们还参加了陆军体能测试、东岭昼夜陆地导航，“EIB是由当时的陆军参谋长乔治・C・马歇尔将军于1944年创建的，目的是向美国陆军步兵致敬，”他说。“它是为了在美国陆军步兵部队中建立和维持团队精神而设立的。”罗纳尔德・艾伦中士（Roynald Allen），步兵，第二营，第35中导团，BCT第3团，第25身份证，描述了他必须做些什么来获得EIB。“EIB是我每周训练的多种任务，”艾伦说。“我在业余时间学习是为了更好地为自己做准备。一旦时机成熟，我就能够把所有事情按顺序正确地安排好，以便开始行动。”艾伦在X光区域必须完成的众多步兵任务中，他不得不在一个最困难的项目上加倍努力。“我担心巡逻车道，”他说。“去年我在手榴弹站被双重禁止。今年我第一次被禁止，所以我真的为此感到骄傲。”

column2: Helicopter Training Squadron 18 Receives Adm. John H. Towers Flight Safety Award
column3:
The Order of Daedalians recognized the “Vigilant Eagles” of Helicopter Training Squadron (HT) 18’s outstanding safety record for 2018 with the Adm. John H. Towers Flight Safety Award, May 17.

Cmdr. Kenneth Kerr, HT-18’s commanding officer accepted the award on behalf of his squadron during a ceremony hosted at Training Air Wing 5 in Milton, Florida.

The award is presented to squadrons that have maintained an outstanding safety record and made significant contributions to the Naval Aviation Safety Program throughout the year. All squadrons within the Naval Air Training Command engaged in training student naval aviators or student naval flight officers are eligible to compete for this award.

"We are constantly making improvements in our Naval Aviation Safety Program to fit a fast-paced and demanding field,” Chief of Naval Air Training Safety Officer Cmdr. Nathan Bitz said. “We are proud to have the op to recognize squadrons that meet and exceed these safety standards.” 

HT-18 received the Towers award in 2002 and has maintained a superior safety record since then. 

The selection for this award is based upon reports of Class A, B, and C aircraft flight mishaps, Class A and B aircraft ground mishaps, how much time the squadron spent mishap free, and the quality of mishap reports. Apart from the mishap report, the number of aircraft being flown and the number of days the aircraft spent detached from the squadron contribute to selection criteria.

“This is a commendable achievement," said Kerr. "I am truly honored to accept this award, but all the credit goes to our safety department and instructor pilots.  It is their day-to-day decision making and grit that has allowed HT-18 to operate so safely, while simultaneously maintaining the highest quality instruction.  We are developing future combat aviators and their ownership of the mission makes me extremely proud to be a Vigilant Eagle.”

The Order of Daedalians is a non-profit organization that advocates for air and space power and honors military aviators. It is headquartered at Randolph Air Force Base, San Antonio. The award, named for Adm. John H. Towers, who was a designated naval pilot in 1911, recognizes squadrons for their commitment to flight safety. Towers was known for his many pioneer accomplishments during his career, one of which was the establishment of the first naval flight school in Pensacola, Florida.

HT-18, established in 1972, provides rotary-wing training and designation to selected members of the Navy, Marine Corps, and Coast Guard, along with various allied nations. Its primary mission is to transition student aviators through basic and advanced rotary-wing pilot training. HT-18 is one of six squadrons under Training Air Wing 5.
column9: 美国佛罗里达州米尔顿
column10: 直升机训练中队18号获得海军上将约翰・H・托尔斯飞行安全奖
column11: Daedalians骑士团于2018年5月17日授予海军上将John H.Towers飞行安全奖，表彰直升机训练中队（HT）18的“警惕鹰”2018年杰出安全记录。HT-18的指挥官肯尼斯・克尔（Kenneth Kerr）在佛罗里达州米尔顿市训练航空联队5号举行的仪式上代表他的中队接受了该奖项。该奖项颁发给了在全年中保持了卓越安全记录并为海军航空安全计划做出重大贡献的中队。海军航空训练司令部内所有训练海军飞行学员或海军飞行学员的中队都有资格参加该奖项的竞争。“我们正在不断改进我们的海军航空安全计划，以适应快节奏和高要求的领域，”海军航空训练安全主任Nathan Bitz少校说。“我们很自豪能够有op来认可满足和超过这些安全标准的中队。”HT-18在2002年获得了塔楼奖，并自那时起保持了卓越的安全记录。该奖项的评选基于A类、B类和C类飞机飞行事故报告、A类和B类飞机地面事故报告、中队无事故时间以及事故报告质量。除了事故报告外，飞行中的飞机数量以及飞机与中队分离的天数也构成了选择标准。“这是一项值得称赞的成就，”克尔说我真的很荣幸接受这个奖项，但所有的荣誉都归于我们的安全部门和教练飞行员。正是他们的日常决策和毅力使HT-18能够如此安全地运行，同时保持最高质量的指导。我们正在发展未来的战斗飞行员和他们对任务的所有权Daedalians骑士团是一个非营利性组织，倡导空中和太空力量，向军事飞行员致敬。它的总部设在圣安东尼奥的伦道夫空军基地。该奖项以1911年被指定为海军飞行员的海军上将约翰・H・托尔斯命名，以表彰各中队对飞行安全的承诺。托尔斯以其职业生涯中的许多开创性成就而闻名，其中之一是在佛罗里达州彭萨科拉建立了第一所海军飞行学校。1972年成立的HT-18为海军、海军陆战队和海岸警卫队以及各盟国的选定成员提供旋转翼训练和指定。它的主要任务是通过基本和高级旋转翼飞行员培训使学生飞行员过渡。HT-18是空军第五联队训练的六个中队之一。

column2: Rear Adm. Chip Rock Recognizes NAS Oceana, JEB LCFS Public Works Department Employees
column3:
From Naval Facilities Engineering Command Mid-Atlantic Public Affairs

VIRGINIA BEACH, VIRGINIA -- Commander, Navy Region Mid-Atlantic Rear Adm. Charles “Chip” Rock met with Naval Air Station (NAS) Oceana and Joint Expeditionary Base, Little Creek-Fort Story (JEB LCFS) Public Works Department (PWD) employees, March 3, onboard NAS Oceana, to recognize them for their recent hard work and accomplishments.

The Naval Facilities Engineering Systems Command Mid-Atlantic public works employees from NAS Oceana and JEB LCFS responded expeditiously, Feb 2, to an emergent water main rupture that was immediately affecting the Lincoln Military Housing Wadsworth Shores. Working late into the night, they repaired the rupture, insuring the more than 600 families living in the complex had their water restored in a timely manner.

After a few consecutive days of rainfall and freezing weather, installations throughout the Hampton Roads area were dealing with multiple water line ruptures and breaks. The PWD Oceana team had already been working two other breaks on the Dam Neck Annex that affected multiple facilities to include a barracks.

The team was contacted mid-afternoon regarding the emergent ruptured water line at Wadsworth Shores Housing. After securing from the barracks repair, the team mobilized immediately to begin, what would be an all afternoon, late evening repair evolution.

“When support was needed for pumping operations to remove the water and enable necessary digging operations, the team ‘phoned a friend’ and received unquestioned support from their brothers at Little Creek,” said PWD Oceana Public Works Officer Cmdr. Lakeeva Gunderson. “To come out in the middle of the night without prior notice or knowledge of the situation, and stay with the team until repairs were complete is awe-inspiring.”

Gunderson added that the fact that any PWD employee would assist another PWD without hesitation for whatever and whenever, speaks volumes to the true relationships the teams have built over the years.

“This is what the production supervisors have made into a culture for our Hampton Roads’ Public Works Departments. The bond shared between the PWDs is undeniable,” she said.
column9: 弗吉尼亚海滩，弗吉尼亚州，美国
column10: Chip Rock后方海军上将表彰NAS Oceana、JEB LCFS公共工程部员工
column11: 来自海军设施工程司令部大西洋中部公共事务弗吉尼亚州弗吉尼亚海滩――海军地区大西洋中部后方司令查尔斯・奇普・洛克海军上将于3月3日在海军航空站Oceana上会见了海军航空站（NAS）Oceana和小河堡故事联合远征基地（JEB LCFS）公共工程部（PWD）员工，2月2日，来自NAS Oceana和JEB LCFS的海军设施工程系统司令部中大西洋公共工程部员工迅速响应了一次紧急水管破裂事件，该事件立即影响了林肯军事住房沃兹沃斯海岸。他们工作到深夜，修复了破裂处，确保居住在建筑群中的600多个家庭及时恢复供水。在连续几天的降雨和冰冻天气之后，汉普顿路地区的设施正在处理多处水管破裂和破裂。PWD Oceana团队已经在大坝颈部附件上进行了另外两次破坏，这影响了包括营房在内的多个设施。下午中旬，就Wadsworth Shores Housing的紧急破裂水管线与该团队取得了联系。在确保营房维修安全后，团队立即动员起来，开始整个下午、深夜的维修工作。PWD Oceana公共工程官员Lakeeva Gunderson少校说：“当抽水作业需要支持以清除积水并进行必要的挖掘作业时，团队‘打电话给朋友’，并从他们在Little Creek的兄弟那里获得了毫无疑问的支持。”。“在半夜不事先通知或了解情况的情况下出来，与车队保持联系，直到完成维修是令人敬畏的。”Gunderson补充说，任何PWD员工无论何时何地都会毫不犹豫地帮助另一个PWD，这一事实充分说明了团队多年来建立的真正关系。“这就是生产主管为我们汉普顿路公共工程部门打造的文化。PWD之间的纽带是不可否认的，”她说。

column2: Storied company guidon from Vietnam finds way home
column3:
FORT HOOD, Texas C The small company flag C known in the military as a guidon C flew over an airmobile infantry company of 160 Soldiers during some of the bloodiest battles of the Vietnam War.

The guidon flew over Company B, 2nd Battalion, 8th Cavalry Regiment, 1st Cavalry Division, during the Battle of Dak To in November 1967, the Battle of Tam Quan in December 1967, the TET Offensive from January to May 1968, the A Shau Valley Incursion from April to May 1968, and the operations in the vicinity of the infamous Landing Zone Carol/Fire Support Base Ripcord from July to August 1968.
	
Friday, the guidon was formally presented to the company by the Vietnam veterans whom had cared for it for nearly 50 years. The veterans of Co. B., 2-8 Cav., who served from 1967 to 1968 in Vietnam, started an organization called Eager Arms, after their radio call sign in Vietnam, and meet regularly.
	
“Bandog Company was honored to have the Vietnam veterans of Co. B, 2-8 Cav. in our company area today,” said Capt. Joseph Dywan, commander, Co. B, 2-8 Cav. “It was an outstanding event where Bandog Company memorialized the fallen Soldiers of Co. B, 2-8 Cav., symbolized by the bestowment of the company’s guidon that they flew in Vietnam. The company is honored to be the recipient of such a sentimental icon, and we have it proudly displayed in our company hallway along with pictures that represents Bandog Company’s proud and valorous history.”
	
Vietnam veterans read a roll call of those fallen service members from the unit, and then presented the guidon to Dywan and 1st Sgt. Isaac McKee, Co. B, 2-8 CAV.
	
“We all agree it means a lot to connect to the active duty unit,” said Peter Genecki, a native of Helmetta, New Jersey. “It has been fantastic for us to return this flag to the company, one piece of the puzzle.”
	
The ceremony was important for the Soldiers currently serving in Bandog Company.
	
“Today was a good day,” said McKee. “Not only did we get to honor our Vietnam Co. B, 2-8 Cav brothers, we also got to reflect on their hard times and share stories of past and present combat.  Our Soldiers realized that a guidon is not just a piece of cloth, but a piece of history, and represents all the Soldiers who served under it.  Every Bandog Soldier who passes by the guidon that hangs in the hallway will forever remember the 126 men who died in Vietnam from 1965 to 1971 while serving with Co. B, 2-8 Cav.”
column9: 美国德克萨斯州胡德堡
column10: 越南著名公司guidon找到回家的路
column11: 德克萨斯州胡德堡―在越南战争最血腥的几场战斗中，一个由160名士兵组成的空中机动步兵连的上空飘扬着小连队的旗帜。1967年11月，在达克战役中，一骑兵师第8骑兵团第2营B连的上空飘扬着这面旗帜，1967年12月的谭泉战役，1968年1月至5月的春节攻势，1968年4月至5月的阿绍谷入侵，以及1968年7月至8月在臭名昭著的登陆区卡罗尔/火力支援基地撕裂带附近的行动。星期五，guidon是由关心它近50年的越南老兵正式赠送给该公司的。1967年至1968年在越南服役的2-8 Cav公司的退伍军人在越南的无线电呼号后成立了一个名为“渴望武器”的组织，并定期会面。“班多格公司很荣幸今天有2-8 Cav公司的越南退伍军人来到我们连区，”2-8 Cav公司指挥官约瑟夫・迪万上尉说。“班多格公司纪念2-8 Cav.B公司的阵亡士兵，这是一个杰出的事件，他们在越南飞行时获得了该公司的guidon标志。班多格公司很荣幸获得了这样一个感伤的图标，我们在公司走廊上骄傲地展示了它以及代表越南的图片班多格公司引以为豪的英勇历史。“越南老兵宣读了该部队阵亡军人的点名，然后向迪万和1号中士艾萨克・麦基（2-8 CAV）赠送了圭登。我们都同意，与现役部队建立联系意义重大，”新泽西州赫尔梅塔人彼得・杰内基（Peter Genecki）说。麦基说：“对于我们来说，把这面旗帜还给连队真是太棒了，这是拼图的一部分。这个仪式对目前在班多格连队服役的士兵来说很重要。今天是个好日子。”。“我们不仅向我们的越南公司B、2-8名Cav兄弟致敬，还回顾了他们的艰难时期，分享了过去和现在的战斗故事。我们的士兵意识到，圭登不仅是一块布，而且是一段历史，代表了所有在它手下服役的士兵。每一个经过圭登的班多格士兵挂在走廊上的那张照片将永远铭记1965年至1971年在越南服役的126名男子，他们当时在2-8 Cav服役。”

column2: Rear Adm. Peter J. Brown visits FIU to speak with students about CSPI program
column3:
MIAMI - U.S. Coast Guard Rear Adm. Peter J. Brown, the assistant commandant for response policy, visited Florida International University on March 4 to speak with Honors College students about the Coast Guard’s College Student Pre-Commissioning Initiative.

“It’s a way for college students to get their junior and senior year of college paid for,” said Brown.

The Coast Guard partnered with FIU to increase engagement for the Coast Guard’s overall officer recruiting effort and provide more tuition-saving options and academic solutions to FIU students and professors.

The CSPI scholarship program funds tuition for up to two years of college as a well as books, fees, full time Coast Guard salary, housing allowance and medical benefits. CSPI candidates are enlisted in the Coast Guard while enrolled in school and get a guaranteed slot in the Coast Guard’s Officer Candidate School upon graduation. Students enrolled or accepted for enrollment in a full-time bachelor’s degree program at a CSPI designated college or institution can apply for the program.

“We’re making an effort for our recruiting offices to get to students at the community colleges, and to freshmen and sophomores at FIU so they can apply for the program,” said Brown.

Brown said he asked to be connected with FIU because he understands how important relationship building is with our neighbors to the south. He particularly wanted to work with a Hispanic serving institution.

Brown signed a Memorandum of Agreement with Mark Rosenberg, the president of FIU, in 2014 giving an overall strategic vision for the partnership.

A full service university is a great opportunity for the Coast Guard and others to engage with academia, industry and government in Central America, South America and the Caribbean, said Brown.

To learn more about CSPI and other Coast Guard scholarship programs, contact your local Coast Guard recruiting office or visit gocoastguard.com.
column9: 迈阿密，佛罗里达州，美国
column10: 海军少将彼得・布朗访问金融情报室，与学生讨论CSPI项目
column11: 迈阿密―美国海岸警卫队后方海军上将彼得・布朗（Peter J.Brown）是负责应对政策的助理指挥官，他于3月4日访问了佛罗里达国际大学，与荣誉大学的学生就海岸警卫队的大学生预调试计划进行了交谈。“这是大学生获得大学三年级和四年级学费的一种方式，”布朗说。海岸警卫队与金融情报室合作，以增加海岸警卫队整体官员招聘工作的参与度，并为金融情报室学生和教授提供更多的学费节约选择和学术解决方案。CSPI奖学金计划为长达两年的大学学费以及书籍、费用、全职海岸警卫队奖学金提供资金y、 住房津贴和医疗福利。CSPI候选人在入学时被招募到海岸警卫队，毕业后获得海岸警卫队军官候选学校的保证名额。在CSPI指定的学院或机构注册或接受全日制学士学位课程的学生可以申请“我们正在努力让我们的招生办公室接触到社区学院的学生，以及佛罗里达大学的大一和大二学生，以便他们能够申请该项目。”布朗说。布朗说，他要求与金融情报室建立联系是因为他了解与我们南部邻国建立关系的重要性。他特别希望与一家西班牙裔服务机构合作。2014年，布朗与金融情报室总裁马克・罗森博格签署了一份协议备忘录，为金融情报室提供了总体战略愿景他表示，合作伙伴关系。布朗说，一所全方位服务的大学是海岸警卫队和其他机构与中美洲、南美洲和加勒比地区学术界、工业界和政府接触的绝佳机会。要了解CSPI和其他海岸警卫队奖学金项目的更多信息，请联系当地海岸警卫队招募办公室或访问gocoastguard.c嗯。

column2: PACFLT cybersecurity conference highlights cyber capabilities
column3:
By Mass Communications Specialist 2nd Class Tamara Vaughn, U.S. Pacific Fleet Public Affairs

PEARL HARBOR, Hawaii C More than 160 cybersecurity specialists met at Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam Feb. 9-11 to discuss cyber readiness within the Pacific Fleet (PACFLT).

The Cybersecurity Waterfront Training Symposium, hosted by PACFLT, provided Hawaii-based afloat and ashore leadership and civilian cybersecurity workforce personnel with training and a better understanding of cybersecurity initiatives. The theme of the event highlighted the importance of “Bringing Actionable Cyber Capabilities to the Fleet.”

“We need the senior leaders to understand the importance of cybersecurity ... ” said Capt. Danny Sadoski, PACFLT deputy communications and information systems officer. “ ... that cyber is part of their business, and that it’s a warfare tool they have that they can use.” 

Adm. Scott Swift, commander of U.S. Pacific Fleet, kicked off the Navy information warfareCled event.

“Because of the context of the challenges we face in the Pacific, I am focused on two key areas, one is defense and the other is offense,” Swift said. “From a cyber perspective, offense is a national risk and that is why the authority is held at the national level. My focus is also on defense to improve cybersecurity for the fleet.” 

The information shared during the event was geared toward understanding and familiarization of increased volume and sophistication of cyber threats and to prepare to defend against these types of threats. 

“I think it’s important to have events like this to answer questions about cybersecurity,” said Ensign Aaron Fleming, USS Chafee’s (DDG 90) cybersecurity officer. “It has opened my eyes to a lot of things I didn’t know, in particular about the different cyber-attacks.”

Swift also emphasized the strength of the Pacific Fleet and the importance of cybersecurity, stressing a cultural change is necessary to be successful long-term.

“There will always be risk. Computers are playing a major role in nearly every aspect of our lives,” Swift said. “We have to attack and defend in the same way as our adversaries attack and defend.” 

The symposium provided an opportunity for subject matter experts to discuss state-of-the-art techniques and current processes to provide feedback aimed at improving cybersecurity practices around the fleet. 

For more news from Navy Cyber Forces, visit www.navy.mil/local/ncf/.
column6: JOINT BASE PEARL HARBOR-HICKAM, HI, UNITED STATES
column9: 珍珠港-希卡姆联合基地，美国
column10: PACFLT网络安全会议强调网络能力
column11: 大众传播专家二等塔玛拉・沃恩，美国太平洋舰队公共事务部，夏威夷珍珠港――2月9日至11日，160多名网络安全专家在珍珠港希卡姆联合基地会面，讨论太平洋舰队（PACFLT）内的网络准备情况。PACFLT主办的网络安全海滨培训研讨会，为夏威夷的海上和陆上领导层以及民用网络安全工作人员提供培训，并更好地了解网络安全计划。此次活动的主题强调了“为舰队带来可操作的网络能力”的重要性。“我们需要高级领导人了解网络安全的重要性……”太平洋舰队副通信和信息系统官Danny Sadoski上尉说。“……网络是他们业务的一部分，也是他们可以使用的作战工具。”美国太平洋舰队司令斯科特・斯威夫特上将主持了海军信息战主导的活动。斯威夫特说：“鉴于我们在太平洋地区面临的挑战，我将重点放在两个关键领域，一个是防御，另一个是进攻。从网络的角度来看，进攻是国家风险，这就是为什么在国家一级拥有权力。我还将重点放在防御上，以改善舰队的网络安全。”在活动期间共享的信息旨在了解和熟悉网络威胁的数量和复杂性的增加，并准备防御这些类型的威胁。“我认为有这样的活动来回答有关网络安全的问题很重要，”Chafee号航母的Aaron Fleming少尉说（DDG 90）网络安全官员。“这让我看到了很多我不知道的事情，特别是关于不同的网络攻击。”斯威夫特还强调了太平洋舰队的实力和网络安全的重要性，强调文化变革是长期成功的必要条件。“风险总是存在的。计算机在我们生活的几乎每个方面都扮演着重要角色，”斯威夫特说。“我们必须像我们的对手那样进攻和防守。”研讨会为主题专家提供了一个机会，讨论最先进的技术和当前流程，以提供旨在改进舰队周围网络安全实践的反馈。有关海军网络部队的更多新闻，请访问www.Navy.mil/local/ncf/。

column2: Marne Soldiers depart for Afghanistan
column3:
FORT STEWART, Ga. -- Approximately 160 Soldiers of the Headquarters and Headquarters Battalion, 3rd Infantry Division, deployed August 3, to Afghanistan following a final formation in Newman Gym on Fort Stewart, Georgia. 

The HHBN Soldiers will be among 250 service members from 3rd Inf. Div. serving as part of the U.S. Forces C Afghanistan National Support Element in support of Operations Resolute Support and Freedom’s Sentinel. 

“The division as a whole is there to support U.S. Forces Afghanistan and coordinate all of the support-type tasks for the entire theater,” said Lt. Col. Luke Richards, commander, HHBN, 3rd Infantry Division. “For the (HHBN), we are there to make sure the division staff C the commander and his staff C can do their mission.”

The HHBN Soldiers will provide administrative support, logistics, training and anything else needed to ensure division can accomplish their tasks in country, Richards said. They will also provide force protection of their own facility and facility maintenance around the compound to ensure operability for division Soldiers, he said. 

“We take care of all of those things that have to happen behind the scenes so that (the command team) can just focus on supporting the team that is out there in Afghanistan,” Richards said. 

Pvt. 1st Class Brendan Morgan, a signals intelligence analyst with HHBN, said he excited to do what he was trained to do at what will be his first deployment since he enlisted in the U.S. Army. 

“It is going to be good to get to actually go and do our job and do some good,” Morgan said. 

Morgan’s wife, Larissa, and 2-year old son, Padraic, were at Newman Gym to see him off. He said they had talked about keeping in touch through Facebook, Skype, email and FaceTime during his deployment. 

To prepare for the mission, Soldiers of HHBN ensured their proficiency at individual Soldier tasks, conducted live fire exercises and trained on the standards for where they are going, Richards said. 

The unit will also have a platoon of Bosnian soldiers attached to them, Richards said.

“For some of the younger team, this will be a pretty good experience for them to interact with other countries and other services,” Richards said.

The timeline for the day of deployment allowed deploying Soldiers to see their children off for their first day of school, Richards said. 

Family Readiness Groups within individual companies held trainings and town halls leading up to the deployment to provide Family Members of deploying Soldiers comfort through knowledge and understanding of the mission, Richards said. 

“Sometimes it is just a matter of knowing and being aware of what we’re going to do down there,” Richards said. “Everyone has their own image of how things might be.”

Richards said it is important to share the information to allow for a more common visualization of what will happen. 

“Even if you go to the same location 10 different times, it is going to be different every time,” Richards said. 

Brig. Gen. David Hamilton, deputy commanding general C support, thanked the “unsung heroes,” of the deploying Soldiers for their support in his final remarks just moments before Soldiers boarded the buses to Hunter Army Airfield to deploy.

“Our loved ones, our Family Members, wives, husbands, children, mothers, fathers, grandmothers, grandfathers, aunts, uncles C those who are here to support our sendoff,” Hamilton said.  “Those who have been here with us through thick and thin, those who are here to show their love, affection, respect, admiration for the hard work that our Marne Soldiers do.”
column9: 美国佐治亚州斯图尔特堡
column10: 马恩士兵前往阿富汗
column11: 斯图尔特堡，佐治亚州――大约160名第三步兵师司令部和司令部营的士兵于8月3日在佐治亚州斯图尔特堡纽曼体育馆的最后编队后部署到阿富汗。HHBN士兵将是250名来自第三中导师的军人之一，作为美国部队-阿富汗国家支持部队的一部分，支持“坚决支持行动”和“自由哨兵”。第三步兵师HHBN指挥官卢克・理查兹中校（Luke Richards）说：“该师作为一个整体在那里支持美军驻阿富汗部队，并协调整个战区的所有支援型任务。”。理查兹说：“对于（HHBN），我们在那里是为了确保师里的工作人员――指挥官和他的工作人员――能够完成他们的任务。HHBN士兵将提供行政支持、后勤、培训和任何其他必要的东西，以确保师里能够完成他们在该国的任务。”。他说，他们还将为自己的设施提供部队保护，并对营地周围的设施进行维护，以确保师士兵的可操作性。理查兹说：“我们会处理所有必须在幕后发生的事情，以便（指挥团队）能够专注于支持阿富汗的团队。”。HHBN的信号情报分析员、一等兵布伦丹・摩根（Brendan Morgan）说，他很高兴能在入伍后的第一次部署中完成他接受过的训练。摩根说：“能够真正去做我们的工作，做一些好事，这将是一件好事。”。摩根的妻子拉里萨和2岁的儿子帕德雷克在纽曼体育馆为他送行。他说，在他的部署期间，他们讨论过通过Facebook、Skype、电子邮件和FaceTime保持联系。理查兹说，为了为这次任务做好准备，HHBN的士兵们确保了他们对单兵任务的熟练程度，进行了实弹演习，并按照他们要去的地方的标准进行了培训。理查兹说，这支部队还将有一排波斯尼亚士兵跟随他们。对于一些年轻的队员来说，这将是他们与其他国家和其他部队互动的一次非常好的经历理查兹说，部署当天的时间表允许部署士兵送孩子上学的第一天。理查兹说，个别公司的家庭准备小组在部署前举办了培训和市政厅，通过了解和理解任务，为部署士兵的家庭成员提供舒适。理查兹说：“有时候，这只是一个知道并意识到我们将在那里做什么的问题。”。“每个人对事情的发展都有自己的看法。”理查兹说，分享这些信息是很重要的，这样可以更普遍地看到将要发生的事情。理查兹说：“即使你去同一个地方10次，每次都会不同。”。布里格。支援部副司令大卫・汉密尔顿将军在士兵登上前往亨特陆军机场部署的公共汽车前的最后一句话中感谢了部署士兵中的“无名英雄”，感谢他们的支持。汉密尔顿说：“我们的亲人、家人、妻子、丈夫、孩子、母亲、父亲、祖母、祖父、阿姨、叔叔――这些人都是来支持我们送别的。”。“那些与我们同甘共苦的人，那些在这里向我们展示他们的爱、感情、尊重和对我们马恩士兵辛勤工作的钦佩的人。”

column2: Travis marches to celebrate women
column3:
With banners stretched wide and signs held high, more than 160 people marched in unison down Travis Blvd. to celebrate Women's History Month March 24.

The march, dubbed "March for Women's History," culminated in front of the wing headquarters building, where Solano County Supervisor Linda Seifert served as the keynote speaker.

"This month we want to honor and recognize women that have helped shape America's history and its future through their public service and government leadership," Seifert said.

The county supervisor spoke about the "three P's" - a set of characteristics - which she says she sees most profoundly in women who shaped history and challenged barriers: Patriotism, Passion and Purpose.  

"There are many women who preceded us that made the impossible, possible," Seifert said. "We can learn from them, we can appreciate them and emulate the tools they employed to advance in public service and government."

Seifert mentioned influential women in military service such as Opha May Johnson, the first woman to enlist in the U.S. Marine Corps, and Annie G. Fox, the first woman to receive a Purple Heart for combat for her actions as the chief nurse during the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.

"Today more and more women, like all of you, are choosing military service as a way of life and choosing to place their lives at risk to ensure those of us here at home remain free and safe," Seifert said. "We are truly fortunate to enjoy the benefits of that kind of patriotism right here in Solano County, where military service is woven into the fabric of our history, our values and our everyday life.

"There are nearly 2,600 women stationed here at Travis Air Force Base and I would say they truly inspire all of us on a daily basis, so I say thank you," she continued. 

Master Sgt. Shevaun Reighter, 60th Air Mobility Wing protocol superintendent and event coordinator, spoke about what it means to stand on the forefront of that inspiration.

"We all need role models to look up to," Reighter said. "People are inspired when they can see themselves in someone else. As both a woman and an Airman, I aspire to serve as a positive role model to the present and future Airmen that will take my place. It is important to honor the present and remember the past, while paving the future."

Reighter said that events like these band the members of Team Travis together for a common purpose.

"It was a superior demonstration of fellowship," she said. "This was not a mandatory event, and yet we were able to fill the streets with representation from all three wings in the name of Women's History Month."
column9: 特拉维斯空军基地，加利福尼亚州，美国
column10: 特拉维斯游行庆祝女性
column11: 随着横幅的伸展和标志的高举，160多人齐心协力沿着特拉维斯大道游行。为庆祝妇女历史月，3月24日。这场被称为“妇女历史游行”的游行在索拉诺县主管琳达・塞弗特（Linda Seifert）担任主旨发言人的联队总部大楼前达到高潮。塞弗特说：“本月，我们要表彰和表彰通过公共服务和政府领导帮助塑造美国历史和未来的女性。”县主管谈到了“三个P”“-一系列特征――她说她在塑造历史和挑战障碍的女性身上看到了最深刻的特征：爱国主义、激情和目标。塞弗特说：“在我们之前，有很多女性使这一切变得不可能，成为可能。”。“我们可以向他们学习，我们可以欣赏他们，并模仿他们在公共服务和政府管理方面所使用的工具。”塞弗特提到了有影响力的女性军人，如第一位加入美国海军陆战队的女性奥帕・梅・约翰逊（Opa May Johnson）和安妮・福克斯（Annie G.Fox），在日本偷袭珍珠港期间，她作为护士长的行为成为第一位获得紫心勋章的女性。“今天，越来越多的女性，像你们所有人一样，选择服兵役作为一种生活方式，并选择将自己的生命置于危险之中，以确保我们这些在家的人保持自由和安全，”Seifert说。“我们真的很幸运能在索拉诺县享受到这种爱国主义的好处，在这里，兵役已融入我们的历史、价值观和日常生活。”特拉维斯空军基地有近2600名女性驻扎在这里，我想说，她们每天都真正激励着我们所有人，“所以我要说谢谢，”她继续说道。第60航空机动联队礼宾监督和活动协调员谢万・赖特上士谈到了站在这一灵感的最前沿意味着什么。“我们都需要值得尊敬的榜样，”赖特说，“当人们能从别人身上看到自己时，就会受到鼓舞。”。作为一名女性和一名飞行员，我渴望成为现在和未来接替我的飞行员的积极榜样。在为未来铺路的同时，尊重现在、铭记过去是很重要的。“Reighter说，像这样的活动将Travis团队的成员团结在一起是为了一个共同的目的。”她说，“这是友谊的一个极好的证明。”这不是一个强制性的活动，然而，我们能够以妇女历史月的名义，在街道上摆满来自所有三个方面的代表。”

column2: 822 BDS deploys in support of Task Force - Holloman
column3:
More than 160 members from the 822nd Base Defense Squadron at Moody Air Force Base, Georgia, deployed to Holloman Air Force Base, New Mexico, Aug. 28, 2021, to support the Department of Homeland Security’s Operation Allies Welcome.

The 93rd Air Ground Operations Wing’s base defense Airmen will provide an enhanced security presence to Task Force C Holloman.

The Department of Defense, through U.S. Northern Command, and in support of the Department of Homeland Security, is providing transportation, temporary housing, medical screening, and general support at least 50,000 Afghan evacuees at suitable facilities, in permanent or temporary structures, as quickly as possible. This initiative provides Afghan personnel essential support at secure locations outside Afghanistan.

The 23rd Wing’s 71st Rescue Squadron supplied the HC-130J Combat King II cargo aircraft to airlift the team and the thousands of pounds of cargo to Holloman after only a few days’ notification.

The overall mission of the base defense squadron is to provide the Secretary of Defense with a fully integrated defense capability which enables Air Force, joint and coalition missions against advanced adversaries in line with national defense strategic objectives while maintaining immediate response force responsibilities, said Maj. Timothy Finucan, 822nd BDS commander.

Simply put, if an area needs a stand-alone security function, this expeditious team can deploy at a moment’s notice and secure the area.

“We are at our highest state of readiness to go anywhere in the world,” Finucan said. “This movement was a little different than our normal taskings, but it’s what the Secretary of Defense and the country needed us to do, so we’re here.

“I trust my Airmen with my life,” he added. “So even though there will be challenges based on the uniqueness and sensitivity of this mission, I have full faith and confidence in my team and their level of professionalism.”

That professionalism translates well into their specific mission at Holloman: support.

“Our team is performing a very critical role right now in the process,” said Staff Sgt. Matt Hugaboom, a 822nd BDS member deployed to Holloman. “We are thankful for the chance to help, and we know that this is a once in a lifetime opportunity. 

“We are touching so many lives by being out here,” he continued. “We are going to treat everybody as if they’re part of our own team, our own family.” 


The entire temporary provision effort ― housing, medical, security, transportation, food and supplies ― is housed under U.S. Northern Command and includes other pre-identified military installations to take in the thousands of Afghan personnel. 

“The 822 Base Defense Squadron’s motto is ‘SAFESIDE,’ which comes from a proud heritage of protecting Airmen and air bases dating back more than 50 years,” said Col. Danielle Willis, 93rd AGOW commander. “This mission is continuing that tradition by joining with the total force team to care for evacuees as they transition to a new life.

“We’re honored to be part of the effort, and I know our Airmen, Guardians, Soldiers, Sailors and Marines are doing their best to care for these people in their time of need,” she said.
column6: HOLLOMAN AIR FORCE BASE, NM, UNITED STATES
column9: 美国新墨西哥州霍洛曼空军基地
column10: 部署822个BDS以支持工作队-霍洛曼
column11: 2021年8月28日，来自乔治亚州穆迪空军基地822基地防御中队的160多名成员被部署到新墨西哥州霍洛曼空军基地，欢迎支持国土安全部的“盟友行动”。93空地行动联队的基地防御飞行员将向霍洛曼特遣部队提供增强的安全存在。国防部通过美国北方司令部，并支持国土安全部，提供运输，在适当的设施、永久或临时结构中，尽快为至少50000名阿富汗撤离者提供临时住房、医疗检查和一般支持。这一举措在阿富汗境外的安全地点为阿富汗人员提供了必要的支持。第23联队的第71救援中队提供了HC-130J战斗国王II型运输机，仅在几天的通知后就将该队和数千磅货物空运至霍洛曼。基地防御中队的总体任务是：BDS第822指挥官Timothy Finucan少校表示，为国防部长提供全面综合的防御能力，使空军、联合部队和联军能够根据国防战略目标对先进对手执行任务，同时保持快速反应部队的职责，如果一个地区需要一个独立的安全功能，这个快速的团队可以在接到通知后立即部署并确保该地区的安全。“我们处于最高的准备状态，可以去世界上任何地方，”菲努坎说。“这项运动与我们的正常任务略有不同，但这是国防部长和国家需要我们做的，所以我们来到了这里。”他补充道，“我用生命信任我的飞行员。”。“因此，尽管这项任务的独特性和敏感性会带来挑战，但我对我的团队和他们的专业水平充满信心。”这种专业精神很好地转化为他们在霍洛曼的具体使命：支持。“我们的团队目前在这一过程中发挥着非常关键的作用。”部署到霍洛曼的BDS第822名成员马特・胡加博姆上士说：“我们非常感谢有机会提供帮助，我们知道这是一个千载难逢的机会。我们来到这里触动了很多人的生命，”他继续说。“我们将把每个人都当作我们自己团队、我们自己家庭的一部分来对待。”整个临时供应工作――住房、医疗、安全、运输、食品和用品――由美国北方司令部负责，包括其他预先确定的军事设施，以接收数千名阿富汗人员。“822基地防御中队的座右铭是‘安全区’，它源自50多年来保护空军和空军基地的光荣传统，”AGOW第93任指挥官Danielle Willis上校说。她说：“这项任务继续了这一传统，加入了全军团队，在撤离人员过渡到新生活的过程中照顾他们。我们很荣幸能够参与这项工作，我知道我们的飞行员、卫士、士兵、水手和海军陆战队正在尽最大努力在他们需要的时候照顾他们。”。

column2: 28th Military Police Company returns from Middle East deployment
column3:
Approximately 160 Soldiers assigned to the Pennsylvania Army National Guard’s 28th Military Police Company returned from deployment to the Middle East in support of Operation Spartan Shield July 10, 2019. The company, which deployed in early October 2018, is part of the 165th Military Police Battalion, 55th Maneuver Enhancement Brigade, 28th Infantry Division.

The 28th Military Police Company provided security and customs support in nearly a dozen countries in Southwest Asia. Operating in one of the most dynamic regions of the world, their presence enhanced security cooperation and provided vital reassurance to our partners and allies in the region.

“I am extremely excited to have the soldiers of the 28th Military Police Company back home in Pennsylvania,” said Lt. Col. Brad Pierson, commander of the 165th Military Police Battalion. “They have achieved exceptional results and have been outstanding representatives for the Pennsylvania Army National Guard and the 165th Military Police Battalion.”  

The company was established in 1964 as the 4th Military Police and Security Platoon, and designated as the 28th Military Police Company in 1965. The company deployed to Iraq in 2007. In 2010 through 2013, members of the 28th Military Police Company deployed to Afghanistan as part of the joint Police Operational Mentoring and Liaison Team, along with armed forces from our state partner, Lithuania, and worked with the Afghan national security forces.
column9: 美国宾夕法尼亚州
column10: 第28军警连从中东部署归来
column11: 2019年7月10日，约160名被分配到宾夕法尼亚州陆军国民警卫队第28宪兵连的士兵从部署中返回中东，支持斯巴达盾行动。该连于2018年10月初部署，隶属于第28步兵师第55机动增强旅第165宪兵营。第28宪兵连在西南亚近十几个国家提供安保和海关支持。他们在世界上最具活力的地区之一开展活动，加强了安全合作，并为我们在该地区的合作伙伴和盟友提供了至关重要的保证。布拉德・皮尔森中校说：“我非常高兴第28宪兵连的士兵回到宾夕法尼亚州的家中。”，第165宪兵营指挥官。“他们取得了卓越的成绩，是宾夕法尼亚州陆军国民警卫队和第165宪兵营的杰出代表。”该连成立于1964年，是第4宪兵和安全排，1965年被指定为第28宪兵连。该公司于2007年部署到伊拉克。2010年至2013年，第28宪兵连的成员与我们的国家伙伴立陶宛的武装部队一起部署到阿富汗，作为联合警察行动指导和联络小组的一部分，并与阿富汗国家安全部队合作。

column2: 60 years in the air- The birth of a tanker legacy
column3:
Editor’s note: This is the first part of a series looking back on the history of the KC-135 Stratotanker throughout the decades, leading up to the 60th anniversary of the KC-135's first flight in August 2016.

MCCONNELL AIR FORCE BASE, Kan. C More than 60 years ago, the idea of a tanker able to keep up with the technologically advanced jet-propelled aircraft was just that, an idea. The idea became a reality and the aerial refueler would go on to leave its mark for decades to come, not only here at the Air Force’s premier KC-135 Stratotanker wing, but around the globe as well.

“The KC-135 was born out of necessity and innovation,” said Michael Lombardi, The Boeing Company corporate historian in a July 2006 article. “In the early 1950s, Strategic Air Command was beginning to operate the new jet-powered Boeing B-52 Stratofortress that, with in-flight refueling, was capable of striking targets anywhere in the world.” 

The technological differences between the prop-driven KC-97 Stratotanker, SAC’s primary aerial refueling tanker at the time, and the newer, jet-propelled aircraft proved to be less than ideal.

“While the KC-97 could and did refuel the jets in flight, doing so was problematic due to the KC-97's low speed and limited altitude capability,” said Mark Morgan, Air Mobility Command historian. “SAC wanted a jet-powered tanker, which would enable the bombers to take on more fuel, at higher altitudes and more quickly, thus contributing to the success of their mission.”

To keep up with the expanding tactical and strategic air fleet, blueprints for the KC-135 were soon developed and transitioning to the initial production phase began at Boeing’s facility in Renton, Washington.

Manufacturing of the updated refueling tanker was underway by 1954 and the first KC-135A production model, serial number 55-3118, rolled off the assembly line in a ceremony on July 18, 1956, said Morgan.

Nicknamed “City of Renton,” the aircraft weighed a total of 275,000 pounds and had a top speed of 600 mph.

“They’re built like a tank,” said Col. Phil Heseltine, 22nd Air Refueling Wing vice commander. “They’re probably 150 percent stronger than anybody would have needed in an airplane.”

On Aug. 31, 1956, Aircraft 55-3118 completed its first flight at the Boeing facility where it was manufactured.

“[After final testing and modifications], the aircraft was delivered to the Air Force’s Air Material Command at Tinker Air Force Base, Oklahoma, on Jan. 24, 1957,” said Morgan.

Aircraft 55-3118 was the first of 732 KC-135s to show the impact these tankers had and continue to have on aerial refueling. After decades of supporting the mission, it was retired and is currently on display near the east gate here.

“The KC-135 is the reason why we are the best Air Force in the world,” said Heseltine. “There is no question about it. We [the Air Force] can’t be who we are without our tankers.”
column6: MCCONNELL AIR FORCE BASE, KS, UNITED STATES
column9: 美国堪萨斯州麦康奈尔空军基地
column10: 空中60年――油轮遗产的诞生
column11: 编者按：这是回顾KC-135平流层加油机几十年历史的系列文章的第一部分，该系列文章将于2016年8月迎来KC-135首次飞行60周年。堪萨斯州麦康奈尔空军基地60多年前，油轮能够跟上技术先进的喷气式飞机的想法就是这样，一个想法。这一想法成为现实，空中加油机将在未来几十年继续留下印记，不仅在空军首屈一指的KC-135同温层加油机联队，而且在全球范围内。波音公司企业历史学家迈克尔・伦巴迪（Michael Lombardi）在2006年7月的一篇文章中说：“KC-135诞生于需要和创新。”。“20世纪50年代初，战略空军司令部开始运营新型喷气式波音B-52同温层堡垒，通过空中加油，能够打击世界任何地方的目标。”当时SAC的主要空中加油机――支柱驱动KC-97同温层加油机与更新型KC-97同温层加油机之间的技术差异，喷气式飞机被证明不太理想。“虽然KC-97能够并且确实为飞行中的喷气机加油，但由于KC-97的低速和有限的高空能力，这样做是有问题的，”空中机动司令部历史学家马克・摩根（Mark Morgan）说。“SAC想要一辆喷气式加油机，这将使轰炸机能够在更高的高度和更快地消耗更多的燃料，从而为其任务的成功做出贡献。”为了跟上不断扩大的战术和战略空军，KC-135的蓝图很快被开发出来，并在华盛顿伦顿的波音工厂开始向初始生产阶段过渡。1954年，更新的加油机开始制造，第一个KC-135A生产型号，序列号55-3118，在1956年7月18日的一个仪式上下线，绰号“伦顿市”的摩根说，这架飞机总重27.5万磅，最高时速600英里。第22空中加油联队副指挥官菲尔・赫塞尔廷上校说：“它们像一辆坦克。”。1956年8月31日，55-3118号飞机在波音公司的工厂完成了第一次飞行。在进行了最终测试和改装之后“1957年1月24日，该飞机被交付给位于俄克拉荷马州廷克空军基地的空军物资司令部，”Morgan说。飞机55-3118是732架KC-135中的第一架，显示了这些加油机对空中加油的影响。经过几十年的支持，它已经退役，目前正在东门附近展出。“KC-135是我们成为世界上最好的空军的原因，”赫塞尔廷说。“这是毫无疑问的。没有我们的加油机，我们（空军）不可能成为现在的我们。”

column2: Submarine Squadrons Host Career Advancement Symposium
column3:
GROTON, Conn. (NNS) C Command Submarine Squadron (CSS) 4 and (CSS) 12 hosted more than 60 Yeoman, Personnel Specialist and Legalman for a Career Advancement Symposium at Submarine Base New London, Nov. 21C22.

The symposium focused on bridging the gap between the ratings to empower Sailors with the knowledge and tools they need to successfully manage their careers while improving administrative services to fleet.

Symposium organizer Yeoman (Submarine) 1st Class Eric Opitz, assigned to the USS San Juan (SSN 751), said the rates are particularly important to the Navy because they control what motivates all Sailors: financial well-being of themselves and their families.

Optiz said the takeaway goal of the symposium is for Sailors to gain knowledge and resources that assure Sailors around the fleet are receiving the best administrative service possible.

“We need to close the knowledge gap between ranks within our rates,” said Optiz. “What I mean by this is our admin offices are only as good as the performance of our junior Sailors. As natural leaders, we can combat this by building our benches and training our Sailors.”  

Rating community leaders and enlisted fleet training managers facilitated the event. Attendees participated in discussions on policies, instructions, personnel management, changes between the rates and ideas that could improve administrative services.

“This training was important because we need our leadership and junior Sailors to constantly train and develop,” said Chief Personnel Specialist Sergio Garcia, assigned to Naval Station Newport, Rhode Island. “Polices and instructions are always changing and the only way to keep up is train constantly.”

Yeoman (Submarine) 2nd Class Adam Emig said the symposium was very beneficial, because Personnel Specialist and Legalman Sailors do not serve on submarines and so many of those duties are handled by a Yeoman (Submarine).

 “The training was a big eye opener,” said Emig. “It was really good training that covered a lot of problem areas that needed to be addressed.”

“This is a first of many Symposium to come,” said symposium organizer Chief Yeoman (Submarine) Vincent Butler, assigned to CSS-12. “We had a lot of positive feedback from Sailors that want see more training like this.”
column9: 格罗顿，CT，美国
column10: 潜艇中队举办职业发展研讨会
column11: 康涅狄格州格罗顿（NNS）C指挥潜艇中队（CSS）4和（CSS）12在新伦敦潜艇基地举办了一次职业发展研讨会，共有60多名约曼、人事专家和法律顾问参加，11月21日至22日。研讨会的重点是弥合评级之间的差距，让海员掌握成功管理职业生涯所需的知识和工具，同时改善对舰队的管理服务。研讨会组织者约曼（潜艇）一级埃里克・奥皮茨，被派往圣胡安号（SSN 751）航母，他说，费率对海军来说尤其重要，因为它控制着激励所有海员的因素：他们自己和家人的经济福利。Optiz说，研讨会的目的是让海员获得知识和资源，确保舰队周围的海员尽可能得到最好的管理服务。Optiz说：“我们需要在我们的费率范围内缩小职级之间的知识差距。我的意思是，我们的行政办公室只与我们的初级水手的表现一样好。作为天生的领导者，我们可以通过建造长凳和培训水手来解决这一问题。”评估社区领导和招募的车队培训经理为活动提供了便利。与会者参与了有关政策、指示、人事管理、费率之间的变化以及可以改善行政服务的想法的讨论。罗得岛州纽波特海军基地的首席人事专家塞尔吉奥・加西亚（Sergio Garcia）说：“这次训练非常重要，因为我们需要我们的领导和初级船员不断地训练和发展。警察和指令总是在变化，唯一能跟上的方法就是不断地训练。”二等舱亚当・埃米格说，这次研讨会非常有益，因为人事专家和立法者水手不在潜艇上服役，所以这些任务中有很多是由一艘潜艇来完成的。“这次培训让人大开眼界，”埃米格说。“这是一次非常好的培训，涵盖了许多需要解决的问题领域。”“这是许多研讨会中的第一次，”研讨会组织者、CSS-12的负责人约曼（潜艇）文森特・巴特勒（Vincent Butler）说。“我们从水手那里得到了很多积极的反馈，他们希望看到更多这样的培训。”

column2: Shaping our newest leaders- Students graduate Advanced Leadership Course in Idaho
column3:
Gowen Field hosts several 19-Delta Advanced Leadership Courses throughout the year at the Idaho National Guard's 1-204th Regional Training Institute schoolhouse on base. However, due to COVID-19 this hasn’t been a typical year, making this the first course offered this year.  Students came from all over the nation to fulfill this leadership requirement and graduated here on Aug. 8.

Students in this course were at Gowen Field for 28 days coming from around the world, to include four local students and students from Germany, Hawaii, Nevada, North Carolina, Texas and active duty U.S. Army counterparts. Safety measures and precautions for COVID-19 were followed during the students' time in Idaho.
 
The students ended the course with a leadership scenario in which they called upon the Idaho Army National Guard's UH-60 Black Hawks for airlift medical assistance during their field exercise of zone area reconnaissance. 

The course is always improving and Staff Sgt. Daniel Bistriceanu, NCO in charge and instructor for the course, is taking a more intuitive learning strategy. 

“My new approach is fostering an innovative thought process and interactive communication,” said Bistriceanu. “By providing facilitation empowerment in our teaching style, the students are able to use problem-solving methods while building relationships.”
column9: 博伊西，ID，美国
column10: 塑造我们最新的领导者-爱达荷州学生毕业高级领导力课程
column11: Gowen Field在爱达荷州国民警卫队的1-204区域训练学院校舍的基地上全年举办了19个Delta高级领导力课程。然而，由于新冠病毒-19，今年不是典型的一年，这是今年提供的第一个课程。学生们来自全国各地，以满足这一领导要求，并于8月8日在这里毕业。参加本课程的学生来自世界各地，在Gowen Field学习了28天，其中包括四名当地学生以及来自德国、夏威夷、内华达、北卡罗莱纳、德克萨斯和美国陆军现役部队的学生。学生们在爱达荷州期间遵循了新冠病毒-19的安全措施和预防措施。学生们以一个领导场景结束了课程，在该场景中，他们呼吁爱达荷州陆军国民警卫队的UH-60黑鹰队在区域侦察的野外演习中提供空运医疗援助。课程一直在改进，负责该课程的NCO和讲师Daniel Bistriceanu中士正在采取更直观的学习策略。“我的新方法是培养创新思维过程和互动交流，”Bistriceanu说。“通过在我们的教学风格中提供便利授权，学生能够在建立关系的同时使用解决问题的方法。”

column2: AFRRI Marks 60 Years as Unique National Asset
column3:
“I believe the likelihood of a nuclear catastrophe is greater today than during the Cold War.” -- William J. Perry, 19th U.S. Secretary of Defense.

The Armed Forces Radiobiology Research Institute (AFRRI), celebrating its 60th anniversary in 2021, is responsible for advising and assisting commanders in preserving and protecting the health and performance of U.S. military personnel operating in radiologically contaminated battle spaces and urban environments. Through research, education, and operational training, AFRRI advances the understanding of the effects of ionizing radiation and develops medical countermeasures in line with 21st century national security threats. 

AFRRI, a part of Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences (USU), is a tri-service entity created in 1961, with the mission of carrying out the medical radiological defense research program at the height of the Cold War. AFRRI has been instrumental in responding to nuclear threats around the world and pushing the field of radiation sciences forward in the last 60 years as the United States’ primary source of military-relevant medical radiological research, preparedness, and training. 

AFRRI was established because of the threat of the massive Soviet armies pouring through the Fulda Gap and overtaking Western Europe during the Cold War.  

“NATO forces had to figure out how they might be able to use battlefield nuclear weapons to stop that massive assault, as well as how defending troops could protect themselves if they became the victims of nuclear devices,” said Army Col. (Dr.) Mohammad Naeem, director of AFRRI.  

The Cold War-centered mission continued for several decades after the institute’s creation. 

“The ‘60s, ‘70s, and ‘80s were the boom of AFRRI,” said Naeem. “It had about 300 individuals and was packed with scientists and doctors. Then in 1992, the Soviet Union fell apart and with the end of the cold war, AFRRI’s mission and survival became a topic of discussion by the top military brass and it was realigned with the USU.”

Despite the end of the cold war and the decline of the Soviet Union, AFRRI’s mission remains just as essential today as it was in the 1960s, said Naeem.

“I think after 60 years, we have come back to the same mission,” said Naeem. “The threat is either the same or increased; there’s another gap in Europe that’s similar to the Fulda Gap called the Suwalki Gap, and United States is once again facing the great power competition with near-peer adversaries possessing sophisticated and highly advanced nuclear capabilities.”

The radiological threats of today extend beyond nuclear weapons to “dirty bombs,” low-dose radiation, and toxic metal contamination, added Naeem.

“Dirty bombs  are traditional explosive devices attached to stolen or orphaned radioactive sources that disperse radiation into an area,” said Naeem. “The potential exists today for non-state actors to detonate one of these dirty bombs in a major urban center, and we need to be prepared to respond. We can help determine when it might be safe to reenter the area, and how to treat those at the scene.”

To combat today’s threats AFRRI focuses on three areas: research, education, and operational training.

On the research side, there are five main areas of focus: low-dose radiation, biodosimetry or radiation injury diagnostics, radiation-trauma combined injury, toxic metal exposure, and radiation countermeasures. AFRRI’s infrastructure, including its research nuclear reactor and other radiation facilities, can simulate the immediate radiation effects of a nuclear detonation, radiation effects of nuclear fallout and long term radiation effects in a post-nuclear detonation zone weeks to months. 
“AFRRI is a leader in radiological research, and we also have teams dedicated to worldwide education and emergency response,” said Army Lt. Col. (Dr.) Lien Senchak, AFRRI’s military medical operations (MMO) department chief. “Some of the specific field research we’re currently conducting focuses on the effects of electromagnetic pulse on medical equipment, thermal resistance of military uniforms, hands- free radiation detection devices and testing materials for dry decontamination in cold weather.”

AFRRI has been essential in the development of therapeutic drugs, which limit and treat radiation injuries, as well as high-precision biodosimetry tools ranging from novel assays to software programs. AFRRI’s researchers like Senchak and her colleague, Dr. William F. Blakely, a senior scientist who has helped develop multi-parameter biodosimetry models and radiation risk assessment tools, were instrumental in many of these accomplishments.

Scientists at AFRRI are focused on transitioning this kind of research into education and operational training by working synergistically with their MMO department. 

“MMO serves as the operational and applications arm of AFRRI, applying research and expertise to real-world problems,” said Blakely. “The biodosimetry group collaborated with MMO to prepare several guidance documents for the assessment of radiation-related injuries. Recently we’re also involved in the creation of a radiation risk communication tool, a one-page document to assist commanders in the field in communicating the risk of operating in a potential radiation environment.”

The department provides these education and training tools for students and leaders not only at USU, but around the world. 

“Understanding of radiation is pretty limited in the medical community and outside of people who specialize in the field,” said Senchak. “It's important for people in the medical field to be educated on early symptoms of radiation exposure so that they can triage patients. We have a team that goes throughout the world and trains medical professionals on the health effects of acute radiation injury, how to treat radiation injuries, and how to detect radiation and other harmful substances.”

MMO also provides rapidly deployable response teams that have addressed a variety of situations throughout the world such as the Fukushima reactor meltdown and the anthrax attacks in 2001, and stand ready to address new threats as they arise. The department assists NATO and other international organizations with readiness exercises and educational materials as well. 

Senchak, Blakely, and their colleagues take pride in tackling this critical mission, and thoroughly enjoy conducting research at an institution with such clear ties between science and real-world solutions.

“As a young scientist looking for a place to serve in my career I was attracted to AFRRI because it had critical resources like personnel from every military service, civilian scientists, relevant sources, dosimetry support, and cutting edge research technology,” said Blakely. “It has been a wonderful experience in my last 38 years to work at AFRRI and contribute to the enhancement of medical readiness to respond to a potential radiological incident. I highly recommend others to join us and contribute in our mission to preserve the health and performance of U.S. military personnel and protect humankind through research that advances understanding of the effects of ionizing radiation.”
column9: 美国马里兰州贝塞斯达
column10: AFRRI标志着60年成为独一无二的国家资产
column11: “我认为今天发生核灾难的可能性比冷战时期更大。”――威廉・佩里，美国第19任国防部长。武装部队放射生物学研究所（AFRRI）在2021年庆祝成立60周年，负责向指挥官提供建议和协助，以保护在受辐射污染的作战空间和城市环境中作战的美国军事人员的健康和绩效。通过研究、教育和操作培训，AFRRI促进了对电离辐射影响的理解，并根据21世纪的国家安全威胁制定了医疗对策。AFRRI是美国卫生科学军队服务大学（UU）的一部分，是1961成立的三级服务实体，肩负着在冷战高峰期开展医学放射防护研究的使命。在过去60年中，AFRRI作为美国军事相关医学放射研究、准备和培训的主要来源，在应对世界各地的核威胁和推动辐射科学领域向前发展方面发挥了重要作用。AFRRI的建立是因为大规模的苏联军队在冷战期间通过富尔达缺口并超越西欧的威胁。“北约部队必须弄清楚他们如何能够使用战场核武器来阻止大规模袭击，以及如果他们成为核装置的受害者，防卫部队如何能够保护自己，”AFRRI主任陆军上校（Mohammad Naeem博士）说。该研究所成立后，以冷战为中心的使命持续了几十年。“60年代、70年代和80年代是AFRRI的繁荣时期，”Naeem说。“它大约有300人，里面挤满了科学家和医生。然后在1992年，苏联解体，随着冷战的结束，阿法里的使命和生存成为军方高层讨论的话题，并与USU重新结盟。”尽管冷战结束，苏联衰落，纳伊姆说：“今天，AFRRI的使命与20世纪60年代一样重要。我认为60年后，我们又回到了同样的使命上来。”。“威胁要么是相同的，要么是增加的；欧洲还有一个类似于富尔达差距的差距，称为苏沃基差距，美国再次面临与拥有先进核能力的近邻对手的大国竞争。”Naeem补充道，今天的辐射威胁已经超出了核武器的范围，包括“脏弹”、低剂量辐射和有毒金属污染。“脏弹是附着在被盗或孤立放射源上的传统爆炸装置，可将辐射分散到某个区域，”Naeem说。“如今，非国家行为者有可能在一个主要城市中心引爆其中一枚脏弹，我们需要做好应对准备。我们可以帮助确定何时可以安全进入该地区，以及如何处理现场人员。”为了应对当今的威胁，AFRRI专注于三个领域：研究、教育和安全，在研究方面，有五个主要重点领域：低剂量辐射、生物剂量学或辐射损伤诊断、辐射创伤复合损伤、有毒金属暴露和辐射对策。AFRRI的基础设施，包括其研究核反应堆和其他辐射设施，可以在数周到数月的时间内模拟核爆炸的即时辐射效应、核沉降物的辐射效应以及核爆炸后区域的长期辐射效应。“AFRRI是放射学研究的领导者，我们也有致力于全球教育和应急响应的团队，”AFRRI军事医疗行动（MMO）部门负责人陆军中校（博士）连森察克说。“我们目前正在进行的一些具体的实地研究集中在电磁脉冲对医疗设备、军服的热阻、免提辐射检测设备和寒冷天气下干洗去污测试材料的影响。”AFRRI在治疗药物的开发中至关重要，限制和治疗辐射损伤，以及高精度的生物剂量学工具，从新的分析到软件程序。AFRRI的研究人员，如Senchak和她的同事William F.Blakely博士，一位帮助开发多参数生物剂量学模型和辐射风险评估工具的资深科学家，AFRRI的科学家们正致力于通过与他们的MMO部门协同工作，将此类研究转化为教育和操作培训。Blakely说：“MMO作为AFRRI的运营和应用部门，将研究和专业知识应用于现实世界的问题。”。“生物剂量学小组与MMO合作，为评估辐射相关伤害准备了几份指导文件。最近，我们还参与创建了一个辐射风险沟通工具，这是一份一页的文件，用于帮助现场指挥官沟通在潜在辐射环境中操作的风险该系不仅为USU的学生和领导人，而且为全世界的学生和领导人提供这些教育和培训工具。Senchak说：“医学界和该领域的专业人士对辐射的了解非常有限。”。“对医疗领域的人们来说，对辐射暴露的早期症状进行教育是很重要的，这样他们就可以对患者进行分类。我们有一个遍布世界各地的团队，对医疗专业人员进行急性辐射损伤的健康影响、如何治疗辐射损伤以及如何检测辐射和其他有害物质的培训MMO还提供了快速部署的反应团队，这些团队已经处理了世界各地的各种情况，例如福岛核反应堆熔毁和2001年的炭疽病袭击，并随时准备应对出现的新威胁。国防部还协助北约和其他国际组织进行战备演习和编写教材。森查克、布莱克利和他们的同事为完成这一关键任务而感到自豪，并且非常喜欢在一个科学和现实世界解决方案之间有着如此明确联系的机构中进行研究。Blakely说：“作为一名在我的职业生涯中寻找工作的年轻科学家，我对AFRRI很感兴趣，因为它拥有关键资源，如来自各军种的人员、平民科学家、相关来源、剂量测定支持和尖端研究技术。”。“在过去的38年里，我在AFRRI工作，为提高医疗准备以应对潜在的放射性事件做出了贡献，这是一次非常美妙的经历。我强烈建议其他人加入我们，为我们的使命做出贡献，以保护美国军事人员的健康和表现，并通过研究保护人类。”h这有助于理解电离辐射的影响。”

column2: NIWC Atlantic Advances New Technologies at NICE ANTX
column3:
CAMP LEJEUNE, N.C. C Naval Information Warfare Center (NIWC) Atlantic wrapped up a joint civilian-military exercise on April 14 at Camp Lejeune, N.C., where over 60 emerging technologies were evaluated by the Navy and Marine Corps for future warfighter application. 

NIWC Atlantic partnered with Naval Surface Warfare Center Crane Division, Navy Warfare Development Command (NWDC) and Marine Corps Warfighting Laboratory (MCWL) to spearhead the planning and execution of the 10-day Naval Integration in Contested Environments (NICE) Advanced Naval Technology Exercise (ANTX), one of the Navy’s largest participations in an ANTX to date.

“It was awesome to see the great collaboration occurring between our Marines and Sailors, large and small businesses, and our government warfare centers as they experimented together with new technologies and operating concepts to serve the warfighter in contested environments,” said the Honorable James Geurts, currently performing the duties of Under Secretary of the Navy. “Enabling our operators to provide candid and immediate feedback on these technologies ensures we leverage their valuable perspective and experiences as we together shape the equipment needed to compete and win in future contested environments.”

ANTXs demonstrate emerging technologies in operationally relevant settings. With the focus of NICE ANTX on naval integration, technology owners knew their products would be judged through the lens of naval warfare concepts like expeditionary advanced base operations (EABO) and distributed maritime operations (DMO).

Each prototype technology was grouped into one of six capability areas: command and control, communications, domain maneuver, fires and effects, fleet support, and operations in an information environment.

Naval leaders selected roughly 65 technologies, the majority of them from private industry. Assessors gauged each capability while observers envisioned relevant EABO/DMO scenarios in which each product could be used. 

Technologies focused on radio frequency waveforms, autonomous air and sea vehicles, advanced sensors, optical communications, cybersecurity applications, and a variety of software capabilities.

“The assessments helped us understand exactly how those technologies could work in an operational environment,” said Matt Largent, a NIWC Atlantic engineer and NICE ANTX assessment lead. “That information is also extremely useful to the technology owners, since some products can be improved upon to help us with capability gaps we are looking to fill.”

NIWC Atlantic brought along eight of its own technologies to demonstrate at NICE ANTX, including an airborne surrogate satellite capability designed to provide warfighters fallback communications.

ANTX exercises are one of several aggressive steps the Navy and Marine Corps are taking to establish cultures of experimentation, adaptation and risk-taking that will help increase speed and agility in technology development and procurement, according to Greg Hays, NIWC Atlantic’s senior scientific technology manager for Rapid Prototyping and Fleet Exercises. 

“We take pride in addressing these issues and in understanding the future impact that science and technology will have on warfare,” said Hays, also a participant in the exercise. “Integrating new technologies into the fleet faster than our adversaries will be a key to achieving tech overmatch and winning the information war. We get there by offering these very low-barrier-of-entry opportunities that come with accelerated contractual options, including the Commercial Solutions Opening.”

The nation’s most recent National Defense Strategy calls for “no complacency” in an increasingly complex global security environment that is marked by rapid technological change and challenges from adversaries in every operating domain. The document also states that new commercial technologies are changing society, which, ultimately, will change the character of war.

“It will take the entire team working together to maintain our competitive edge,” Geurts emphasized.

On April 9, Geurts toured the technology areas aboard Camp Lejeune, along with Lt. Gen. Eric Smith, U.S. Marine Corps deputy commandant for Combat Development and Integration, and Vice Adm. James Kilby, deputy Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) for Warfighting Requirements and Capabilities (OPNAV N9).

For the exercise, members of 2nd Marine Expeditionary Force (II MEF) based at Camp Lejeune hosted the ANTX footprint and supported onsite logistics. Marines from II MEF, MCWL and other organizations comprised the contingent of 160 technology assessors, along with a record two dozen Sailors and roughly 60 DOD civilians. 

Uniformed assessors had backgrounds ranging from infantry and artillery to communications and navigation. An enlisted Marine from MCWL who participated in the exercise said ANTX is a win-win scenario for both the military and the private sector.

“It brings these technologies in front of us to not only see the realm of what’s possible,” said Staff Sgt. Joshua Crabb, “but also to offer our operational and technical expertise, to help make the products better, which serves both our needs as well as the company’s.”

Brig. Gen. Benjamin Watson, MCWL commanding general and NICE ANTX officer in charge, called the exercise a great opportunity to solve hard tactical and operational problems.

“A unique thing about ANTX is the warfighter integration,” Watson said during a visit to Camp Lejeune on April 14. “Rather than it just being a technology fair for innovators to show off their wares, ANTX enables our industry partners to insert their technologies into specific mission threads. It demonstrates not just capability, but relevance of that technology.” 

Dana Rushing, NIWC Atlantic execution lead for NICE ANTX, said the complex exercise with many moving parts and multiple major stakeholders and industries saw as many as 800 participants cycle through. 

“From inception to endpoint, this year’s ANTX was a major success,” Rushing said. “It was particularly rewarding to see NIWC Atlantic engineers and private tech companies collaborating throughout the process. That, coupled with direct feedback from the Navy and Marine Corps, makes events like this invaluable to the future of the warfighter.”

NICE ANTX took place in open fields and followed strict protocols to minimize COVID-19 exposure. Capt. Wesley Sanders, NIWC Atlantic commanding officer, said it felt good to get outdoors and see the fruits of his team’s labors.

“NICE ANTX was a huge lift, with many months of preparation, and monumental implications for the warfighter,” Sanders said. “I am just so proud of everyone on the team who helped make this year’s exercise a success.”

NIWC Atlantic Executive Director Peter C. Reddy echoed the commander’s remarks.

“I’m not just so proud of the NIWC Atlantic team,” Reddy said, “but excited for our engineers and scientists who are receiving this infusion of real-time feedback from uniformed Marines and Sailors. Incorporating the warfighter’s thoughts and perspectives on these technologies when they are back in the lab will make our work that much more purposeful and meaningful. It also means these capabilities could one day end up in the hands of our warfighters.” 

About NWDC
NWDC works for the generation and development of innovations in concepts and doctrine for enhanced operational-level maritime capability and integration in joint and coalition activities.

About MCWL
MCWL generates and examines threat-informed, operating concepts and capabilities, and provides analytically supported recommendations to inform subsequent force design and development activities.

About NIWC Atlantic
As a part of Naval Information Warfare Systems Command, NIWC Atlantic provides systems engineering and acquisition to deliver information warfare capabilities to the naval, joint and national warfighter through the acquisition, development, integration, production, test, deployment, and sustainment of interoperable command, control, communications, computer, intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance, cyber and information technology capabilities.

About NSWC Crane
NSWC Crane is a naval laboratory and a field activity of Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA) with mission areas in Expeditionary Warfare, Strategic Missions and Electronic Warfare. The warfare center is responsible for multi-domain, multi- spectral, full life cycle support of technologies and systems enhancing capability to today's Warfighter.
column9: 美国
column10: NIWC Atlantic在尼斯安特斯推进新技术
column11: 北卡罗来纳州勒琼营――4月14日，大西洋海军信息战中心（NIWC）在北卡罗来纳州勒琼营结束了一次军民联合演习，海军和海军陆战队对60多项新兴技术进行了评估，以供未来作战人员使用。NIWC大西洋与海军水面战中心起重机师、海军作战发展司令部（NWDC）和海军陆战队作战实验室（MCWL）合作，率先规划和实施为期10天的“竞争环境中的海军集成”（NICE）高级海军技术演习（ANTX），海军迄今为止最大规模的ANTX活动之一。“看到我们的海军陆战队和海军、大小企业以及我们的政府作战中心在试验新技术和作战概念，在有争议的环境中为作战人员服务时，他们之间发生了巨大的合作，真是太棒了。”现任海军副部长的尊敬的詹姆斯・格尔斯说。“使我们的运营商能够就这些技术提供坦率和即时的反馈，确保我们在共同打造未来竞争环境中竞争和取胜所需的设备时，充分利用他们的宝贵视角和经验。”ANTX在运营相关环境中展示了新兴技术。随着NICE ANTX将重点放在海军集成上，技术所有者知道他们的产品将通过远征先进基地作战（EABO）和分布式海上作战（DMO）等海战概念进行评判。每种原型技术都分为六个能力领域之一：指挥与控制、通信、，领域机动、火力和效果、舰队支援和信息环境中的作战。海军领导人选择了大约65种技术，其中大多数来自私营行业。评估人员评估了每种能力，而观察员则设想了每种产品可用于的相关EABO/DMO场景。技术集中于射频波形、自主空中和海上车辆、先进传感器、光通信、网络安全应用和各种软件功能。马特・拉金特说：“这些评估帮助我们准确了解这些技术如何在作战环境中工作。”，NIWC大西洋工程师和NICE ANTX评估负责人。“这些信息对技术所有者也非常有用，因为有些产品可以改进，以帮助我们填补我们希望填补的能力缺口。”NIWC大西洋公司带来了自己的八项技术，在尼斯安特克斯进行了演示，包括机载替代卫星能力，旨在为作战人员提供后备通信。ANTX演习是海军和海军陆战队为建立实验文化而采取的几项积极措施之一，NIWC大西洋公司负责快速原型和舰队演习的高级科学技术经理Greg Hays表示，适应和冒险将有助于提高技术开发和采购的速度和灵活性。“我们为解决这些问题以及理解科学技术对未来战争的影响而感到自豪，”海斯说，他也是演习的参与者之一。“比我们的对手更快地将新技术集成到机队中，这将是实现技术优势和赢得信息战的关键。我们通过提供这些非常低的进入壁垒机会来实现这一目标，这些机会伴随着加速的合同选择，包括商业解决方案的开放。”美国最新的国防战略呼吁在日益复杂的全球安全环境中“不要自满”，这一环境的特点是迅速的技术变革和来自各个作战领域对手的挑战。该文件还指出，新的商业技术正在改变社会，最终将改变战争的性质。“需要整个团队共同努力才能保持我们的竞争优势，”Geurts强调。4月9日，Geurts与Eric Smith中将一道参观了Lejeune营地的技术领域，美国海军陆战队负责作战发展和整合的副司令，以及负责作战需求和能力（OPNAV N9）的海军作战（CNO）副司令詹姆斯・基尔比（James Kilby）副上将。在这次演习中，驻扎在勒琼营的第二海军陆战队远征军（II MEF）成员主持了ANTX足迹，并支持现场后勤。来自II MEF、MCWL和其他组织的海军陆战队包括160名技术评估员，以及创纪录的24名海军陆战队士兵和大约60名国防部平民。军装评估员的背景从步兵和炮兵到通信和导航。一名参加演习的MCWL海军陆战队士兵说，ANTX对军方和私营部门来说都是一个双赢的方案。“它将这些技术带到我们面前，不仅仅是看到可能的领域，”参谋长Joshua Crabb说，MCWL指挥官兼NICE ANTX主管本杰明・沃森准将（Brig.Gen.Benjamin Watson）称，此次演习是解决棘手战术和作战问题的绝佳机会。沃森在4月14日访问勒琼营地时说：“ANTX的一个独特之处是战士的整合。”。“ANTX不仅仅是一个供创新者展示其产品的技术展览会，它使我们的行业合作伙伴能够将他们的技术插入到特定的任务线程中。它不仅展示了该技术的能力，还展示了该技术的相关性。”NICE ANTX的NIWC Atlantic执行主管Dana Rushing表示，这项由许多活动部件、多个主要利益相关者和行业组成的复杂演习循环了多达800名参与者。“从开始到结束，今年的ANTX取得了重大成功，”Rushing说。“看到NIWC大西洋公司的工程师和私营科技公司在整个过程中进行合作，特别是值得的。这加上海军和海军陆战队的直接反馈，使得类似这样的活动对作战人员的未来非常宝贵。”尼斯蚂蚁在开阔的场地进行，并遵循严格的协议，以尽量减少接触新冠病毒-19。NIWC大西洋指挥官韦斯利・桑德斯上尉说，到户外看看团队的劳动成果感觉很好。“尼斯蚂蚁是一次巨大的提升，经过了数月的准备，对作战人员来说意义重大。”桑德斯说：“我为团队中所有帮助今年演习取得成功的人感到骄傲。”NIWC大西洋执行董事彼得・C・雷迪附和了指挥官的话。“我不仅仅为NIWC大西洋团队感到骄傲，”雷迪说，“但对于我们的工程师和科学家来说，他们正在接受来自海军陆战队和海军陆战队的实时反馈，这让他们感到兴奋。当他们回到实验室时，结合作战人员对这些技术的想法和观点，将使我们的工作更有目的性和意义。这也意味着这些能力可以总有一天会落到我们战士的手里。”关于NWDCNWDC，NWDC致力于概念和理论创新的产生和发展，以增强作战水平的海上能力，并整合联合和联盟活动。关于MCWLMCWL，产生和检查已知威胁的作战概念和能力，并向信息部提供分析支持的建议rm后续部队设计和开发活动。关于NIWC Atlantic作为海军信息战系统司令部的一部分，NIWC Atlantic提供系统工程和采办，通过采办、开发、集成、生产、测试和depl向海军、联合和国家作战人员提供信息战能力可互操作的指挥、控制、通信、计算机、情报、监视和侦察、网络和信息技术能力的维护和维持。关于NSWC CraneNSWC Crane是海军实验室，也是海军海洋系统司令部（NAVSEA）的现场活动在远征战、战略任务和电子战中设有任务区。作战中心负责技术和系统的多领域、多光谱、全生命周期支持，以增强当今作战人员的能力。

column2: CCAD inducts new helicopter model, begins modification on new cockpit
column3:
CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas -- In keeping with current technological advancements, a Corpus Christi Army Depot Induction ceremony was held to mark the beginning of the newest upgrade to the UH-60 Black Hawk Helicopter, here, January 9, 2019.
	The U.S. Army has utilized the Black Hawk since the 1970s. They are offered in multiple airframe configurations, including the Alpha, Lima, Mike and Victor models, all used to provide air assault, general support, aeromedical evacuation, command and control, and special operations support to combat, stability and support operations.
	Induction C beginning the modernization process C of the Lima-model helicopters is twofold: To introduce an affordable and relevant technological upgrade and improve the aviation community’s requirements for such a helicopter, said Jackie Allen, industrial engineer, CCAD.
	CCAD will begin the nine-step recapitalization process on a Black Hawk immediately following the ceremony, with six more to follow this fiscal year, said Allen. The final end state scheduled for CCAD is 760 converted Victor-model Black Hawks. 
Specifics to the modification are focused on the cockpit and the electronic components within, said Don Dawson, director of aircraft production, CCAD. 
“(Lima models) have an old analog dial instrumentation,” said Dawson. “What this (upgrade) does is gives (the Victor model) a full glass cockpit,” which is similar to the Mike model. 
	A glass cockpit is a digital suite that streamlines an enhanced management system allowing for better Pilot-Vehicle Interface or PVI, added Allen.
	Many advantages to a better PVI, includes using a moving map, enhanced messaging between the pilots and commands, and the best navigation system available, which is part of an open system architecture, said Lt. Col. Andrew Duus, product manager, Program Executive Office, Aviation, Redstone Arsenal, Alabama. 
	“The open system architecture will significantly minimize the time getting new technology uploaded into the aircraft,” said Duus.
The upgrade goes further than an infrastructure to improving pilot interaction and training efforts.
	Dawson said, the upgrade will “help the pilots with all the information flow coming to them… it synergizes the information and gives it to them in bite-size pieces.”
	Additionally, the upgrade will help in the training of pilots as most are learning on Mike models that are already equipped with the digital cockpit.
	“(The upgrade) will speed up the cost of training for new pilots, because they now can learn, essentially, one cockpit instead of two,” added Dawson. 
	CCAD is prepared for this project, which is considered a “significant responsibility” given the depot’s position to produce such a “phenomenal helicopter for our (Army),” said Col. Gail Atkins, commander, CCAD.
	Duus said he and PEO leadership is thankful for CCAD’s commitment to this project and are confident in the work they perform.
	“The legacy and trust that has been established by (CCAD) is what has got us here… I look forward to working with all of you and harness the value you provide, thank you again,” said Duus.
column9: 科珀斯克里斯蒂，德克萨斯州，美国
column10: CCAD引进新直升机型号，开始对新座舱进行改造
column11: 科珀斯克里斯蒂，得克萨斯州――为了配合当前的技术进步，科珀斯克里斯蒂陆军基地入职仪式于2019年1月9日在这里举行，以标志UH-60黑鹰直升机最新升级的开始。美国陆军自20世纪70年代以来一直使用黑鹰直升机。它们以多种机身配置提供，包括阿尔法、利马、迈克和维克托机型，所有这些机型都用于提供空中突击、一般支援、航空医疗后送、指挥和控制以及作战的特别行动支援，稳定和支持运行。工业工程师Jackie Allen说，利马型号直升机的入职培训――现代化进程的开始――有两个方面：引进负担得起的相关技术升级，提高航空界对此类直升机的要求，艾伦说，CCAD将在仪式结束后立即开始黑鹰式的九步资本重组过程，本财年还将有六步。CCAD计划的最终状态为760辆改装的维克多型号黑鹰。CCAD飞机生产总监唐・道森（Don Dawson）表示，改装的细节主要集中在驾驶舱和驾驶舱内的电子部件上。“利马型号）有一个旧的模拟拨号仪器，”道森说。“这（升级）所做的是给（维克托模型）一个全玻璃驾驶舱，”这与迈克模型类似。Allen补充道，玻璃驾驶舱是一个数字套件，它简化了增强的管理系统，允许更好的人机界面或PVI。更好的PVI有许多优点，包括使用移动地图，增强飞行员和指挥之间的信息传递，以及可用的最佳导航系统，这是开放系统架构的一部分，阿拉巴马州红石兵工厂航空项目执行办公室产品经理安德鲁・杜斯中校说。“开放式系统架构将大大减少将新技术上传到飞机上的时间，”Duus说。升级不仅仅是一个基础设施，还将进一步改善飞行员互动和培训工作。Dawson说，升级将“帮助飞行员获得所有的信息流……它将信息协同起来，并以微小的碎片形式提供给他们。”此外，升级将有助于飞行员的培训，因为大多数飞行员都在学习已经装备了数字驾驶舱的麦克型号。”（升级）这将加快新飞行员的培训成本，因为他们现在基本上可以学习一个驾驶舱而不是两个，”道森补充道。CCAD为这个项目做好了准备，考虑到基地生产这种“为我们（军队）制造的非凡直升机”的地位，这被认为是一项“重大责任”杜斯说，他和PEO领导层感谢CCAD对该项目的承诺，并对他们所做的工作充满信心。“CCAD所建立的遗产和信任使我们走到了这里……我期待着与你们所有人合作，利用你们提供的价值，再次感谢你们。”杜斯说。

column2: CCDC’s Road Map to Modernizing the Army- Soldier lethality
column3:
